Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.12%  lower. The  Hang  Seng  Index  lost  31.18  points  to  close  at  25,057.99  points  on  Monday.

Experts:  US'  HK  legislation  meddles  in  China's  affairs. The  signing  of  the  so-called  "Hong  Kong  Autonomy  Act"  into  law  by  the  US  interferes  in  China's  internal    affairs  and  violates  international  law,  experts  said.

​Hong  Kong  sets  daily  record  in  virus  cases. Hong  Kong  reported  its  all-time  daily  high  of  108  coronavirus  cases  on  Sunday,  pushing  the  city's  infection  tally  to  1,885,  with  12  related  fatalities.

HK  cooperates  with  mainland    against  ‘hypocritical’  US  acts. The  HKSAR  govt  will  fully  cooperate  with  the  central  govt  to  counter  the  United  States'  attempt  at  hegemony,  Matthew  Cheung  said  Sunday.
Hong  Kong  tightens  coronavirus  restrictions  as  new  cases  spike. Hong  Kong's  civil  servants  will  resume  work-from-home  from  Monday  amid  worsening  COVID-19  pandemic  in  the  city.

US'  HK-related  legislation  'violates  international  law'. Experts  worldwide  said  that  the  signing  of  the  so-called  "Hong  Kong  Autonomy  Act"  into  law  by  the  US  is  detrimental  to  global  peace  and  stability.

Financial  chief:  Security  law  won't  affect  HK  markets. Paul  Chan  said  Hong  Kong's  financial  markets  had  continued  to  operate  in  a  stable  and  orderly  manner  since  the  National  Security  Law  took  effect.

HK  gives  conditional  nod  to  COVID-19  drug  remdesivir. Gilead  Sciences  medicine  remdesivir  has  received  a  conditional  green  light  to  be  used  to  curb  the  coronavirus  pandemic,  Hong  Kong  officials  said.

LegCo  president:  Foul  acts  by  rowdy  lawmakers  at  record  high. Andrew  Leung  Kwan-yuen  urged  future  LegCo  members  to  understand  that  serving  the  people  of  Hong  Kong  remains  their  primary  objective.
A  ‘pragmatic’  security  law  to  safeguard  HK. Veteran  legal  expert  Richard  Cullen  said  he  is  confident  that  the  law  will  help  Hong  Kong  move  forward  more  smoothly.

Internal  struggles,  radicalism  exhausting  HK:  Finance  Committee  head. Chan  Kin-por  said  Hong  Kong  is  being  dragged  into  an  era  of  internal  friction  caused  by  extremists  and  those  advocating  mutual  destruction.

Business  sector:  US  move  won't  harm  HK's  long-term  prospects. The  Chinese  General  Chamber  of  Commerce  in  HK  said  the  US  'sanctions'  will  undermine  the  trade  ties  between  HK  &  US  and  business  interests  of  both.

Cathay  projects  HK$9.9b  net  loss  in  first  half  of  2020. Cathay  said  the  loss  includes  impairment  charges  of  HK$2.4  billion,  which  mainly  relate  to  16  aircraft  and  certain  airline  service  subsidiaries’  assets.

Trump's  HK  action  will  hurt  US  businesses,  AmCham  says. Trump's  move  to  end  HK's  special  status  under  US  law  will  hurt  the  country's  business  interests,  said  the  American  Chamber  of  Commerce's  local  branch.

HK  sees  58  new  virus  cases,  11th  death  as  71-year-old  patient  dies. Including  imported  cases,  the  number  of  new  cases  in  the  past  24  hours  was  58,  taking  the  tally  since  late-January  to  1,713  patients,  10  of  whom  have  died.

Another  5  billion  yuan  ‘dim  sum’  bonds  for  Hong  Kong. The  Chinese  Ministry  of  Finance  is  to  issue  yuan-denominated  treasury  bonds  worth  5  billion  yuan  (US$714.3  million)  in  Hong  Kong  next  Thursday.

Shenzhen  requires  virus  test  certificate  of  travelers  from  HK. The  announcement  said  the  certificate  should  be  issued  by  qualified  testing  institutes  certified  by  the  HKSAR  within  72  hours  of  port  entry.

Expert:  Joint  Declaration  not  binding  on  security  law. Legal  expert  Richard  Cullen  said  the  1984  declaration  has  no  binding  effect  on  the  new  law  as  it  is  not  a  foundation  of  HK's  constitutional  structure.

Established  framework  to  safeguard  national  security  in  HK. The  National  Security  Law  for  the  HKSAR  took  effect  on  June  30.  China  Daily  takes  a  look  at  the  structural  framework  established  in  accordance  with  stipulations  of  the  law.

‘Romantic  heroine’  on  a  patriotic  mission. HK  entrepreneur  Annie  Wu  Suk-ching,  named  recently  as  one  of  China’s  ‘most  inspiring  people  of  the  year’,  has  taken  the  city’s  youths  to  task.

Trump  order  'impact  limited'  as  HKSAR  reverts  to  China  tariffs. Trump's  order  issued  late  on  Tuesday  in  Washington  does  not  explicitly  mention  tariffs  nor  Hong  Kong's  separate  customs  status.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.47%  higher. The  benchmark  Hang  Seng  Index  traded  between  25,015.28  and  25,263.97.  Turnover  totaled  HK$129.53  billion  (about  US$16.71  billion).

Election  watchdog:  LegCo  poll  nominations  to  start. The  nomination  period  for  the  2020  Legislative  Council  General  Election  will  start  on  Saturday  and  run  until  July  31,  the  Election  Affairs  Commission  said.

Greater  Bay  Area  airport  cluster  targeted  for  2025. China  will  complete  the  construction  of  a  world-class  cluster  of  airports  in  the  Guangdong-Hong  Kong-Macao  Greater  Bay  Area  by  2025  with  greatly  enhanced  connectivity  and  convenience.

HK  said  to  give  nod  to  Asia's  biggest  healthcare  listing  in  2020. Hangzhou  Tigermed  Consulting  Co  has  won  approval  from  the  HK  stock  exchange  for  its  second  listing  which  could  raise  about  US$1  billion.
A  wider  net  for  high-net-worth  club. The  People's  Bank  of  China,  the  HKMA  and  the  Monetary  Authority  of  Macao,  injected  fresh  impetus  into  the  operations  of  the  mega  GBA.

Everything  goes  tech,  ‘pro-tech’  yourself. ​With  social  distancing  and  health  protection  evolving  into  the  order  of  the  day  amid  the  COVID-19  shock,  virtual  insurance  has  gained  momentum  in  HK.

US  hurts  only  itself  with  politically  motivated  sanctions:  Trade  expert. The  comments  came  after  US  President  Donald  Trump  signed  an  executive  order  on  Tuesday  that  ends  Hong  Kong’s  special  trade  status.

US  clings  to  'Cold  War  mentality'  against  China,  geopolitical  scholar  says. Fabio  Massimo  Parenti  says  the  US’  “Cold  War  mentality”  can  be  explained  in  documents  by  the  CIA  that  outlined  measures  to  block  China’s  development.
US'  hegemonic  policy  to  'backfire’. US  sanctions  are  destined  to  fail  and  will  ultimately  hurt  itself,  city  leaders  say.

HK  sees  record  daily  spike  of  67  virus  cases  in  swelling  wave. Hong  Kong  reported  on  Thursday  67  confirmed  coronavirus  cases,  its  largest  daily  spike  in  new  infections  since  the  outbreak  started  in  the  city  in  January.

Singapore  downplays  fund  outflows  from  Hong  Kong. HK  remains  a  "formidable"  financial  center  despite  inquiries  from  businesses  looking  to  come  to  Singapore  picked  up,  said  Monetary  Authority  of  Singapore.

Virus  cases  with  unknown  origins  add  to  containment  difficulty. As  countries  and  regions  struggle  with  resurgences  of  the  virus,  one  data  point  is  steering  government  responses:  the  share  of  cases  with  no  known  origins.

US  interference  in  HK  affairs  strongly  condemned. The  so-called  "Hong  Kong  Autonomy  Act"  signed  into  law  in  the  US  to  interfere  in  Hong  Kong  affairs  has  drawn  strong  opposition  from  various  sectors.
HK  to  play  bigger  role  as  a  link  amid  geopolitical  changes. Charles  Li  says  'one  country,  two  systems'  still  offers  the  Chinese  mainland  and  the  US  the  best  way  forward.

Understanding  National  Secrutiy  Law:  HK's  status  as  financial  hub. As  the  National  Security  Law  for  Hong  Kong  has  taken  effect,  one  of  the  most  concerning  issues  for  some  residents  is  whether  it  will  undermine  its  status  as  an  international  financial  center.

HKSAR  govt  strongly  opposes  US'  HK-related  legislation. The  US  move  seriously  violates  international  law  and  constitutes  gross  interference  in  HK  affairs  and  China's  internal  affairs,  a  spokesman  said.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  2.00%  lower. The  benchmark  Hang  Seng  Index  traded  between  24,919.95  and  25,576.49.  Turnover  totaled  HK$199.79  billion  (about  US$25.78  billion).

China  to  take  countermeasures  against  US  over  HK-related  act. The  Hong  Kong  and  Macao  Affairs  Office  strongly  condemned  the  signing  of  the  so-called  "Hong  Kong  Autonomy  Act"  into  law  by  the  United  States.

HK  CE  vows  to  end  chaos,  restore  order. The  Chief  Executive  vowed  to    lead  the  financial  hub  to  rally  its  strengths  and  efforts  for  recovery  after  a  turbulent  year  of  violence  and  unrest.

Liaison  office  condemns  US  ‘HK  act’. The  US  insisted  on  passing  the  act  in  total  disregard  for  the  common  will  of  the  people  of  Hong  Kong  and  their  mainland  compatriots,  liaison  office  said.

HK  activist’s  attempt  to  exploit  the  election  slammed. City  leaders  said  Tai  was  attempting  to  use  the  LegCo  election  to  coerce  the  central  government  into  acceding  to  the  opposition  camp’s  demands.

Major  spike  in  new  COVID-19  cases  recorded  in  SAR. Hong  Kong  reported  19  confirmed  coronavirus  cases  and  37  preliminary  cases  likely  to  be  confirmed  pending  further  tests  on  Wednesday.

FSDC  says  HK’s  financial  hub  status  remains  intact. FSDC  chairman  Laurence  Li  Lu-jen  said  on  Wednesday  that  Hong  Kong,  as  a  bridge  between  China  and  the  West,  will  have  to  weather  stronger  headwinds.

COVID-19:  Visitors  to  HK  down  90%  in  first  half  of  2020. HK  received  about  14,600  visitors  in  June,  representing  a  daily  average  of  about  500,  a  99.7  percent  drop  from  the  same  time  last  year,  the  HKTB  said.

HK  sees  19  new  virus  cases,  10th  death  as  2  more  patients  die. Hong  Kong  reported  19  new  coronavirus  cases  on  Wednesday,  including  14  that  were  locally  transmitted,  as  new  social  distancing  measures  came  into  force.

China  plans  Greater  Bay  Area  airport  cluster  by  2025. Efforts  will  be  made  to  enhance  HK's  status  as  an  international  aviation  hub,  according  to  the  plan  released  by  the    Civil  Aviation  Administration  of  China.

China  to  impose  sanctions  on  US  in  response  to  HK  legislation. China  said  that  it  will  impose  sanctions  on  relevant  US  personnel  and  entities,  urging  Washington  not  to  implement  the  so-called  Hong  Kong  Autonomy  Act.

Understanding  National  Security  Law  for  HK:  International  practice. Some  foreign  media  outlets  and  politicians  have  wagged  their  fingers  at  China  for  passing  a  national  security  law  for  the  HKSAR.  Is  it  in  line  with  international  practice?

HK  banks  urge  staff  to  work  at  home  as  virus  spikes. HK  detected  40  new  local  cases  on  Tuesday,  bringing  the  total  over  the  past  week  or  so  to  224  and  disrupting  moves  to  let  employees  resume  office  work.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.01%  higher. The  benchmark  Hang  Seng  Index  traded  between  25,299.36  and  25,888.78.  Turnover  totaled  HK$164.17  billion  (about  US$21.18  billion).

Law  helps  HK  recover  aspiration  of  'one  country,  two  systems’. The  National  Security  Law  has  shown  a  clear  deterrent  effect  on  "black  violence",  said  Maria  Tam  Wai-chu,  one  of  the  drafters  of  the  Basic  Law.

DAB  announces  55  candidates  for  ‘decisive’  LegCo  polls. Hong  Kong's  largest  political  party,  DAB,  called  the  September  Legislative  Council  election  a  “decisive  battle”  that  could  affect  Hong  Kong's  future.

COVID-19  cover-up  claims  are  dismissed    as  ‘unfounded’,  ‘hearsay’. Medical  experts  and  HKU  dismissed  claims  that  the  university  and  Beijing  withheld  key  information  about  the  epidemic.
Illicit  ‘primary  polls’  condemned. Legal  experts  say  opposition’s  ‘35-plus’  strategy  is  illegal,  unfair  and  wrong.

HK  elections  have  no    ‘primaries’:  Watchdog. Electoral  Affairs  Commission  spokesman  said  the  election  is  a  serious  matter  and  public  elections  must  always  be  held  in  an  open,  fair  and  honest  manner.

Shrinking  leasing  demand  weakens  Bay  Area  office  market. The  grade-A  offices  rent  index  in  the  Bay  Area  dropped  by  4.1  percent  to  159.7  in  the  first  half  year  compared  to  the  second  half  of  2019,  Savills  says.
HK  ‘primary’  might  have  violated  laws. Central  govt  office  says  it  undermined  electoral  system,  eroded  SAR’s  power.

HK  dollar  strength  on  inflows  shows  'security  law  effective'. The  financial  secretary  said  the  strong  inflow  speaks  volumes  about  how  the  passing  of  National  Security  Law  has  recreated  law  and  order  in  the  city.

Opposition  condemned  for  illegal  LegCo  'primaries'. The  Hong  Kong  and  Macao  Affairs  Office  and  the  liaison  office  condemned  the  so-called  "primaries"  recently  organized  by  the  opposition  camp.
Trump  aides  'rule  out  ending  Hong  Kong  dollar  peg'. China  repeatedly  accused  Washington  of  inappropriately  interfering  in  China’s  internal  affairs.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  1.14%  lower. The  benchmark  Hang  Seng  Index  traded  between  25,254.32  and  25,663.16.  Turnover  totaled  HK$178.95  billion  (about  US$23.09  billion).

HK  sees  48  new  COVID-19  cases,  40  locally  transmitted. HK  reported  48  new  COVID-19  infections​  of  which  40  locally  transmitted,  as  the  financial  hub  saw  a  resurgence  that  could  be  bigger  than  the  previous  waves.
Booklet  on  National  Security  Law  in  HKSAR  published. Booklets  on  the  National  Security  Law  in  the  HKSAR  are  now  available  at  Xinhua  Bookstore  outlets  across  China.

S.  Korea  looking  into  HK  hedge  fund  that  halted  withdrawals. Regulators  are  reviewing  the  suspension  of  client  redemptions  totaling  at  least    US$536  million  by  Gen2  Partners,  people  familiar  with  the  matter  said.

CE:  'Primary  election'  may  have  breached  National  Security  Law. Lam  said  the  event  might  have  constituted  subversion,  an  offense  among  the  four  categories  of  crimes  proscribed  by  the  new  security  law.

HKSAR  govt  to  probe  illegal  acts  in  opposition  camp's  'primaries'. The  HKSAR  govt  will  investigate  the  illegal  "primaries"  for  the  LegCo  elections  after  receiving  a  large  number  of  complaints  from  HK  residents.

HK  tightens  rules  after  8th  death,  52  new  COVID-19  cases. The  HKSAR  govt  brought  back  a  slew  of  restrictive  measures  Monday  after  the  city  recorded  52  new  cases,  including  41  that  were  locally  transmitted.
HK  National  Security  Law  does  not  restrict  freedoms:  Leung. Legislators  advised  to  fully  understand  law  and  be  careful  with  words,  deeds.

LegCo  chief  recalls  'roller  coaster'  4  years  at  helm. Legislative  Council  President  Andrew  Leung  Kwan-yuen  describes  the  past  four  years  at  the  helm  of  Hong  Kong’s  legislature  as  "a  roller  coaster  ride".

SAR  rolls  out  drastic  distancing  measures  amid  local  case  spike. The  Hong  Kong  government  drastically  tightened  up  its  social-distancing  measures  on  Monday,  while  expanding  virus  tests  to  vulnerable  groups.

Starry  Lee  regrets  LegCo  House  Committee  became  'battlefield'  in  political  drama. LegCo  House  Committee  Chairwoman  Starry  Lee  said  it  was  the  most  challenging  year  for  the  committee  as  its  work  was  stalled  for  seven  months.

HK  Book  Fair  postponed  amid  spike  in  virus  cases. The  Hong  Kong  Trade  Development  Council,  which  was  planning  to  hold  the  event  July  15  to  21,  said  the  fair  will  be  rescheduled  at  a  later,  unspecified  date.

Next  hearing  in  Jimmy  Lai  court  case  on  Sept  15. An  HK  court  adjourned  the  proceedings  against  Jimmy  Lai  Chee-ying  and  some  other  people  who  were  allegedly  involved  in  illegal  assemblies  to  Sept  15.

Opposition  accused  of  exaggerating  'primary'  turnout. The  opposition  camp  claimed  Monday  that  more  than  500,000  people  voted  in  the  primary  set  to  select  candidates  for  the  upcoming  LegCo  election.

Cheung:  New  civil  recruits  must  take  Basic  Law  pledge. Matthew  Cheung  said  in  his  blog  that  it  is  the  consistent  duty  of  civil  servants  to  uphold  the  HKSAR  Basic  Law  and  be  loyal  to  the  HKSAR  and  its  government.

Hong  Kong’s  dollar  suffers  sudden  bout  of  weakness. Late  on  Friday,  the  currency  weakened  rapidly  in  its  biggest  drop  since  mid-June.  The  decline  was  unexpected,  given  persistent  inflows  into  HK.

Mainland  A-share  market  firms  should  improve  ESG  reporting:  Experts. Zhang  Guanghua  said  there  is  a  growing  awareness  and  recognition  of  ESG  reporting  among  listed  companies  on  the  mainland.

HK  gets  down  to  the  business  of  advanced  air  quality  control. High-tech  firms  in  HK  are  racing  against  time  to  develop  sophisticated  air  quality  control  technologies  to  ease  the  city's  businesses  back  to  risk-free  office  work.

HK  opposition  seeks  ‘secession’. HK's  new  National  Security  Law  will  curb  secessionist  activity  by  the  local  opposition  camp,  former  Hong  Kong  chief  executive  Leung  Chun-ying  said.

HK  political  leaders  slam  opposition’s  weekend  ‘primary’. Hong  Kong  political  leaders  on  Sunday  slammed  a  so-called  Legislative  Council  primary  election  held  by  the  opposition  camp  over  the  weekend.

One  Country,  Two  Systems  alive  and  well  in  Hong  Kong,  says  former  CE  Leung. Contrary  to  what  Western  media  and  politicians  are  reporting,  the  National  Security  Law  for  Hong  Kong  does  not  “terminate”  the  “one  country,  two  systems”  principle,  said  Hong  Kong  former  chief  executive  Leung  Chun-ying.

HK  reports  38  new  COVID-19  cases,  30  locally  transmitted. Hong  Kong  reported  38  new  infections  of  the  coronavirus  on  Sunday,  of  which  30  were  locally  transmitted  cases,  the  city's  health  authorities  said.

HK  ex-lawmaker:  Opposition  camp's  'primary  election'  unfair. Wong  Kwok-hing  urged  authorities  to  follow  the  case  and  investigate  whether  the  acts  violated  the  Elections  Ordinance.

Hong  Kong  gets  zero  fee  trading  in  blow  to  struggling  brokers. As  of  last  month,  Huatai  International  is  no  longer  charging  commissions  and  platform  fees  for  stock  trades,  but  just  a  HK$8  monthly  fee.

HK  reports  28  new  COVID-19  cases,  16  locally  transmitted. An  acting  senior  immigration  assistant  stationed  at  the  Shenzhen  Bay  Control  Point  preliminarily  tested  positive,  said  the  Immigration  Department.

HK  representative  voices  support  for  new  law  at  UN  session. A  young  NGO  representative  from  Hong  Kong  condemned  the  violence  and  foreign  interference  in  the  SAR  during  a  session  of  the  UN  Human  Rights  Council.

Lam:  New  security  law  to  help  students  focus  on  studies  again. Carrie  Lam  said  the  SAR  government  will  cooperate  with  the  educational  sector  to  cultivate  a  sense  of  national  identity  in  students  and  the  younger  generation.
National  Security  Law  'frightens'  separatists. DAB  head  Starry  Lee  said  the  National  Security  Law  will  help  bring  back  peace  and  order  to  the  city.

Economist:  Mainland  business  to  secure  HK's  financial  hub  status. A  Hong  Kong  economist  is  optimistic  that  the  city  will  remain  a  global  financial  hub,  as  it  will  be  empowered  by  mainland  capital.

DAB  chief  :  Very  tough  campaign  in  LegCo  polls. Starry  Lee  Wai-king  believes  the  newly  enacted  National  Security  Law  can  help  restore  law  and  order  and  ensure  a  fair  election.

University  heads  urged  to  uphold  National  Security  Law  on  campus. Mervyn  Cheung  Man-ping  calls  on  universities  to  take  the  initiative  to  ensure  no  illegal  activities  on  campus  and  the  National  Security  Law  is  upheld.

Stanley  Ho's  funeral  held  in  HK. HK  and  Macao's  highest-profile  officials  and  business  people  paid  their  respects  on  Friday  to  late  casino  magnate  Stanley  Ho,  who  died  on  May  26  at  age  98.

HK  starts  summer  holiday  early  as  local  COVID-19  cases  surge. HK  schools  will  begin  summer  vacation  Monday  as  a  surge  in  COVID-19  cases  within  the  community  forces  the  city  to  revert  to  tighter  social  distancing  rules.
Protester  jailed  for  5  weeks  for  burning  national  flag. The  apprentice  barista  was  originally  sentenced  to  240  hours  of  community  service  for  burning  the  national  flag​.

HK  police  arrest  7  over  stabbing  of  officer  during  protest. Five  suspects  could  go  to  jail  for  10  years  for  "assisting"  Wong  Kwan-wa,  a  24-year-old  engineer,  on  July  2  on  suspicion  of  stabbing  and  wounding  an  officer.

Understanding  non-retroactivity  of  National  Security  Law  for  HKSAR. As  the  National  Security  Law  for  HK  takes  effect,  one  of  the  most  frequently  asked  questions  is  whether  the  law  will  apply  to  acts  that  happened  before  it  came  into  force.  Watch  the  video  to  find  out.

Hong  Kong  stocks  close  1.84%  lower. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  down  482.75  points,  or  1.84  percent,  to  25,727.41  points  on  Friday.


​
​

HK  businessman  helps  youth  kick  start  firms  on  mainland. 45-year-old  HK  businessman  Jack  Lam  has  offered  business  and  working  advice  to  people  from  HK  &  Macao  interested  in  living  in  the  mainland  since  2017.

Confucius  culture  influences  telecom  head's  worldview. Li  Feng,  chairman  of  China  Mobile  Hong  Kong,  believes  that  for  young  people  to  have  great  careers,  they  should  adopt  a  more  down-to-earth  attitude.

Luxury  labels  stand  their  ground. It  looked  like  a  "second  spring"  for  Hong  Kong's  high-fashion  avenue  after  news  about  high-end  French  house  raising  prices  on  some  of  its  brands  spread  around.
Judicial  independence  ‘intact’  under  new  law. Tong  Ka-wah  says  enough  safeguards  exist  in  the  security  law  to  ensure  presiding  judges  are  free  from  outside  interference.

Fledgling  5G  technology  promises  to  be  telecom  ‘game-changer’. ​Chairman  of  China  Mobile  Hong  Kong  predicts  faster  speeds  will  change  lives,  but  adapting  the  new  technology  will  take  time.

China  warns  against  Australian  meddling  in  HKSAR  affairs. China  warned  that  it  reserves  the  right  to  take  action  in  response  to  Australia's  announcement  to  extend  the  visas  of  Hong  Kong  people  in  the  country.

HK  LegCo  passes  bill  to  extend  maternity  leave  to  14  weeks. The  government  will  cover  the  paychecks  for  the  extended  leave  of  absence,  with  a  cap  of  HK$80,000  (US$10,300)  for  each  employee.

Australia  urged  to  stop  meddling  in  HKSAR  affairs. The  Chinese  Embassy  in  Australia  said  it  strongly  deplored  and  opposed  "groundless  accusations  and  measures"  by  Canberra  on  the  HKSAR.

Experts:  National  security  law  to  boost  good  governance  in  HK. Jurists  attending  a  symposium  held  by  China  Law  Society  said  the  new  law  has  offered  a  strong  legal  guarantee  for  the  SAR's  long-term  prosperity  and  stability.

Hong  Kong  dollar  peg  defense  tops  US$13b  as  demand  surges. Demand  for  Hong  Kong  dollars  is  intensifying,  with  Chinese  mainland  buying  helping  to  buoy  both  the  pegged  currency  and  local  stock  market.

HK  tightens  curbs  as  42  new  COVID-19  cases  reported. HK  reported  42  new  coronavirus  cases  Thursday,  of  which  34  locally  transmitted,  marking  the  second  consecutive  day  of  a  jump  in  local  infections.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.31%  higher. The  benchmark  Hang  Seng  Index  traded  between  26,016.75  and  26,374.94.  Turnover  totaled  HK$206.83  billion  (about  US$26.69  billion).​

Unknown  origin  of  HK's  rising  local  cases  sparks  resurgence  fears. Six  more  infections  were  detected  by  authorities  on  Wednesday  night,  reported  HK01  on  Thursday  morning,  suggesting  that  the  spread  is  continuing.

Civic  leaders  applaud  the  new  security  office. Civic  leaders  said  the  national  security  office​  set  up  in  HK  by  the  central  govt  will  fortify  the  city’s  defense  against  threats  to  national  security.

Poll:  66%  of  HK  residents  support  national  security  law. Nearly  80%  said  the  implementation  of  the  law  will  not  have  a  negative  impact  on  the  prospects  of  HK,  according  to  the  Hong  Kong  Research  Association  poll.

National  security  office  set  up  by  central  govt  inaugurated. Liaison  office  director  Luo  Huining  said  he  believes  the  office  will  serve  as  an  "envoy  of  Hong  Kong  security",  and  "a  gatekeeper  of  national  security".

Wong:  The  new  law  will  bring  back  safety,  peace  to  campus. College  students  who  fled  HK  last  year  while  fearing  for  their  safety  might  start  returning,  said  the  Open  University  of  Hong  Kong's  President  Wong  Yuk-shan.

Central  govt  opens  new  national  security  office. Political  leaders  and  legal  experts  said  Hong  Kong's  new  national  security  office  will  fortify  the  city's  defense  against  threats  to  national  security.

Oaths  for  HK  civil  servants  proposed. The  HK  government  proposed  requiring  people  joining  the  civil  service  to  take  oath  saying  they  will  uphold  the  Basic  Law  and  pledge  allegiance  to  the  SAR.

HK  resilient  markets  show  investors  have  little  to  worry. If  Hong  Kong's  markets  are  any  guide  to  its  future  as  an  international  financial  center,  then  the  city's  investors  have  little  to  worry  about.

Education  chief:  HK  kids  should  learn  without  interference. HK's  Secretary  for  Education  Kevin  Yeung  Yun-hung  reiterated  that  "no  political  propaganda  activities  should  be  allowed  in  schools".

National  security  office  set  up  by  central  govt  in  HK  inaugurated. According  to  the  national  security  law,  the  office  coordinates  with  and  supports  the  HKSAR  in  assuming  the  duties  for  safeguarding  national  security.

HK  needs  more  policies  to  help  improve  ESG  reporting. The  Financial  Services  Development  Council  released  two  reports,  one  on  ESG  and  the  other  on  developing  family  offices  in  the  city.

Govt  proposes  oaths  for  civil  servants. The  government  proposed  that  new  civil  servants  joining  the  service  after  July  1  should  declare  to  uphold  the  Basic  Law  and  pledge  allegiance  to  the  SAR.

Russia  firmly  backs  China  in  safeguarding  national  security. Russian  President  Vladimir  Putin  said  that  his  country  firmly  supports  China's  efforts  to  safeguard  national  security  in  the  HKSAR.

HK's  new  COVID-19  cases  jump  by  24,  19  locally  transmitted. The  financial  hub  also  reported  six  new  imported  cases.  The  total  number  of  COVID-19  cases  in  the  city  since  late  January  now  stands  at  1,323.

Fundraising  of  mainland  firms  on  HKEX  'up  37.1%  YoY  in  H1'. A  total  of  36  mainland  firms  debuted  on  the  HKEX  in  the  first  half  of  the  year,  the  Securities  Daily  reported  on  Wednesday,  quoting  data  from  Zero2IPO  Research.

Understanding  national  security  law  for  HK:  Rights  and  freedom. As  the  national  security  law  for  HK  has  taken  effect,  some  residents  in  the  city  are  concerned  about  whether  their  rights  and  freedom  will  be  undermined.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.59%  higher. The  benchmark  Hang  Seng  Index  traded  between  25,849.78  and  26,299.84.  Turnover  totaled  HK$196.19  billion  (about  US$25.31  billion).

Law  experts:  US  'sanctions'  over  national  security  law  futile. Chinese  law  experts  said  attempts  by  Western  countries  to  obstruct  the  implementation  of  the  law  in  the  HKSAR  by  malicious  "sanctions"  will  end  in  vain.

DPP's  plot  to  meddle  in  HK  affairs  slammed. A  Chinese  mainland  spokesperson  said  Taiwan's  Democratic  Progressive  Party  has  once  again  exposed  its  evil  intentions  to  interfere  in  HK  affairs.

Full  text:  Luo  speech  at  national  security  office  inauguration. Liaison  office  director  Luo  Huining  delivered  a  speech  at  the  opening  ceremony  of  the  national  security  office  in  Hong  Kong  on  Wednesday.

Envoy  slams  UK  coverage  of  security  law. China's  UK  envoy  said  local  media's  reports  on  the  new  security  law  are  "full  of  misinterpretation,  misunderstanding,  and  even  distortion".

Lam  says  market  shows  confidence  in  legislation. Carrie  Lam  said  the  market  is  a  strong  rebuttal  to  allegations  that  the  law  signifies  the  death  of  "one  country,  two  systems"  and  is  putting  HK  in  jeopardy.

New  law  for  HK  seen  as  better  serving  prosperity. The  national  security  law  doesn't  affect  any  lawful  interests  of  HK  citizens  or  foreign  institutions  and  personnel  in  HK,  a  Foreign  Ministry  spokesman  said.
West  ‘dreads    losing  spying  toehold’  in  HK. Executive  councilor  Wong  Kwok-kin  said  the  national  security  law  for  HK  was  a  response  to  growing  chaos  in  the  city.

Security  law  to  create  ‘fair  environment’  for  LegCo  election. Ip  Kwok-him  said  he  believed  residents  will  be  protected  from  fear  and  threats  of  violence  and  they  can  cast  their  ballots  according  to  their  own  will.

Wong:  LegCo  election  to  be  ‘life  and  death’  battle  between  rival  camps. Wong  Kwok-kin  predicts  a  very  intense,  tough  competition  between  the  pro-establishment  and  ‘‘pan-democratic’’  camps  in  the  election.

LegCo  to  file  bankruptcy  petition  against  ousted  lawmaker. LegCo  plans  to  institute  a  bankruptcy  petition  in  court  against  Sixtus  Leung  Chung-hang  to  recover  debts  of  HK$930,000  he  owes  the  legislature.

CE:  Implementation  rules  of  new  law  won't  expand  police  power. Carrie  Lam's  statement  came  a  day  after  the  govt  gazetted  the  Implementation  Rules  for  Article  43  of  the  national  security  law  for  Hong  Kong.

HK  'facing  community  outbreak'  as  local  COVID-19  cases  jump. HK  was  facing  another  community  outbreak  of  the  coronavirus  after  reporting  mostly  imported  infections  in  recent  months,  a  health  official  said.

Hong  Kong  stocks  close  1.38%  lower. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  down  363.50  points,  or  1.38  percent,  to  25,975.66  points  on  Tuesday.


​

Chinese  law  experts  stress  full  implementation  of  security  law. Strong  enforcement  mechanisms  should  be  set  up  to  ensure  the  implementation  of  the  national  security  law  for  HK,  the  experts  said  at  a  recent  symposium.

Commissioner's  office  refutes  US  diplomat's  claims  against  new  law. The  Commissioner's  Office  of  the  Chinese  Foreign  Ministry  in  the  HKSAR  firmly  opposed  the  accusations  of  the  US  consul-general  against  the  national  security  law.

China  warns  Canada  against  interference  in  HKSAR  affairs. China  warned  that  it  reserves  the  right  to  take  additional  action  in  response  to  a  package  of  measures  announced  by  Canada  to  interfere  in  Hong  Kong  affairs.

HK's  national  security  committee  convenes  first  meeting. All  the  members  of  the  committee  attended  the  meeting,  including  its  chair,  HKSAR  Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  Cheng  Yuet-ngor.

Legislation  conforms  to  global  norms. The  newly  enacted  National  Security  Law  for  HK,  which  includes  a  provision  on  offenses  outside  the  region,  conforms  to  international  laws,  experts  said.

HKSAR  national  security  committee  holds  1st  meeting. Ip  Kwok-him  said  the  enactment  of  the  law  will  help  ensure  that  the  upcoming  Legislative  Council  election  on  Sept  6  is  conducted  in  a  fair  and  safe  manner.

Full  text:  Implementation  rules  for  national  security  law  in  HK. ​Implementation  Rules  for  Article  43  of  the  Law  on  Safeguarding  National  Security  in  the  HKSAR  were  gazetted  on  July  6  and  will  take  effect  on  July  7.

National  security:  New  law  boosts  police  confidence. The  national  security  legislation  for  HK  provides  a  strong  legal  basis  for  the  police  force  to  effectively  tackle  crimes,  said  Commissioner  of  Police  Chris  Tang.

First  person  charged  under  new  HK  security  law  denied  bail. Tong  Ying-kit  was  charged  with  inciting  separatism  and  terrorism  after  he  carried  a  sign  saying  "Liberate  Hong  Kong"  and  drove  his  motorbike  into  police.

Finance  chief:  HK$40b  set  to  flow  into  HK  residents'  accounts. More  than  HK$40b  will  be  paid  into  the  bank  accounts  of  HK  residents  this  week,  confirmed  Financial  Secretary  Paul  Chan  Mo-po.

HK  stocks  enter  bull  market  after  US$1.1  trillion  rebound. Hong  Kong  stocks  joined  the  rest  of  the  world  in  bull  market  territory  after  a  more  than  US$1.1t  rebound  that's  gathered  steam  in  recent  days.

HKSAR  govt  firmly  rejects  remarks  by  US  consul-general. Chief  Secretary  for  Administration  Matthew  Cheung  Kin-chung,  joined  by  Secretary  for  Security  John  Lee,  met  with  US  Consul  General  Hanscom  Smith.

HK  sees  1  new  local  infection,  16  imported  COVID-19  cases. ​The  local  case  involved  a  30-year-old  male  who  is  the  colleague  of  a  59-year-old  male  restaurant  worker  earlier  diagnosed  with  COVID-19.

Illegal  assembly:  HK  activist  Anges  Chow  pleads  guilty. Agnes  Chow  Ting  pleaded  guilty  to  two  charges  of  incitement  and  taking  part  in  an  unlawful  assembly  outside  the  police  headquarters  in  June  last  year.

Scholar:  HK  residents'  rights  guaranteed  under  new  law. The  law  on  safeguarding  national  security  in  HK  guarantees,  rather  than  harms,  the  legitimate  rights  and  interests  of  HK  residents,  a  renowned  scholar  said.
HK  stock  market  climbs  to  four-month  high. The  market  closed  at  26,339  points,  with  the  gain  narrowed  to  3.8  percent.
HK’s  business  outlook  stabilized  in  June  as  virus  eases. The  IHS  Markit  purchasing  managers’  index  for  Hong  Kong  climbed  to  49.6  in  June,  the  highest  since  March  2018.

HK  govt  officials  pledge  full  support  for  national  security  law. Carrie  Lam  &  16  key  officials  published  articles  on  the  front  page  of  Wen  Wei  Po,  vowing  to  do  their  best  in  supporting  the  implementation  of  the  law.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  3.81%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  966.04  points,  or  3.81  percent,  to  26,339.16  points  on  Monday.

Scholar:  New  law  protects  HK  residents'  freedom  from  fear. The  new  law  targets  a  tiny  number  of  people  endangering  national  security  while  protecting  the  freedoms  of  the  general  public,  a  HK  scholar  said.

Lee:  Money  pouring  into  HK  puts  lie  to  naysayers’  predictions. ​Vincent  Lee  Kwan-ho,  a  HK  deputy  to  the  NPC,  rejected  claims  that  the  new  law  would  undermine  Hong  Kong’s  position  as  a  global  financial  hub.

HKSAR  sets  up  conferences  to  explain  National  Security  Law. ​Matthew  Cheung  Kin-chung  wrote  in  his  blog  that  the  principal  officials  involved  will  hold  a  joint  conference  at  the  city's  legislature  Tuesday  to  explain  the  law.
New  legislation  requires  HK-Beijing  cooperation. Maria  Tam  Wai-chu  said  the  HKSAR  doesn't  have  the  experience  necessary  for  dealing  with  security  and  intelligence  matters.

National  security  law  for  HK  should  be  enforced  according  to  common  law,  expert  says. The  national  security  law  for  Hong  Kong  should  be  implemented  using  common  law  traditions    —  court  decisions  based  on  prior  judicial  pronouncements.

National  security:  'Civil  servants  should  fully  support  govt'. Matthew  Cheung  slammed  Western  politicians’  sanctions  threats  as  blatant  interference  in  HKSAR  and  China's  internal  affairs.

Foreign  businesses  welcome  to  continue  operating  in  HK. The  response  came  after  the  American  Chamber  of  Commerce  in  HK  said  it  remains  "committed  to  the  SAR  as  a  home  base  for  international  business."

Top  legislature  'can  make  more  laws'  on  national  security  for  HK. Deng  Zhonghua,  deputy  director  of  the  Hong  Kong  and  Macao  Affairs  Office  of  the  State  Council,  made  the  remarks  on  CCTV  on  Friday.

China's  US  envoy  shares  '1  to  9'  facts  on  national  security  law. Chinese  envoy  to  the  US  Cui  Tiankai  shared  basic  facts  and  his  viewpoints  on  the  newly  enacted  national  security  law  for  HK  by  using  the  numbers  "1  to  9."

National  security  law  requires  better  understanding. A  senior  legislator  called  for  legal  professionals  across  the  country  to  closely  study  and  accurately  interpret  the  newly  adopted  national  security  law  for  Hong  Kong.

Canada  urged  to  stop  interfering  in  China's  internal  affairs. A  spokesperson  for  the  Chinese  embassy  in  Canada  urged  the  Canadian  side  to  view  the  national  security  law  for  Hong  Kong  in  a  fair,  objective  manner.

HK  officials  hit  out  at  Canada  suspension  of  extradition  treaty. Senior  officials  of  the  HKSAR  govt  criticized  Canada  for  putting  politics  above  the  rule  of  law  by  suspending  an  extradition  treaty  with  the  financial  hub.
Beverage  firm  Wahaha  said  to  mull  IPO  worth  over  US$1  billion. A  listing  could  come  as  soon  as  next  year,  people  familiar  with  the  matter  said.

Senior  official  stresses  effective  implementation  of  new  law. Wang  Chen,  a  member  of  the  Political  Bureau  of  the  CPC  Central  Committee,  made  the  remarks  at  a  symposium  on  studying  the  national  security  law.

Author  slams  West's  'colonial'  mindset. The  reaction  of  Western  countries  against  China's  enactment  of  its  national  security  law  in  the  HKSAR  is  riddled  with  hypocrisy,  said  Martin  Jacques.
First  suspect  charged  under  security  law. A  23-year-old  man  was  charged  on  Friday  with  terrorism  and  inciting  secession.

Wu:  New  law  promises  a  safe  and  stable  HKSAR. HK  businesswoman  Annie  Wu  Suk-ching  said  the  enactment  of  the  national  security  law  will  ensure  the  stable  and  peaceful  business  environment.

Shouting  'Liberate  Hong  Kong'  could  land  you  in  hot  water. Political  and  business  leaders  support  SAR  govt's  stand  that  a  cry  connotes  separatism  or  subversion  proscribed  by  the  national  security  law  now  in  force.

Key  officials  of  HK's  national  security  committee,  office  named. Luo  Huining  has  been  appointed  HK's    national  security  adviser  while  Zheng  Yanxiong  has  been  named  head  of  HKSAR's  national  security  office.

HKSAR  govt  strongly  opposes  passage  of  HK-related  act  in  US. A  spokesman  for  the  HKSAR  government  urged  the  US  Congress  to  immediately  stop  interfering  in  HKSAR's  internal  matters.

HK  sees  5  new  COVID-19  cases,  tally  at  1,247. The  newly-reported  cases  involve  one  male  and  four  females  aged  between  three  and  49.  All  patients  had  a  travel  history  during  the  incubation  period.

Rumors  about  national  security  law  for  HKSAR,  debunked. Some  US  &  Western  politicians  have  recently  made  false  accusations  against  the  law  on  safeguarding  national  security  in  the  HKSAR.

Suspect  charged  with  stabbing  police  officer  during  illegal  protest. A  24-year-old  man  appeared  in  court  on  Friday  after  he  allegedly  stabbed  a  police  officer  during  Wednesday's  illegal  protest  in  Causeway  Bay.
23-year-old  man  first  in  HK  to  be  charged  invoking  new  law. The  man  allegedly  drove  his  motorcycle  into  police  officers  on  July  1  during  protests.
City  leaders  confident  in  HK’s  can-do  spirit. Experts  from  business  and  academia  say  that  despite  unprecedented  challenges,  the  SAR  always  rebounds.
HK  set  for  new  heights  as  Bay  Area  revs  up. Region’s  mega  development  plan  promises  to  lift  SAR’s  financial  status,  creating  vast  career  avenues  for  young.
HKSAR  govt  bans  'Liberate  Hong  Kong'  slogan. The  govt  said  earlier  on  Thursday  that  banners  and  chants  calling  for  “Hong  Kong  independence”  were  also  illegal.

HK  establishes  committee  for  safeguarding  national  security. Edwina  Lau  Chi-wai  was  appointed  as  the  deputy  commissioner  of  the  Hong  Kong  Police  Force  to  lead  a  department  that  is  dealing  with  national  security  cases.

Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.99%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  248.93  points,  or  0.99  percent,  to  25,373.12  points  on  Friday.



​

Three  things  to  know  about  HK's  new  national  security  committee. Establishing  the  committee  is  a  vital  and  imperative  move  to  tackle  realistic  issues  as  the  SAR  was  in  a  de  facto  'defenseless'  status  regarding  national  security.

HK  legal  sector:  Law  protects  people's  rights. HK's  prominent  legal  groups  and  practitioners  said  the  newly  enacted  national  security​  law  applies  only  to  a  very  small  number  of  criminals.

HSBC  pledges  more  investments  in  the  mainland. The  bank  on  Friday  announced  it  was  starting  a  new  service  to  provide  customers  in  the  mainland  with  digital  wealth  and  insurance  planning  services.

Asia  share  sales  double  in  Q2  amid  retreat  from  US. Firms  raised  US$48.2b  via  follow-on  offerings  in  the  three  months  through  June,  a  127  percent  jump  from  the  same  period  last  year.

Experts:  Law  allots  roles  in  HK  properly. Experts  said  there's  no  need  to  worry  that  Hong  Kong's  judicial  autonomy  or  human  rights  will  be  threatened  now  that  the  new  law  has  taken  effect.

Russia  backs  law  as  aiding  HK  stability. China's  adoption  of  a  national  security  law  for  HK  is  a  necessary  move  by  the  central  govt  to  maintain  regional  safety  and  stability,  Russian  officials  said.

All  the  green,  green  grass  of  home. In  the  23  years  since  HK’s  return  to  the  nation,  the  opportunities  up  for  grabs  for  the  city’s  budding  entrepreneurs  have  never  been  more  distinct.

US  bill  on  HKSAR  condemned. ​​The  Foreign  Affairs  Committee  of  the  NPC  said  the  passage  of  the  so-called  "Hong  Kong  Autonomy  Act"  was  a  serious  violation  of  international  law.

Separatists  urged  to  turn  over  a  new  leaf. Tam  said  the  implementation  of  the  security  law  will  fend  off  separatism  as  well  as  external  and  foreign  forces  that  endanger  national  security.

Security  law  takes  precedence  over  other  local  laws. The  national  security  law  for  HKSAR  takes  precedence  over  other  local  Hong  Kong  laws,  says  Basic  Law  Committee  Deputy  Director  Maria  Tam  Wai-chu.

Appointment  of  security  judges  'free  of  politics'. The  Hong  Kong  chief  executive  shall  designate  a  group  of  judges  from  each  level  of  court  to  handle  cases  and  appeals  in  relation  to  the  new  law.

1.65m  HK  people  sign  petition  against  foreign  meddling. Over  1.65  million  Hong  Kong  residents  signed  an  online  petition  against  foreign  interference  led  by  the  US  in  national  security  legislation  for  the  SAR.

Envoy:  National  security  law  timely,  necessary. Chinese  Ambassador  to  Britain  Liu  Xiaoming  said  recent  remarks  by  the  UK  on  the  national  security  law  for  HK  are  irresponsible  and  unwarranted.

China  opposes  UK  citizenship  offer  to  HKSAR  residents. A  spokesperson  for  the  Chinese  Embassy  in  Britain  said  the  move  breaches  international  law  and  basic  norms  governing  international  relations.

HK  police  arrest  suspect  at  airport  after  assault  on  officer. Police  arrested  a  24-year-old  man  at  the  HK  airport  on  suspicion  of  attacking  and  wounding  an  officer  during  anti-government  protests  on  Wednesday.
Eric  Chan  named  HK's  national  security  secretary. The  appointment  of  Eric  Chan  Kwok-ki  by  the  State  Council  came  upon  the  nomination  by  Hong  Kong  Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam.

HK  sees  9  new  COVID-19  cases,  tally  at  1,242. The  new  cases  involved  three  males  and  six  females  aged  between  two  and  40.  All  patients  had  a  travel  history  during  the  incubation  period.

Mainland  tech  tycoons  flood  HK  with  US$20b  of  stock  listings. William  Ding  of  NetEase  and  JD.com's  Richard  Liu  are  among  the  Chinese  mainland  tycoons  who  are  flooding  HK's  exchange  new  listings.

Hong  Kong  stocks  close  2.85%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  697.00  points,  or  2.85  percent,  to  25,124.19  points  on  Thursday.


​
​

HK  govt  condemns  violence,  supports  police  law  enforcement. ​Hong  Kong  police  arrested  around  370  people  Wednesday,  including  ten  on  suspicion  of  violating  the  newly  enacted  national  security  law  for  Hong  Kong.

Au  Ka-wang  appointed  as  HK  immigration  director. Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  said  Au  has  served  in  the  Immigration  Department  for  more  than  30  years  and  has  extensive  experience  in  departmental  operations.

PLA  HK  garrison  firmly  backs  implementation  of  security  law. Members  of  the  PLA  garrison  in  Hong  Kong  will  resolutely  carry  out  the  decisions  and  plans  by  the  central  authorities,  according  to  a  statement.

53  nations  join  to  welcome  national  security  law  for  HK. The  countries  said  in  a  joint  statement  that  the  new  legislation  will  provide  a  better  guarantee  for  "one  country,  two  systems".

Legislation  a  'turning  point',  Lam  says. Hong  Kong  Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  made  the  remarks  at  a  reception  commemorating  the  23rd  anniversary  of  HK's  return  to  the  motherland.
Security  law  guardian  of  HK  prosperity. The  formulation  of  the  law  shows  that  the  central  government  attaches  great  importance  to  targeting  the  root  causes  of  problems.
First  arrests  made  under  security  law. Suspects  were  arrested  for  incitement  to  commit  secession  during  unlawful  rally.

Safeguarding  national  security  in  the  SAR  brings  HK  society  confidence  for  future. HKGCC  said  the  passage  of  the  national  security  law  is  instrumental  to  restoring  stability  and  certainty  to  Hong  Kong,  which  benefits  the  business  sector.

HK  police  make  first  arrests  by  invoking  security  law. Police  on  Wednesday  arrested  a  man  for  possessing  a  flag  advocating  Hong  Kong  independence  in  Causeway  Bay  on  Hong  Kong  Island.
New  law  to  'boost'  practice  of  'one  country,  two  systems'. Chinese  officials  held  a  press  conference  in  Beijing  on  the  national  security  law  for  Hong  Kong  on  Wednesday.

US  urged  to  stop  interfering  in  China's  internal  affairs. A  Foreign  Ministry  spokesperson  responded  to  some  US  officials'  statements  over  China's  national  security  legislation  for  Hong  Kong.

Law  and  order  dawns  in  Hong  Kong  as  new  law  takes  effect. HK  reached  a  significant  turning  point  on  the  23rd  anniversary  of  its  return  to  the  motherland  as  a  law  on  safeguarding  national  security  came  into  force.

Full  text:  Law  on  safeguarding  national  security  in  HKSAR. The  law  on  safeguarding  national  security  in  the  Hong  Kong  Special  Administrative  Region  was  adopted  by  the  NPC  Standing  Committee  Tuesday.

HK  celebrates  23rd  anniversary  of  return  to  motherland. Carrie  Lam  stressed  the  significance  of  the  return  anniversary  and  said  the  new  national  security  law  for  HK  will  help  restore  stability  in  the  region.

CE:  National  security  law  shows  central  government's  trust  in  HK. The  enactment  of  the  national  security  law  at  the  state  level  shows  the  central  government  is  determined  to  restore  stability  in  Hong  Kong,  said  Carrie  Lam.

HK  reports  28  new  COVID-19  cases,  tally  at  1,233. The  new  cases  involve  12  males  and  16  females  aged  between  three  and  46,  and  all  but  one  of  them  had  travel  history  during  the  incubation  period.

Residents  celebrate  anniversary  across  Hong  Kong. Residents  sang  the  national  anthem  on  the  Peak  and  at  Po  Lin  Monastery  to  celebrate  the  23rd  anniversary  of  Hong  Kong's  return  to  the  motherland.

52  countries  welcome  China's  adoption  of  HK  security  law. 52  countries  welcomed  the  adoption  of  the  law  on  Safeguarding  National  Security  in  the  HKSAR  by  China's  top  legislature.

Liaison  Office  director:  Security  law  a  'guardian'  for  HK  residents. The  promulgation  of  the  national  security  law  marks  a  significant  turning  point  for  HK  and  a  milestone  for  "one  country,  two  systems,"  said  Luo  Huining.

Highlights  of  press  briefing  on  national  security  law  for  HK. The  State  Council  Information  Office  held  a  press  conference  about  the  law  of  safeguarding  national  security  in  Hong  Kong  on  Wednesday  morning.

US  warned  of  countermeasures  over  sanctions  on  Hong  Kong. Hong  Kong  Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  said  the  SAR  would  cooperate  with  any  countermeasures  deemed  necessary  by  the  central  government.

CE's  speech  at  reception  marking  HK's  return  to  motherland. Carrie  Lam  delivered  a  speech  at  a  reception  held  in  celebration  of  the  23rd  anniversary  of  the  establishment  of  the  HKSAR  on  Wednesday  morning.

HK  setting  up  offices  to  handle  new  law. HK's  secretary  of  justice  said  a  dedicated  office  under  the  DoJ  has  been  set  up  to  handle  prosecutions  and  related  legal  matters  on  national  security.

Hong  Kong  community  welcomes  the  legislation. ​Various  sectors  of  the  Hong  Kong  community  hailed  on  Tuesday  the  passage  of  a  new  law  to  safeguard  national  security  in  Hong  Kong.

HKSAR  govt  vows  to  fulfill  duties  in  safeguarding  national  security. The  Hong  Kong  government  pledged  efforts  to  implement  the  national  security  law  for  the  SAR  to  ensure  the  city's  long-term  prosperity.

NPC  adopts  law  on  safeguarding  national  security  in  HK. A  meeting  of  the  NPC  Standing  Committee  also  adopted  a  decision  to  add  the  law  to  Annex  III  of  the  HKSAR  Basic  Law.

Change  strategies  to  ride    out  storm,  businesses  told. "From  conglomerates  to  small-and-medium-sized  enterprises,  they  need  to  proactively  manage  their  cash  flow,  bank  loans  and  human-resources  issues.”

Liaison  office  hails  passage  of  security  law. The  central  government's  Liaison  Office  in  Hong  Kong  vowed  on  Tuesday  to  firmly  support  the  enforcement  of  the  city's  national  security  law.

COVID-19  hit  ‘the  worst’  fashion  trade  has  seen. Tan  said  the  coronavirus  pandemic  has  disrupted  the  entire  cycle  of  fashion  sourcing  and  orders  have  been  slashed  in  the  past  several  months.

‘New  ideas,  bottom-up  innovation’  key  to  reviving  flagging  economy. Andrew  Sheng  said  the  central  government  and  the  HKSAR  government  should  be  more  open  to  new  ideas  to  revitalize  economy  after  the  COVID-19  crisis.
Pandemic  recovery  to  require  ‘new  normal’. Politicians  and  entrepreneurs  must  find  new  solutions  in  a  post-coronavirus  world.

The  Law  of  the  PRC  on  Safeguarding  National  Security  in  the  HKSAR  gazetted  with  immediate  effect. The  Law  of  the  PRC  on  Safeguarding  National  Security  in  the  HKSAR  (the  National  Security  Law)  was  gazetted  for  promulgation  on  June  30  and  took  effect  at  11pm  the  same  day.

Law  on  safeguarding  national  security  in  HKSAR  takes  effect. The  Law  of  the  People's  Republic  of  China  on  Safeguarding  National  Security  in  the  Hong  Kong  Special  Administrative  Region  took  effect  at  11  pm  on  Tuesday.

Mainland  warns  Taiwan  against  undermining  stability  of  HK. A  Chinese  mainland  spokesperson  responded  to  a  media  question  about  the  DPP  authority's  smearing  of  the  top  legislature  adopting  a  national  security  law  in  the  HKSAR.

China  to  take  necessary  actions  to  counter  US  sanctions. ​China  won't  be  intimidated  by  the  US'  attempts  to  obstruct  it  from  advancing  national  security  legislation  for  the  HKSAR,  a  government  spokesman  said.

HK  CE,  govt  officials  welcome  passage  of  national  security  law. Lam  said  the  enactment  of  a  national  security  law  at  the  state  level  is  both  necessary  and  urgent  in  order  to  plug  the  loophole  in  national  security  in  HK.

HK  retail  sales  slide  32.8%  in  May  on  virus  shutdown. The  city's  retail  sales  by  value  fell  to  HK$26.8b  (US$3.5b  )  for  a  16th  straight  monthly  decline,  according  to  a  government  release.

HK  relaxes  social  distancing  rules  as  COVID-19  cases  fall. The  announcement  came  as  the  financial  hub  reported  two  imported  cases  of  COVID-19  on  Tuesday,  taking  the  city's  infection  tally  to  1,205.

Top  legislature  adopts  national  security  law  for  HKSAR. President  Xi  Jinping  signed  a  presidential  order  to  promulgate  the  law,  which  goes  into  effect  as  of  the  date  of  promulgation.

Embassy:  China  offers  help  to  Philippines  in  sea  collision  probe. As  of  Tuesday,  Philippine  Coast  Guard  commandant  Vice-Admiral  George  Ursabia  said  no  signs  of  life  have  so  far  been  found  by  the  rescuers.

HKMAO,  liaison  office  support  national  security  law  in  HKSAR. The  Hong  Kong  and  Macao  Affairs  Office  and  the  liaison  office  both  voiced  firm  support  for  the  law  on  safeguarding  national  security  in  the  HKSAR.

Hong  Kong  Sevens  canceled  as  virus  thwarts  rugby’s  big  party. The  Hong  Kong  Sevens,  originally  scheduled  for  April,  had  previously  been  postponed  until  October  due  to  concerns  over  the  virus  outbreak.
Lam:  National  security  law  helps  HK's  stability. Hong  Kong  Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  delivered  a  video  message  at  the  UN  Human  Rights  Council  meeting  on  Tuesday.

China  Bohai  Bank  launches  IPO  in  HK. China  Bohai  Bank  said  it  will  offer  2.88b  H  shares  in  the  global  offering,  and  the  offer  price  is  currently  expected  to  be  no  less  than  HK$4.75  per  offer  share.

Lam:  HK  will  help  central  govt  on  counterattacks,  if  needed. Carrie  Lam  was  responding  to  US  sanctions  to  revoke  HK's  special  trade  status,  announced  by  the  US  Department  of  Commerce  on  Monday.

HK  local  groups  welcome  passage  of  national  security  law. Political  groups,  police  associations,  and  a  college  alliance  voiced  strong  support  for  the  national  security  law  adopted  by  the  top  legislature  on  Tuesday.

Impact  of  US  sanctions  limited,  say  HK  business,  science  sectors. US  sanctions  will  have  little  impact  on  HK's  manufacturing  industry  and  HK-US  research  and  science  collaboration,  business  leaders  and  an  engineer  said.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.52%  higher. The  benchmark  Hang  Seng  Index  traded  between  24,271.77  and  24,598.61.  Turnover  totaled  HK$122.49  billion  (about  US$15.81  billion).

China,  Egypt  reject  foreign  interference  in  HK  affairs. Chinese  Foreign  Minister  Wang  Yi  expressed  his  gratitude  to  Egypt  for  understanding  and  supporting  China's  legitimate  claims  on  the  HK  affairs.
China’s  achievements  in  pandemic  response  praised. The  nation’s  performance  during  the  pandemic  shows  its  ability  to  cope  with  a  severe  health  crisis,  an  expert  said.

HKSAR  welcomes  Thailand's  relaxed  travel  controls. Business  travelers  and  guests  of  the  Thai  govt  will  be  allowed  to  enter  but  they  have  to  submit  their  itinerary  in  advance  and  will  travel  only  by  private  car.

Staff  associations  of  3  disciplined  forces  back  legislation. The  staff  associations  said  they  they  fully  support  the  National  People's  Congress'  legislative  work  on  safeguarding  national  security  in  HKSAR.

Mainland  allows  cross-border  wealth  flows  with  HK,  Macao. Regulators  announced  Monday  the  kick  off  of  Wealth  Management  Connect,  which  will  allow  HK  residents  to  place  accumulated  cash  across  the  border.

HK  finance  chief:  Cross-border  wealth  flows  bring  opportunities. The  WMC  aims  to  facilitate  cross-boundary  investment  by  residents  in  the  Greater  Bay  Area  and  promotes  the  opening-up  of  the  Chinese  mainland's  financial  markets.
Nation  united  in  the  war  on  COVID-19  pandemic. Photography  exhibition  highlights  the  country’s  efforts  to  contain  the  coronavirus  pandemic.

600,000  overseas  Chinese  sign  petition  supporting  law. Nearly  600,000  overseas  Chinese    signed  an  online  petition  to  support  the  proposed  national  security  legislation  for  the  HKSAR.
Experts  back  life  sentences  for  national  security  offenses. A  life  sentence  for  someone  convicted  of  a  national  security  crime  is  warranted,  Hong  Kong's  law  experts  said.

HK  legislation  will  protect  human  rights,  say  experts. The  national  security  law  for  HKSAR  will  fully  protect  the  human  rights  and  freedoms  people  currently  enjoy  in  the  SAR:  Legal  experts.
Legal  expert:  some  countries  opposing  security  law  for  political  ends. Alan  Hoo  condemned  meddling  by  foreign  powers,  led  by  the  United  States  and  Britain.

NPC  panel  finetunes  HK  draft  law  version  after  deliberations. The  NPC  Constitution  and  Law  Committee  prepared  a  version  of  the  draft  national  security  law  for  HK​  after  meetings  by  senior  Chinese  lawmakers.

China  to  impose  visa  restrictions  on  US  individuals  over  HKSAR. China  has  decided  to  impose  visa  curbs  on  US  individuals  who  have  behaved  egregiously  over  HK-related  issues,  a  Foreign  Ministry  spokesman  said.

Hong  Kong's  exports  down  7.4%  in  May. The  value  of  Hong  Kong's  total  exports  decreased  in  May  to  HK$317.6  billion  while  the  value  of  imports  of  goods  decreased  to  HK$331.3  billion.

HK  student  gets  32  months  in  jail  for  possessing  petrol  bombs. A  Hong  Kong  district  court  on  Monday  sentenced  a  local  student  to  32  months  in  prison  for  illegally  possessing  petrol  bombs  during  last  year’s  social  unrest.

Hong  Kong  reports  4  imported  COVID-19  cases,  tally  at  1,203. The  new  cases  include  a  male  and  three  females  aged  between  23  and  53  who  had  travel  history  during  the  incubation  period.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  1.01%  lower. The  Hang  Seng  Index  traded  between  24,148.62  and  24,627.64.  Turnover  totaled  HK$133.02  billion  (about  US$17.16  billion).  ​

Draft  security  law  for  HK  honors  'one  country,  two  systems'. Experts  said  the  draft  national  security  law  is  based  on  the  Constitution  and  the  region's  Basic  Law  and  is  fully  in  line  with  "one  country,  two  systems".

NPC  starts  2nd  review  of  security  law  for  HK. The  NPC  Standing  Committee  started  a  second  review  of  the  draft  national  security  law  for  Hong  Kong  at  its  20th  session  starting  from  Sunday.

HKSAR  govt  welcomes  Thailand's  relaxation  of  inbound  passenger  control. Business  travelers  and  guests  of  the  Thai  govt  will  be  allowed  to  enter  but  they  have  to  submit  their  itinerary  in  advance  and  will  travel  only  by  private  car.
HK  business  backs  national  security  law. Financial  Secretary  Paul  Chan  said  the  city's  financial  sector  believes  the  new  law  will  boost  business  opportunities.

Police:    53  arrested  for  unlawful  assembly  in  Hong  Kong. Police  arrested  53  persons,  including  41  males  and  12  females,  for  unlawful  assembly  in  Mongkok  district  on  Sunday  afternoon.

Top  lawmakers  hear  report  on  security  legislation  for  HK. The  draft  Amendment  XI  to  the  Criminal  Law  was  submitted  to  an  ongoing  session  of  the  National  People's  Congress  Standing  Committee.

S&P  affirms  AA+/A-1+  issuer  credit  ratings  on  HK. Hong  Kong  economy  will  likely  suffer  another  deep  contraction  this  year  as  the  pandemic  has  increased  pressure  on  the  services  and  trade  sectors,  said  S&P.

National  security  education  'necessary'  in  schools. School  principals  said  it  is  necessary  to  include  national  security  education  in  school  curriculum  once  the  draft  law  on  national  security  for  HK  is  passed.

China  firmly  opposes  US  visa  curbs  on  Chinese  officials. ​China  strongly  opposes  the  US  imposing  visa  restrictions  on  Chinese  officials  over  HK-related  issues,  a  spokesperson  for  the  Chinese  embassy  in  the  US  said.

Commissioner's  office  urges  US  to  stop  interfering  in  HK  affairs. The  Commissioner's  Office  of  the  Foreign  Ministry  in  the  HKSAR  firmly  opposed  the  US  announcement  of  visa  restrictions  on  Chinese  officials.
Washington's  Hong  Kong  bill  slammed. The  HKSAR  government  on  Friday  expressed  strong  opposition  to  the  passage  of  the  Hong  Kong  Autonomy  Act  by  the  United  States  Senate.

Hong  Kong  confirms  1  new  COVID-19  case,  tally  at  1,197. The  new  case  involved  a  39-year-old  woman  who  came  to  Hong  Kong  from  the  Philippines,  according  to  the  Centre  for  Health  Protection.

Beijing  'determined'  to  legislate  on  national  security  for  HKSAR. Minor  opposition  won't  derail  a  proposed  national  security  law  for  Hong  Kong,  according  to  delegates  from  the  SAR  to  the  nation's  top  legislature.

HKSAR  govt  strongly  opposes  passage  of  HK-related  act  in  US. The  Hong  Kong  Special  Administrative  Region  government  said  it  strongly  opposed  the  passage  of  the  "Hong  Kong  Autonomy  Act"  by  the  Senate  of  the  United  States  Congress.

Education  chief:  Security  law  to  be  taught  in  schools. Kevin  Yeung  said  the  Education  Bureau  will  study  how  to  let  students  more  deeply  understand  the  significance  of  the  law  and  its  key  content.

Exhibition  captures  touching  moments  in  COVID-19  fight. A  photographic  exhibition  themed  "Together,  We  Fight  the  Virus"  was  held  at  HKBU  Affiliated  School  Wong  Kam  Fai  Secondary  and  Primary  School  Friday.

HK's  office  market  lifeless  as  buyers  absent,  tenants  cautious. Office  valuations  in  the  city  may  slump  as  much  as  20  percent  this  year,  according  to  Jones  Lang  LaSalle  Inc.

Hong  Kong  reports  3  new  COVID-19  cases,  tally  at  1,196. The  new  cases  involved  3  males  aged  between  7  and  26,  who  all  had  travel  history  during  the  incubation  period,  the  Center  for  Health  Protection  said.

HK  govt  slams  relegation  in  US  trafficking  report. The  HKSAR  government  strongly  objected  to  the  city's  relegation  to  "Tier-2  Watch  List"  in  the  United  States  Trafficking  in  Persons  Report  2020.

HK’s  logistics  hub  status  put  to  the  test  in  COVID-19  crisis. As  the  pandemic  hammers  supply  chains  globally,  experts  warn  HK's  trade-sector  players  that  they  need  to  diversify  sourcing  bases  &  invest  in  technologies.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.93%  lower. The  benchmark  Hang  Seng  Index  traded  between  24,537.77  and  24,756.58.  Turnover  totaled  HK$96.11  billion  (about  US$12.40  billion).

HSBC  plans  to  double  mobile  bank  users  in  cost-cutting  drive. Planning  to  cut  35,000  jobs  to  trim  costs,  HSBC  targets  to  double  the  number  of  mobile  users  by  2022,  which  could  generate  more  revenue  per  customer.

New  security  law  will  ensure  prosperous  HK. Scholars  from  international  institutions  said  the  enactment  of  a  national  security  law  in  HK  is  legitimate  and  will  further  protect  civil  rights  of  the  city.

Police:  14  people  arrested  for  unlawful  assembly  in  HK. The  Hong  Kong  police  arrested  9  males  and  5  females  aged  between  14  and  55  for  unlawful  assembly  at  the  YOHO  Mall  in  Yuen  Long,  New  Territories.

Smart  technologies  the  way  forward  in  logistics. Enterprises  normally  outsource  parts  of  their  distribution,  warehousing  and  fulfillment  services  to  third-party  logistics-service  providers.

Security  law  for  HK  unlikely  retroactive. Basic  Law  Committee  member  Priscilla  Leung  Mei-fun  believes  the  proposed  national  security  law  for  Hong  Kong  will  not  be  implemented  retroactively.

CE:  National  security  legislation  to  restore  stability  in  HK. Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  stressed  again  that  it  is  the  constitutional  responsibility  of  the  HKSAR  to  safeguard  national  security.

HK  sees  7th  COVID-19  death,  14  new  imported  cases. The  man  suffered  from  a  stroke  in  the  Philippines  and  was  admitted  to  the  Princess  Margaret  Hospital  on  Tuesday  after  being  flown  back  to  Hong  Kong.

Flyers  hiding  infection  show  risk  of  reopening  borders. ​People  infected  with  coronavirus  were  allowed  to  board  aircraft  and  travel  to  HK  in  recent  days,  highlighting  the  challenge  of  controlling  the  pandemic.

HK  airport  passenger  volume  drops  18.9%. The  passenger  volume  and  cargo  volume  at  the  HKIA  dropped  18.9%  and  7.3%  year-on-year  respectively  for  the  fiscal  year  that  ended  March  31,  2020.

Govt  to  hand  out  30  million  free  masks  starting  next  week. Each  household  will  receive  a  pack  of  10  disposable  adult  masks,  which  are  procured  by  the  government  under  the  local  mask  production  subsidy  scheme.

New  guideline  to  promote  maritime  coordination  in  GBA. The  guideline  aims  to  elevate  cooperation  between  maritime  watchdogs  in  the  Greater  Bay  Area  to  a  level  where  resources  are  better  shared.

HK  opposition  unpatriotic:  Italian  expat. An  Italian-born  writer,  researcher  and  academic  says  the  national  security  law  will  end  foreign  meddling  and  safeguard  "one  country,  two  systems"  principle.

Hong  Kong  business  sector  applauds  national  security  law. The  law  is  a  timely  antidote  to  the  city's  constant  chaos  that  has  often  turned  violent,  Hong  Kong  business  leaders  say.

Photo  exhibition  on  China’s  fight  against  COVID-19  impresses  HK  school. The  exhibition  highlights  dramatic  moments  when  medical  employees  and  residents  across  China  collectively  battled  the  spread  of  COVID-19.

Andrew  Cheung  appointed  Chief  Justice  of  HK's  highest  court. Andrew  Cheung  Kui-nung  will  officiate  as  the  Chief  Justice  of  HK's  Court  of  Final  Appeal  with  effect  from  Jan  11,  2021.

HK  to  launch  health  code  system  for  travel  to  Guangdong,  Macao. Travelers  can  exchange  the  "Hong  Kong  Health  Code"  for  use  on  the  "Yuekang  Code"  system  of  Guangdong  or  the  "Macao  Health  Code"  system  of  Macao.

HK  reports  2  new  COVID-19  cases,  tally  at  1,179. The  newly  reported  cases  involve  a  47-year-old  woman  and  a  man  aged  55,  both  having  travel  history  during  the  incubation  period.

23-year-old  imprisoned  for  4  years  for  possessing  bombs. A  HK  District  Court  judge  sentenced  a  23-year-old  man  to  4  years  in  prison  for  possessing  an  offensive  weapon  in  a  public  place.

Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.50%  lower. The  benchmark  Hang  Seng  Index  traded  between  24,770.95  and  25,071.32.  Turnover  totaled  115.43  billion  Hong  Kong  dollars  (about  US$14.89  billion).

HK  govt  clarifies  wage  subsidy  scheme  modalities. The  Employment  Support  Scheme  (ESS)  does  not  require  employers  to  use  the  wage  subsidies  at  HK$9,000  maximum  or  half  of  the  wages  of  each  employee.

CE:  HK  ideal  for  MNCs  even  after  national  security  legislation. Lam  said  the  legislation  only  targets  acts  of  secession,  subversion,  terrorist  activities,  and  collusion  with  external  forces  to  endanger  national  security.

External  interference  in  national  security  legislation  opposed. The  United  Front  Supporting  National  Security  Legislation  launched  a  petition,  which  was  signed  by  more  than  1m  people  as  of  Tuesday  evening.

NPC  chief's  view  on  draft  national  security  law  for  HK. Refining  the  legal  system  for  the  HKSAR  at  the  State  level  is  a  major  measure  to  uphold  and  improve  the  system  of  "one  country,  two  systems,"  said  Li  Zhanshu.

HKEX  chief:  Stock  Connects  to  widen  investment  options. Stock  Connects  are  collaborations  between  the  HK,  Shanghai  and  Shenzhen  bourses  that  allow  investors  to  trade  securities  in  each  other's  markets.

HK  police  say  7  people  charged  for  violence  at  metro  station. Police  said  on  Tuesday  that  the  seven  people  have  been  charged  with  offenses  including  riot  and  unlawful  assembly  at  a  metro  station  in  Kowloon  last  August.

Central  govt  solicits  views  from  HK  sectors  on  draft  law. The  Legislative  Affairs  Commission  of  the  NPC  Standing  Committee  held    seminars  in  HK  to  solicit  views  from  various  local  sectors  on  the  draft  national  security  law.

Key  points  to  know  about  the  draft  national  security  law. Hong  Kong's  Tomorrow  Concern  Group  prepared  a  collection  of  questions  and  answers  regarding  the  draft  law  on  national  security  for  the  HKSAR.

CE:  Hong  Kong’s  judicial  independence  not  affected. Carrie  Lam  said  the  draft  law  has  not  conferred  on  her  the  power  to  appoint  a  specific  judge  for  any  particular  national  security  case.
Suggestions  on  security  law  heard  in  HK. People  from  all  walks  of  life  shared  their  opinions  in  12  seminars  held  in  the  SAR  on  Tuesday.

Photo  exhibition  pays  tribute  to  China's  victory  over  coronavirus. Co-hosted  by  China  Daily  and  Hong  Kong  Art,  the  event,  themed  "Together,  we  fight  the  virus",  opened  on  Tuesday.
Virus:  Exhibition  shows  HK's  efforts  to  protect  motherland. The  exhibition  comprises  images  from  an  album  published  by  China  Daily  called  “100  photographers  Focus  on  COVID-19”.

National  security  law  'respects  HK  judicial  independence'. Carrie  Lam  stressed  that  the  proposed  national  security  law  won't  impair  the  HKSAR's  judicial  independence  and  its  high  degree  of  autonomy.

COVID-19:  HK  reports  6th  death,  16  new  imported  cases. Hong  Kong  reported  16  new  cases  of  COVID-19  caused  by  a  novel  coronavirus  and  the  city’s  sixth  COVID-19  death  on  Tuesday.

HK  economy  gets  boost  from  staycations,  dining  deals. A  captive  audience  for  HK's  hotels,  restaurants  and  shopping  malls  has  likely  sparked  a  modest  uptick  in  retail  sales  in  May  and  June.

Mainland,  HKSAR  see  growth  in  IPO  volume  in  H1  despite  virus. IPO  in  the  mainland  and  the  HKSAR  continued  to  grow  in  the  first  6  months  this  year  as  global  IPOs  slowed  due  to  the  pandemic,  an  EY  report  showed.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  1.62%  higher. The  benchmark  Hang  Seng  Index  traded  between  24,184.88  and  24,907.34.  Turnover  totaled  HK$119.45  billion  (about  US$15.41  billion).

PBOC  issues  bills  worth  10b  yuan  in  Hong  Kong. China's  central  bank  on  Tuesday  issued  10  billion  yuan  of  six-month  renminbi  central  bank  bills  in  Hong  Kong  with  an  interest  rate  of  2.21  percent.

Tencent  smashes  record  high  after  stock's  US$307b  rebound. The  internet  and  gaming  giant  rose  4.9  percent  to  a  record  HK$497.40  on  Tuesday,  leapfrogging  Alibaba  as  Asia's  most  valuable  company.

CE:  National  security  legislation  crucial  to  stability,  order  in  HK. Carrie  Lam  stressed  the  significance  of  restoring  order  and  rebuilding  confidence  to  facilitate  HK's  recovery  from  unrest  &  the  COVID-19  epidemic.

HK  residents  hail  national  security  law. HK  residents  and  legal  experts  believe  the  law  will  serve  as  an  opportunity  for  the  city  to  return  to  a  peaceful  life  and  deter  forces  trying  to  create  disorder.

Hong  Kong  retail  investors  remain  optimistic  despite  uncertain  outlook. Despite  of  the  economic  downturn  and  market  uncertainty,  most  Hong  Kong  retail  investors  are  keen  to  invest,  a  recent  survey  revealed.

Hong  Kong  reports  30  new  COVID-19  cases,  tally  at  1,161. The  newly  reported  cases  involved  15  men  and  15  women  aged  between  one  and  61,  who  all  had  travel  history  during  the  incubation  period,  the  CHP  said.

US-listed  GDS  said  to  weigh  HK  share  sale  worth  US$1b. Founded  in  2001,  GDS  develops  and  operates  data  centers  in  major  mainland  cities  such  as  Beijing,  Shanghai  and  Guangzhou,  according  to  its  website.
Financial  secretary  confident  of  world  economic  recovery. Paul  Chan  says  geopolitical  tensions  between  the  US  and  China  remain  a  major  challenge.

Hong  Kong  society  welcomes  draft  security  law. Ex-chief  executive  Leung  Chun-ying  said  the  legislation  reflects  the  vitality  of  the  principles  of  "one  country,  two  systems"  and  a  high  degree  of  autonomy.
HKSAR  govt  backs  draft  national  security  law  for  HK. Top  officials  of  the  HKSAR  government  on  Sunday  voiced  support  for  the  draft  law  deliberated  by  China's  top  legislature.

Barrister:  Draft  security  law  respects  judicial  independence. The  draft  national  security  law  in  HKSAR  reviewed  by  the  national  legislature  respects  the  current  legal  system  in  HK,  British  barrister  Grenville  Cross  said.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.54%  lower. The  benchmark  Hang  Seng  Index  traded  between  24,391.17  and  24,628.95.  Turnover  totaled  HK$119.58  billion.

Security  law  draft  has  backing  in  HK. Political  leaders  &  the  business  sector  in  HK  backed  the  proposed  law  as  details  of  the  draft  were  released  after  a  session  of  the  NPC  Standing  Committee.
National  security  law  for  HK  discussed. The  13th  NPC  Standing  Committee  deliberated  on  a  draft  law  on  safeguarding  national  security  in  the  HKSAR  during  its  19th  session.

Chinese  mission  slams  European  Parliament's  resolution  on  HK. No  country  in  the  world  would  allow  legal  gaps  in  national  security  or  allow  acts  that  endanger  national  security,  said  a  spokesperson.

CE:  Draft  security  law  fully  reflects  suggestions  from  HK. Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  Cheng  Yuet-ngor  expressed  the  government's  "full  support"  for  the  law,  pledging  to  implement  it  after  it  is  passed.

Wide  support  for  proposed  national  security  law. Various  sectors  of  Hong  Kong  voiced  strong  support  for  the  proposed  national  security  law  for  the  special  administrative  region.

Top  legislature  reviews  draft  HK  national  security  law. The  draft  clarifies  4  types  of  crimes  that  endanger  national  security:  secession,  subversion  against  state  power,  terrorist  activity,  and  collusion  with  foreign  forces  that  endanger  national  security.

NPC  opposes  EU  interference  in  HKSAR  affairs. A  spokesman  for  the  NPC  Foreign  Affairs  Committee  strongly  condemned  and  objected  a  resolution  adopted  on  Friday  by  the  European  Parliament.

HK:  Registration  for  HK$10,000  cash  handout  begins  Sunday. Registration  for  the  government's  HK$10,000  cash  handout  starts  on  Sunday,  with  21  participating  banks  accepting  electronic  registration  from  7  am.

Li:  'One  country,  two  systems'  foundation  for  HK's  success. HKEX  chief  executive  Charles  Li  said  national  security  legislation  for  HK  aims  at  ensuring  the  success  of  "one  country,  two  systems."

HKSAR  govt  strongly  condemns  politically  driven  'referendum'. A  government  spokesman  said  a  so-called  "referendum"  on  a  strike  is  obviously  taking  advantage  of  the  public  and  students  for  political  purposes.

Attempts  to  smear  national  security  legislation  opposed. The  Commissioner's  Office  of  the  Foreign  Ministry  in  the  HKSAR  firmly  opposed  external  forces'  attempt  to  smear  the  national  security  legislation  for  the  city.

Nip:  Union's  strike  'referendum'  tarnishes  civil  servants  reputation. Nip  Tak-kuen  has  warned  that  a  "referendum"  on  a  planned  strike  will  tarnish  the  reputation  of  the  civil  service,  and  is  against  its  political  neutrality.

Civil  groups  urge  second  thoughts  on  poll  arrangements. The  Electoral  Affairs  Commission  was  urged  to  prioritize  the  elderly  for  the  Legislative  Council  election  on  September  6.
