Expert:  Don't  worry  about  security  law. Statistics  from  Macao  have  proved  that  the  special  administrative  region's  National  Security  Law  has  aided  the  city's  development,  not  impeded  it.

Business  sector  'backs  national  security  law'. National  security  law  for  HK  has  the  overwhelming  support  of  local  business  sector,  said  Executive  Council  member  Jeffrey  Lam  Kin-fung.

Security  law  'not  to  affect  financial  hub  status'. Former  HKMA  chief  Joseph  Yam  Chi-kwong  sees  a  chance  to  finally  end  the  social  unrest  in  Hong  Kong  as  a  national  security  legislation  will  be  enacted  in  HK.
Police  officers  put  lives  on  line  to  guard  HK's  law  and  order. Two  police  officers  who  were  injured  by  radicals  share  with  China  Daily  their  ordeals.

Executive  councilor  hopes  security  law  will  eliminate  separatism  and  terrorism. Jeffrey  Lam  Kin-fung  hopes  the  national  security  law  will  wipe  out  the  offenses  of  subversion,  secession,  terrorism  and  collusion  with  external  forces  in  the  city.

HK  bankruptcy  filings  at  17-year  high  amid  pandemic,  unrest. Bankruptcy  filings  have  surged  to  a  17-year  high  after  the  pandemic  pushed  an  economy  already  reeling  from  months  of  anti-govt  protests  deeper  into  recession.

Yum  China  is  said  to  file  for  US$2b  Hong  Kong  listing. Yum  China,  the  mainland's  biggest  fast-food  chain  operator,  is  said  to  have  filed  confidentially  for  a  HK  listing  that  could  raise  about  US$2  billion.

Spokesperson:  Taiwan  'aid  plan'  blatant  interference  in  HK  affairs. The  so-called  'aid  plan'  offered  to  rioters  escaping  from  HK  exposed  DPP's  attempt  to  undermine  the  city's  prosperity,  a  mainland  spokesperson  said.

Heartfelt  cards  heal  battle  scars  of  HK  police  officers. Two  police  officers  severely  wounded  by  radical  protesters  during  last  year's  social  unrest  thanked  those  who  had  expressed  sympathy  to  them.

Police  officer  slashed  in  the  neck  recalls  ordeal. The  police  officer  who  was  slashed  with  a  knife  in  the  neck  by  a  radical  protester  recalled  the  ordeal  he  and  his  family  have  endured  since  his  injury.

HSBC  hits  out  at  'rumors'  with  China  investment  pledge. HSBC  urged  the  Chinese  public  to  "reasonably"  consider  and  assess  its  positive  role  as  an  international  bank  in  the  development  of  China's  market.

COVID-19:  HK  sees  3  new  imported  cases,  tally  at  1,127. The  newly  confirmed  cases  involve  two  males  and  one  female  aged  between  nine  and  41.  They  all  had  a  travel  history  during  the  incubation  period.

HK  let  down  by  US  proposal  to  deny  submarine  cable  link. The  HKSAR  govt  said  the  recommendation  hindered  the  telecoms  development  between  HK  and  the  US  and  also  harmed  US  interests.

The  long  hard  road  off  campus. Hong  Kong’s  graduating  class  of  2020  are  throwing  their  hats  into  the  city’s  coronavirus-battered  job  market,  with  little  confidence  they  will  find  employment.

Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.73%  higher. The  Hang  Seng  Index  gained  178.95  points  to  close  at  24,643.89  points  on  Friday.
​

'It  broke  my  heart':  British  expat  speaks  of  violence  in  HK. Peter  Bentley  recalled  the  shocking  scenes  of  violence  that  brought  him  to  tears  &  expressed  his  concern  about  HK  being  plunged  into  a  political  turmoil.

Election  watchdog:  LegCo  poll  nominations  to  open  on  July  18. The  nomination  period  for  the  2020  Legislative  Council  General  Election  will  run  from  July  18  to  31,  Hong  Kong's  election  watchdog  said.

Crossing  the  Rubicon  homebound. As  US  listings  become  more  difficult  and  less  attractive,  mainland  firms  seeking  a  major  IPO  are  increasingly  looking  to  HK  to  provide  the  opportunity  they  need.

China  voices  firm  opposition  to  G7  statement  on  HKSAR. Foreign  Ministry  spokesman  Zhao  Lijian  on  Thursday  said  that  China  is  determined  to  advance  the  national  security  legislation  for  Hong  Kong.
Review  of  security  law  for  HK  gets  underway. The  NPC  Standing  Committee  started  to  review  the  draft  law  on  safeguarding  national  security  in  the  HKSAR  on  Thursday.
G-7  nations  urged  to  stop  interfering  in  HK  affairs. The  commissioner's  office  slammed  the  G-7's  double  standards  on  the  national  security  legislation  for  Hong  Kong.

LegCo  poll:  Election  watchdog  vows  to  boot  troublemakers  off. The  Electoral  Affairs  Commission  issued  guidelines  for  the  Legislation  Council  election  slated  for  September  6  this  year.

HK  reports  4  new  imported  COVID-19  cases,  tally  at  1,124. The  Center  for  Health  Protection  said  the  new  cases  involved  two  men  and  two  women  who  had  returned  from  Pakistan.

NPC  Standing  Committee  reviews  HK  security  legislation. The  Standing  Committee  of  National  People's  Congress  started  to  review  the  draft  of  the  national  security  law  for  HK  during  its  session  that  began  Thursday.
HK  restaurants  to  offer  discounts  in  campaign  to  revive  economy. The  “unprecedented”  promotional  campaign  coincides  with  the  distribution  of  the  one-off  cash  payments  in  July.

E-commerce  giant  JD.com  climbs  3.5%  in  HK  debut. The  mainland  online  retailer,  which  already  has  stock  listed  in  the  US,  rose  as  much  as  6%  before  closing  at  HK$234,  up  3.5%,  in  its  Thursday  debut  in  HK.

HK's  Disneyland  reopens  after  five-month  coronavirus  break. HK’s  Disneyland  theme  park  reopened  to  a  limited  number  of  local  visitors  and  with  enhanced  health  measures  after  the  epidemic  forced  it  to  close  in  late  Jan.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.07  pct  lower. The  Hang  Seng  Index  traded  between  24,121.89  and  24,464.94.  Turnover  totaled  HK$121.61  billion  (about  US$15.69  billion).

280  HK  people  to  return  from  India. The  returnees,  who  will  bear  the  cost  of  the  flight,  will  proceed  to  the  Temporary  Specimen  Collection  Centre  at  AsiaWorld-Expo  for  compulsory  testing.

HK  infection  tally  rises  to  1,120  with  8  new  imported  cases. The  new  cases  involved  six  females  and  two  males,  aged  between  four  and  70,  who  had  returned  to  Hong  Kong  from  Pakistan  and  the  Philippines.

Lam:  HKSAR  govt  to  provide  more  jobs  for  graduates. Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  Yuet-ngor  said  the  HKSAR  govt  will  provide  more  jobs  as  the  unemployment  rate  hit  a  15-year  high  of  5.9  percent.

Ip:  Details  of  security  law  for  HK  could  be  announced  in  July. Details  of  the  proposed  national  security  law  will  be  announced  likely  as  early  as  July,  with  the  law's  drafting  proceeding  full  steam  ahead,  said  Ip  Kwok-him.

CMA:  Help  HK  manufacturers  in  Bay  Area  to  upgrade. The  CMA  urged  the  SAR  government  to  take  the  lead  in  helping  the  city's  manufacturers  to  upgrade  and  transform  their  operations  in  Bay  Area.
Executive  Councilor  proposes  special  national  security  court. HK  police  should  collaborate  with  mainland  agents  on  national  security  cases,  says  Ip  Kwok-him.

Sinopharm  jumps  most  in  5  years  on  vaccine  results. Sinopharm  surged  by  the  most  since  April  2015,  as  the  trial  results  for  its  COVID-19  vaccine  candidate  rekindled  investors’  enthusiasm  for  the  sector.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.56%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  137.32  points,  or  0.56  percent,  to  24,481.41  points  on  Wednesday.

Unrest:  14  suspects  wanted  in  connection  to  death  of  cleaner. A  senior  inspector  said  police  do  not  rule  out  more  arrests  in  the  case,  adding  a  HK$800,000  (US$103,230)  reward  for  information  on  the  case  is  still  valid.

Social  worker  jailed  for  1  year  for  impeding  law  enforcement. A  social  worker  was  sentenced  to  one  year  in  prison  Wednesday  for  obstructing  law  enforcement  during  an  unauthorized  assembly​  on  July  27,  2019.

PBOC  to  issue  10b  yuan  bills  in  Hong  Kong. The  bills  will  be  issued  through  a  platform  of  the  HKMA,  according  to  a  statement  on  the  website  of  the  People's  Bank  of  China.
Disconnected,  marooned  in  a  world  of  their  own. People  with  autism  feel  rejected,  struggling  to  communicate  with  the  world  around  them.

HK  to  'remain  financial  hub'  despite  possible  US  sanctions. An  economist  said  the  sanctions,  which  would  revoke  HK's  tariff  privileges  or  tighten  US  export  controls  over  HK,  will  have  "almost  no  effect"  on  the  economy.
Lam  warns  against  smearing  proposed  national  security  law. Carrie  Lam  said  those  who  smear  and  demonize  the  proposed  national  security  law  are  enemies  of  Hong  Kong  people.
HKTDC  predicts  10pc  fall  in  HK  exports. New  survey  by  the  trade  promotion  body  finds  coronavirus  has  affected  nearly  98  percent  of  respondents'  businesses.

HK  jobless  rate  hits  15-year  high  amid  COVID-19,  unrest. The  jobless  rate  rose  to  5.9  percent  for  the  March-to-May  period  while  the  underemployment  rate  climbed  to  3.5  percent,  the  highest  in  almost  17  years.

Competitiveness:  HKSAR  govt  stresses  importance  of  stability. The  HKSAR  government  stressed  the  importance  of  stability  as  the  city  was  ranked  three  places  down  globally  in  terms  of  competitiveness.

HK  unemployment  rises  for  8th  straight  month  to  highest  level  in  15  years. This  signals  further  deterioration  of  the  city's  labor  market  prospects  already  slammed  by  the  pandemic  and  political  turmoil.

HK  to  allow  gatherings  of  up  to  50  people  as  virus  curbs  ease. HK  will  let  groups  of  up  to  50  people  meet  from  Friday,  easing  an  earlier  limit  of  8  people,  after  reporting  only  a  small  number  of  virus  cases  in  recent  weeks.

HK  drops  to  5th  position  in  global  competitiveness  ranking. Singapore  was  the  most  competitive  economy  for  the  second  year  in  a  row,    according  to  an  annual  ranking  from  the  Institute  for  Management  Development.

HK  CE  warns  against  smearing  national  security  law. Lam  warned  those  who  have  smeared  the  proposed  national  security  law,  saying  by  doing  so,  they  are  making  themselves  enemies  of  HK  people.

3  opposition  lawmakers  to  pay  HK$252k  for  smearing  LegCo. LegCo  will  solicit  over  HK$252,000  from  Hui  Chi-fung,  Chu  Hoi-dick  &  Chan  Chi-chuen  for  smearing  the  complex  in  their  bid  to  foil  meetings,  LegCo's  head  said.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  2.39%  higher. The  benchmark  Hang  Seng  Index  traded  between  24,302.25  and  24,534.77.  Turnover  totaled  HK$114.63  billion  (about  US$14.79  billion).

HK  shares  national  security  responsibility,  official  says. The  proposed  national  security  legislation  for  HK  will  help  the  SAR  to  guarantee  its  long-term  prosperity  and  stability,  said  a  HKMAO  deputy  director.

Experts:  Proposed  law  to  boost  'one  country,  two  systems'. The  proposed  national  security  law  for  Hong  Kong  will  further  improve  the  implementation  of  "one  country,  two  systems",  legal  heavyweights  say.

Campaign  launches  petition  to  defend  HK. The  campaign  came  as  some  countries,  in  particular  the  US,  continue  to  criticize  the  central  govt's  decision  to  enact  a  national  security  law  in  the  HKSAR.

Cafe  de  Coral  reports  87.1%  fall  in  annual  net  profit. ​The  company's  profit  attributable  to  shareholders  plunged  to  HK$73.6m  for  the  year  that  ended  on  March  31  while  revenue  dropped  by  6.2%  to  HK$7.96b.

Lam:  Proposed  security  law  to  restore  stability  in  Hong  Kong. Carrie  Lam  said  that  a  proposed  national  security  legislation  will  protect  life  and  property  as  well  as  basic  rights  and  freedoms  of  an  overwhelming  majority  of  residents.

Firms  line  up  for  HK  IPO  after  Asia's  biggest  week  for  listings. Companies  are  lining  up  to  list  in  Hong  Kong  as  a  dry  spell  for  initial  public  offerings  comes  to  an  abrupt  end  with  two  multi-billion  dollar  listings.

HK  reports  three  more  COVID-19  cases,  tally  at  1,112. The  Centre  for  Health  Protection  (CHP)  reported  on  Monday  that  the  new  cases  involved  two  women  and  one  man  who  came  from  Indonesia  and  Russia.

HK  Disneyland  to  reopen  on  June  18  with  virus  precautions. The  theme  park  will  reopen  to  a  reduced  number  of  visitors  and  with  enhanced  health  measures  after  the  virus  outbreak  forced  it  to  close  in  late  January.

'HK  has  duty  to  safeguard  national  security'. The  proposed  national  security  legislation  will  become  an  amulet  for  the  HKSAR  to  guarantee  its  prosperity  and  stability,  a  HKMAO  deputy  director  said.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  2.16%  lower. The  Hang  Seng  Index  traded  between  23,684.96  and  24,242.97.  Turnover  totaled  about  US$16.52  billion.

Traders  gear  up  for  HK  to  defend  dollar  peg  for  7th  day. The  HKMA  sold  HK$1.43b  (US$185m)  of  local  dollars  on  Friday,  taking  the  total  since  it  began  intervening  in  April  to  HK$49.45b  to  defend  the  dollar  peg.

New  direct  flights  to  HK  help  Aussie  farmers  overcome  slump. Cathay  Pacific  has  opened  a  new  freight  route  from  Southeast  Queensland  to  Hong  Kong,  helping  Australian  farmers  export  their  farm  produce.

HKEX  chairman  supportive  of  proposed  security  law. The  proposed  security  law  will  bring  stability  without  jeopardizing  HK's  core  values,  Hong  Kong  Exchanges  &  Clearing  Ltd  Chairman  Laura  Cha  said.

HK  people  urged  to  unite  to  stop  foreign  interference. HK's  political  leaders  appealed  to  local  residents  to  stand  with  the  nation  to  counter  foreign  interference  in  HK  affairs  by  backing  the  proposed  security  law.

Call  to  boycott  schools  draws  denunciation  in  Hong  Kong. The  criticism  came  as  Joshua  Wong  organized  an  online  ballot  to  rally  support  for  strikes  and  class  boycotts  to  oppose  the  national  security  legislation.

Ocean  Park  reopens,  after  four  months'  suspension. Ocean  Park  resumed  operations  Saturday  after  remaining  temporarily  closed  for  more  than  four  months  due  to  the  COVID-19  epidemic.

Calls  for  young  students  to  boycott  school  'shameful'. Leading  political  and  education  groups  criticized  a  planned  online  ballot  that  aimed  to  rally  support  for  secondary  students  to  boycott  school.

Tailoring  law  for  HK  in  line  with  'one  country,  two  systems'. A  national  security  law  tailor-made  for  Hong  Kong  is  in  line  with  the  policy  of  safeguarding  the  "one  country,  two  systems"  principle,  said  experts.

Education  chief  pledges  efforts  on  HK  education  reform. Kevin  Yeung  vowed  to  double  down  on  school  reforms  as  radical  groups  called  for  students  to  boycott  classes  over  a  proposed  national  security  law  for  HK.

Finance  chief:  Hong  Kong  can  cope  with  sanctions. The  Hong  Kong  government  has  a  contingency  plan  in  place  to  cope  with  possible  US  sanctions  on  US  dollar  clearing  in  Hong  Kong,  said  Paul  Chan.

National  security  law  sets  to  right  the  wrongs  in  Hong  Kong. Nearly  2.93  million  HK  residents  signed  a  petition  in  support  of  the  national  security  legislation  for  the  city  during  an  eight-day  campaign  starting  on  May  24.

20  years  on,  HKEX  surges  over  40  times  in  market  cap. HKEX's  market  capitalization  currently  stood  at  HK$375.53  billion  on  Friday,  up  from  HK$8.59  billion  at  the  end  of  2000,  according  to  an  HKEX  statement.

HK  defends  dollar  peg  for  6th  day,  longest  run  since  2014. The  Hong  Kong  Monetary  Authority  sold  HK$1.434  billion  worth  of  local  dollars  on  Friday,  taking  the  total  since  it  began  intervening  in  April  to  HK$49.45  billion.

Police  arrest  43  in  unlawful  assemblies  across  the  territory. Police  said  43  people  were  arrested  on  Friday  evening  on  suspicion  of  participating  in  unlawful  assemblies  and  other  charges  in  various  parts  of  HK.

China  rails  against  UK  report  on  HKSAR. A  Chinese  government  spokesperson  slammed  the  UK  government's  latest  report  on  HK,  urging  it  to  cease  any  form  of  interference  in  HK  affairs.

Call  for  easier  voting  access  for  the  elderly. Residents  urged  the  Electoral  Affairs  Commission  to  allow  for  special  queues  for  the  elderly  and  for  wheelchair  access  ahead  of  the  LegCo  elections  on  Sept  6.

Political  strike  planned  by  HK  civil  servants  union  condemned. The  HKSAR  govt  strongly  condemned  a  labor  union  planning  to  stage  a  political  strike  in  protest  at  the  national  security  legislation  for  Hong  Kong.

HK  schools  need  lessons  on  national  identity. The  education  system  in  the  HKSAR  should  be  brought  back  on  track  to  fit  the  "one  country,  two  systems"  principle,  the  central  government  said.

Anthem  ordinance  comes  into  effect. The  HKSAR  government  gazetted  the  National  Anthem  Ordinance  on  Friday,  making  it  an  offense  to  insult  or  offend  China's  national  anthem  in  the  SAR.

HK-listed  companies  buying,  selling  greater  percentage  of  businesses  in  Bay  Area. The  ongoing  economic  integration  of  the  Bay  Area  has  boosted  the  buying  and  selling  of  businesses  in  the  region.

HK  index  firm  lifts  weighting  cap  for  dual-class  shares. ​HK's  index  compiler  is  scrapping  a  weighting  limit  for  dual-class  shares  on  some  of  its  gauges,  in  a  move  seen  as  paving  the  way  for  more  tech  stocks.

Inquiries  up  in  street-level  shops  on  stability  hopes. Inquiries  for  buying  and  leasing  street-level  shops  have  jumped  since  the  national  security  legislation  was  proposed,  said  realtors.

HKMAO,  liaison  office  urge  HK  to  improve  education  system. The  Hong  Kong  and  Macao  Affairs  Office  and  liaison  office  said  education  system  in  the  HKSAR  must  be  in  line  with  "one  country,  two  systems".

HK  sees  1  more  COVID-19  case,  tally  at  1,108. The  new  patient  was  a  58-year-old  woman,  whose  brother  and  his  wife  were  diagnosed  at  the  end  of  May,  according  to  the  Center  for  Health  Protection.
Hong  Kong  Coalition  reveals  latest  plans  to  help  HK  businesses. ​This  includes  promotional  material  on  its  website  designed  to  help  retailers  and  restaurants.
Inside  the  US$5  billion  'Apollo'  deal  to  salvage  Cathay  Pacific. ​The  code  name  was  “Apollo.”  Its  mission  was  to  keep  Cathay  Pacific  Airways  Ltd  alive.

HK  and  S'pore  to  face  off  over  mainland  stock  futures. SGX  is  currently  the  only  overseas  platform  where  investors  can  trade  mainland  A-share  futures,  but  the  HKEX  is  working  on  a  similar  tool.

HKSAR  govt,  commissioner's  office  oppose  UK's  report  on  HK. The  govt  strongly  objected  to  a  British  govt  report  that  alleged  that  a  proposed  national  security  law  will  be  "in  direct  conflict"  with  Article  23  of  the  Basic  Law.

Online  revolution:  Can  HK  shake  off  its  old  mindset?. Once  seen  as  too  slow  in  jumping  aboard  the  internet  bandwagon,  Hong  Kong  is  now  standing  at  the  forefront  of  a  citywide  online  experiment.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.73%  lower. The  benchmark  Hang  Seng  Index  traded  between  23,895.03  and  24,317.72.  Turnover  totaled  about  US$14.90  billion.

High  Court  upholds  travel  ban  of  media  tycoon  Jimmy  Lai. The  ban  was  imposed  when  Jimmy  Lai  was  granted  bail  after  pleading  not  guilty  to  one  count  of  criminal  intimidation  last  month.

There’s  just  no  place  like  home. Despite  a  year  of  unprecedented  street  protests,  the  current  economic  recession  and  the  coronavirus  shock,  HK's  housing  market  fundamentals  remain  sound.

All  goes  virtual  as  virus  rips  up  public  life. Due  to  the  COVID-19  pandemic,  businesses  and  exhibitors  turned  to  the  internet  to  promote  their  products  and  services  through  online  events.

Mainland  internet  firms  consider  secondary  listings  in  HK. More  of  such  firms  that  are  listed  in  the  US  may  mull  secondary  listings  in  HK  as  it  would  ease  regulatory  risks  and  expand  their  investor  base,  analysts  said.

Parents,  teachers  decry  'ballot'  on  boycotting  classes. Hong  Kong  parents  and  teachers  objected  to  a  "referendum"  on  whether  to  boycott  classes  over  the  proposed  national  security  law.

Proposed  security  law  needed  to  'end  chaos  in  HK'. Martin  Liao  Cheung-kong,  convener  of  the  pro-establishment  lawmakers  in  LegCo,  hopes  the  law  can  be  enacted  soon  so  as  to  deliver  a  deterrent  effect.
HK:  National  Anthem  Ordinance  takes  effect  Friday. The  national  anthem  bill  will  come  into  immediate  effect  after  it  is  gazetted  on  Friday,  according  to  the  government.

Alibaba,  ByteDance  'to  expand'  in  HK  as  banks  pull  back. Chinese  mainland  tech  firms  are  expanding  their  footprint  in  HK  even  as  some  banks  consider  scaling  back  in  the  world's  most  expensive  office  market.

Mainland  gaming  giant  NetEase  soars  in  HK  debut. Shares  in  the  mainland's  biggest  gaming  firm  after  Tencent  closed  at  HK$130  on  its  first  day  of  trading  in  HK,  trading  as  high  as  HK$135.2  during  the  day.

Hong  Kong  Coalition  launches  campaign  to  support  economy. The  Hong  Kong  Coalition​  launched  a  campaign  to  stimulate  consumer  spending  and  support  Hong  Kong's  economy  and  employment.

JD  said  to  raise  US$3.9b  in  year's  second-largest  listing. At  US$3.9b,  JD's  Hong  Kong  share  sale  is  set  to  be  the  world's  second-largest  after  Beijing-Shanghai  High  Speed  Railway  raised  US$4.3b  in  January.

Key  NPC  member:  Views  from  HK  to  be  extensively  heard. Key  NPC  member  Zhang  Yong  said  views  from  Hong  Kong  compatriots  will  be  extensively  heard  in  the  drafting  of  the  proposed  national  security  laws.

HK  defends  dollar  peg  for  5th  day  amid  strong  inflows. The  HKMA  sold  HK$3.72b  (US$480m)  worth  of  local  dollars  on  Wednesday,  taking  the  total  since  it  began  intervening  in  April  to  HK$48.1b.

British  businesses  urged  to  view  HK  legislation  objectively. Chinese  Ambassador  to  the  UK  Liu  Xiaoming  made  the  remarks  during  a  session  on  China's  "two  sessions"  with  Chinese  &  British  business  community.

Commerce  secretary  certain  can  overcome  potential  US  action. Edward  Yau  said  that  the  HK  economy  will  be  able  to  remain  on  track  for  sustainable  development  with  its  resilience  and  sound  fundamentals.

Security  law  for  HK  to  'boost  Article  23  legislation'. John  Lee  Ka-chiu  said  the  move  by  the  NPC  to  enact  a  national  security  law  for  HK  will  facilitate  HK's  local  legislation  under  Article  23  of  the  Basic  Law.

Beijing  opposes  US  interference  in  HKSAR  affairs. China  urged  the  US  to  correctly  look  at  the  national  security  legislation  for  the  HKSAR  and  stop  using  it  as  an  excuse  to  interfere  in  China's  internal  affairs.

HK  public  figures  show  support  for  national  security  legislation. The  national  security  legislation  for  HKSAR  shows  the  central  govt's  earnest  care  for  the  SAR's  long-term  interests,  Hong  Kong  public  figures  said.

LegCo  election  slated  for  Sept  6,  nomination  period  July  18-31. The  current  council  will  stand  prorogued  on  July  18  and  its  operation  will  then  be  terminated,  a  spokesman  for  the  SAR  government  said.

Tide  turning  for  HK  stocks  at  50%  discount  to  S&P  500. The  Hang  Seng  Index  is  about  50  percent  cheaper  than  the  S&P  500  on  a  price-to-earnings  basis,  the  biggest  discount  since  at  least  2005.

China  rebukes  Pompeo's  swipe  at  HSBC  over  legislation. ​China  urged  the  US  to  correctly  look  at  the  national  security  legislation  for  the  HKSAR  and  stop  using  it  as  an  excuse  to  interfere  in  China's  internal  affairs

CE:  HK  set  to  further  relax  virus  curbs,  border  control  measures. In  a  Facebook  post  issued  on  Tuesday  evening,  Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  said  the  COVID-19  epidemic  situation  in  the  city  continues  to  stabilize.

HKMA  sells  HK$2.2b  to  defend  currency  peg. ​Analysts  said  a  stronger  HK  dollar  may  be  due  to  large  capital  inflows  following  recent  secondary  listings  by  mainland  tech  giants  in  the  city.
Hong  Kong  reports  no  new  COVID-19  cases. The  total  number  of  COVID-19  infections  in  Hong  Kong  remained  at  1,107,  according  to  the  Centre  for  Health  Protection.
HK  fund  managers  urged  to  boost  tech  investment,  ESG  principles. A  ​KPMG/  HKIFA  survey  says  this  is  vital  to  ensure  the  industry  remains  competitive  over  the  next  5  years.

Police  arrest  family  of  3  as  gun  seized,  warn  of  terrorism  threat. Police  said  the  components  of  the  gun  were  likely  bought  from  overseas  on  online  platforms  and  airmailed  to  Hong  Kong.

After  rollicking  start,  Cathay  Pacific  shares  return  to  earth. Cathay  Pacific  expects  to  repay  the  HK  govt  for  the  HK$19.5  billion  of  preference  shares,  part  of  the  airline's  bailout  plan,  over  a  period  of  3  to  5  years.

Six  things  you  need  to  know  about  HK  security  legislation. The  Foreign  Ministry  has  published  a  text  on  its  website  pointing  out  six  typical  falsehoods  about  the  legislation  and  facts  that  the  public  need  to  know.
HK  police  arrest  53  during  fresh  protests. Police  said  on  Wednesday  that  36  males  and  17  females  had  been  arrested  during  protests  on  Tuesday  evening.

HK  fund  managers  bullish  on  city's  leading  hub  status. Hong  Kong  money  managers  see  a  spike  in  assets  in  the  next  five  years,  with  many  expecting  an  increase  of  up  to  30  percent.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.03%  lower. The  Hang  Seng  Index  lost  7.49  points  to  close  at  25,049.73  points  on  Wednesday.

Wang  Yi:  Proposed  national  security  law  for  HK  a  litmus  test. Chinese  State  Councilor  and  Foreign  Minister  Wang  Yi  made  the  remark  in  a  phone  conversation  with  UK  Foreign  Secretary  Dominic  Raab  on  Monday.
Lam:  'No  change'  in  Beijing's  HK  policy. Carrie  Lam  said  that  the  policy  is  enshrined  through  the  establishment  of  the  HKSAR  and  repeatedly  stressed  by  State  leaders.

Residents  urged  not  to  take  part  in  unauthorized  assemblies. Police  also  condemned  malicious  and  irresponsible  online  messages  which  incited  others  to  attack  police  officers  with  the  use  of  petrol  bombs.

CE:  No  change  in  central  govt  policy  towards  HK. Carrie  Lam  made  the  remarks  when  a  reporter  asked  her  whether  the  central  govt  had  shifted  its  position  on  the  "one  country,  two  systems"  principle.

HK:  Secondary  3-5  cross-border  students  to  resume  classes. Secondary  3-5  cross-border  students  will  be  allowed  to  return  to  resume  classes  from  June  15,  the  Education  Bureau  announced.
HK  govt  to  bail  out  Cathay  with  HK$39  billion  rescue  package. Financial  secretary  says  airline's  woes  threaten  HK's  status  as  leading  global  aviation  hub.

Cathay  plans  HK$39  billion  govt-backed  recapitalization. The  govt  will  buy  HK$19.5  billion  of  preferential  shares  and  provide  a  HK$7.8  billion  bridge  loan,  while  HK$11.7  billion  will  be  raised  by  rights  issued.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  1.13%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  280.45  points,  or  1.13  percent,  to  25,057.22  points.

Greater  'one  country,  two  systems'  leeway  for  HK  seen. With  such  leeway,  HK  could  thrive  again  via  making  the  most  of  the  advantages  brought  by  "one  country,  two  systems"  principle,  said  an  HKMAO  official.

Teen  among  2  arrested  in  HK  on  suspicion  of  making  explosives. A  16-year-old  teenager  and  a  52-year-old  woman  were  arrested  in  Hong  Kong  on  the  suspicion  of  making  or  possessing  explosives,  police  said.

HK  reports  1  new  COVID-19  case,  1,107  in  all. Hong  Kong's  Center  for  Health  Protection  reported  one  more  COVID-19  case,  taking  the  total  number  of  confirmed  cases  in  Hong  Kong  to  1,107.

Ocean  Park  to  reopen  Saturday,  Disneyland  'soon'. Ocean  Park  will  reopen  Saturday  while  the  HK  Book  Fair  will  be  held  from  July  15  to  July  21  as  scheduled,  said  HKSAR  Commerce  Secretary  Edward  Yau.

HK  share  sale  bonanza  on  track  as  JD  is  oversubscribed. JD.com's  share  sale  of  US$4.1b  is  multiple  times  oversubscribed  by  institutional  investors  and  is  set  to  be  the  world's  second  biggest  this  year.

Quarantine  relief  for  eligible  executives  of  HK-listed  firms. Directors  or  executives  of  listed  firms  can  seek  quarantine  exemption  when  they  arrive  in  HK  from  the  Chinese  mainland,  subject  to  a  pre-determined  quota.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.03%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  6.36  points,  or  0.03  percent,  to  24,776.77  points.

Registration  for  HK  cash  subsidy  opens  June  21. Payment  processing  will  take  about  a  week  for  electronic  applications  submitted  from  July  1.  Paper  applications  will  take  about  2  weeks.

CE:  Proposed  law  to  enhance  'one  country,  two  systems'. Speaking  at  a  webinar,  Carrie  Lam  expressed  her  confidence  that  HK  will  become  safe  and  stable  again  with  the  enactment  of  the  law.

HK  property  market  proves  resilient  amid  crisis. Despite  a  contracting  economy,  existing  home  prices  have  risen  1.2  percent  this  year,  and  are  the  highest  since  November,  based  on  the  Centaline  index.

DPRK  media:  Measures  taken  by  China  for  HK  reasonable. Any  attempt  to  separate  HK  from  the  Chinese  territory  under  the  signboard  of  "independence"  is  never  acceptable,  said  official  newspaper  Rodong  Sinmun.

Former  security  chief  denounces  external  meddling. Regina  Ip  said  that  attacks  by  external  forces  on  China's  plans  to  enact  a  national  security  law  in  Hong  Kong  are  baseless  and  wrong.

Luo:  HK  security  legislation  to  protect  people's  rights. The  central  govt  will  press  ahead  with  its  decision  to  enact  a  national  security  law  for  the  HKSAR  while  protecting  citizens'  rights  and  freedoms,  Luo  Huining  said.

Ip:  National  security  law  an  urgent  necessity. Regina  Ip  Lau  Suk-yee,  a  member  of  HK's  Executive  Council,  says  recent  acts  of  violence  and  emergence  of  terrorism  clearly  pose  a  threat  to  national  security.

Webinar  to  be  held  to  mark  Basic  Law  anniversary. A  webinar  will  be  held  by  the  Hong  Kong  Special  Administrative  Region  on  Monday  to  commemorate  the  30th  anniversary  of  the  Basic  Law.

HK  govt  condemns  calls  for  strike,  class  boycott. The  government  condemned  the  call  for  holding  a  strike  and  class  boycott  as  a  referendum  to  oppose  the  proposed  national  security  law  in  Hong  Kong.

'Curbs  on  USD  trading  in  HK  may  hurt  confidence  in  US  assets'. Any  move  to  rattle  Hong  Kong’s  financial  system  will  have  an  enormous  impact  on  global  financial  markets,  the  SAR's  Financial  Secretary  Paul  Chan  warned.

Cheung:  SAR  govt  to  facilitate  NPC  work  on  legislation. The  Hong  Kong  SAR  is  working  in  close  contact  with  central  government  bodies  to  put  the  proposed  national  security  law  into  practice,  said  Matthew  Cheung.

Luo:  Central  govt  firm  to  enact  security  legislation  in  HK. The  remarks  came  as  central  authorities  had  begun  hearing  Hong  Kong  people'  views  on  how  the  national  security  law  should  be  brought  into  practice.

JD  seeks  US$4.1  billion  in  year's  biggest  Hong  Kong  listing. JD.com  is  offering  133  million  new  shares  at  as  much  as  HK$236  each,  according  to  terms  of  the  deal  obtained  by  Bloomberg  News.

Hong  Kong  reports  3  new  imported  COVID-19  cases. The  three  patients,  aged  between  15  and  47,  had  returned  to  Hong  Kong  from  the  UK  or  Pakistan,  according  to  health  officials  at  a  press  briefing.

National  security  law  'urgently  needed'  in  the  city. A  former  HK  police  chief  said  the  city    urgently  needs  a  national  security  law  to  take  on  the  city's  violence,  which  is  already  verging  on  "terrorism  in  nature".

Squad  with  national  security  agencies  'not  novel  to  HK’. Ex-HK  police  commissioner  Andy  Tsang  Wai-hung  said  that  a  special  squad  made  up  of  the  national  &  local  level  security  agencies  would  not  be  new  for  HK.

Educating  HK  public  about  national  security  law  'crucial'. ​National  legislators  and  political  advisers  in  HK  have  highlighted  the  importance  of  strengthening  education  on  and  promoting  the  national  security  law.

HK's  investment  allure  is  'intact'. Hong  Kong's  allure  as  a  global  financial  hub  remains  intact  despite  the  fallout  from  the  virus,    said  a  top  executive  from  a  State-owned  conglomerate.

Liaison  office  collects  opinions  on  national  security  legislation. The  liaison  office  has  collected  more  than  130  opinions  form  the  HK  deputies  to  the  NPC  and  members  of  the  National  Committee  of  the  CPPCC.

HK  justice  chief  allays  concerns  on  proposed  security  law. The  Chinese  mainland  and  the  HKSAR  share  fundamental  principles  safeguarding  national  security,  said  the  city's  justice  chief  Teresa  Cheng.

Councilors  to  boycott  opposition  peers'  'illegitimate'  meeting. District  Councilors  from  the  opposition  camp  has  organized  a  meeting  to  discuss  a  proposed  national  security  law  for  the  HKSAR  on  Saturday

HKEX  chief  backs  national  security  law  for  SAR. Charles  Li  said  the  law  won't  have  a  substantial  long-term  negative  impact  on  the  city’s  status  as  a  global  financial  center,  as  feared  by  critics.

HKMA  intervenes  to  defend  peg  as  HK  dollar  inflows  surge. The  pegged  Hong  Kong  dollar  climbed  to  the  strong  end  of  its  permitted  trading  band  late  Thursday  US  time,  prompting  intervention  by  the  Hong  Kong  Monetary  Authority.

PBOC  says  it  supports  HKSAR's  role  as  a  financial  center. The  PBOC  will  work  to  maintain  HK's  economic  and  financial  stability  and  prosperity,  according  to  a  statement  posted  on  the  institution's  website.

NetEase  'to  raise  US$2.7  billion'  in  Hong  Kong  listing. NetEase  priced  171  million  new  shares  at  HK$123  each,  to  a  2%  discount  to  its  Thursday  closing  price  on  Nasdaq,  said  people  familiar  with  the  matter.

Mainland  online  mall  JD.com  files  for  HK  second  listing. JD.com  filed  a  preliminary  prospectus  on  Friday  with  the  HK  stock  exchange  and  the  company  could  launch  the  offering  to  raise  at  least  US$2  billion  next  week.

Li:  Mainland  firms  to  make  beeline  for  HK  second  listing. Mainland  companies  have  been  facing  political  pressure  in  the  US  since  the  national  security  legislation  for  HK  was  proposed.

In  vogue  online  —  starting  with  toilet  paper  rolls. Online  shopping  takes  off  in  Hong  Kong  as  residents  scramble  to  stock  up  on  basic  necessities  during  the  COVID-19  pandemic  and  supermarkets  struggle  to  keep  up  with  the  demand.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  1.66%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  404.11  points,  or  1.66  percent,  to  24,770.41  points.

So  just  stay  where  you  are  for  the  time  being. Domestic  travel  have  taken  the  front  seat  on  the  Chinese  mainland  since  it  emerged  from  the  lockdown,  driven  by  pent-up  demand  from  vacation-starved  trippers.

The  smart  money  is  on  the  wiser  bets. In  times  of  adversity,  investors  seem  to  have  become  all  the  wiser  managing  their  wealth,  and  know  when  and  where  to  bet  their  bottom  dollar.

Satellite  offices  seen  as  post-pandemic  trend  for  enterprises. As  businesses  across  HK  resume  operations,  landlords  will  face  new  challenges  from  prospective  tenants  whose  office-space  requirements  have  changed  in  the  wake  of  COVID-19.

Travel  in  the  future  —  it  wouldn’t  be  on  the  fly. Experts  say  in  a  post-coronavirus  world,  tourism  industry’s  greatest  priority  will  be  guaranteeing  the  health  and  safety  concerns  of  travelers.
HK  legislators  pass  National  Anthem  Bill. Hong  Kong’s  legislature  passed  the  long­-delayed  National  Anthem  Bill  on  Thursday,  which  outlaws  insults  to  China’s  national  anthem.

Expats:  US  sanctions  against  Hong  Kong  a  mistake. The  sanctions  US  plans  to  impose  on  HK  over  national  security  legislation  for  the  city  are  a  mistake,  and  the  US  will  be  the  biggest  loser  from  the  move,  expats  say.

Beijing  appreciates  global  support  for  HK  security  law. Foreign  Ministry  spokesperson  Zhao  Lijian  urged  certain  countries  to  discard  ideological  prejudice  and  view  China's  decision  in  an  objective  manner.

HK  sees  6  new  cases,  residents  evacuated  from  Sha  Tin  building. Apart  from  five  imported  cases,  there  is  one  local  case  involving  a  man  who  lived  in  the  building  in  Sha  Tin  where  six  local  infections  have  been  found  earlier.

Central  govt  backs  HK  to  keep  separate  customs  territory. The  Ministry  of  Commerce  voiced  the  central  govt's  support  following  US  President  Trump's  decision  to  revoke  the  HKSAR's  preferential  trade  status.
LegCo  passes  national  anthem  bill  after  opposition  stunt. Opposition  lawmakers  disrupted  the  meeting  by  throwing  a  foul-smelling  liquid  in  the  chamber  at  around  1  pm.

HK  firms  currently  raising  funds  at  fastest  pace  all  year. Seven  companies  have  raised  a  total  of  US$1.76  billion  this  week,  the  most  both  in  terms  of  number  of  deals  and  amount  since  the  start  of  the  year.

HK  shares  edge  up  as  HSBC,  StanChart  back  security  law. HK  stocks  rose  Thursday  after  HSBC  &  StanChart  backed  the  national  security  law,  easing  concerns  over  the  law's  impact  on  the  local  business  community.

2nd  batch  of  HK  residents  stranded  in  India  brought  home. A  flight  from  Mumbai  arrived  at  Hong  Kong  International  Airport  on  Thursday  morning,  carrying  about  300  passengers,  including  pregnant  women  and  children.

Commissioner's  Office  slams  UK  politicians'  wanton  remarks. A  spokesperson  said  Hong  Kong  residents  now  enjoy  democratic  rights  and  freedoms  unimaginable  under  British  colonial  rule.

Security  legislation  for  HKSAR  will  not  affect  rights,  freedoms. The  legislation  will  only  target  a  very  small  number  of  people  whose  criminal  acts  endanger  national  security,  Vice-Premier  Han  Zheng  said.
Legal  experts  seek  clarity  in  security  law. Hong  Kong's  legal  experts  also  called  for  offenses  to  be  specified  to  better  comply  with  the  city's  legal  system.

Vittachi  exposes  Western  hypocrisy  over  legislation. HK-based  author  Nury  Vittachi  voiced  concern  about  "double  standards"  shown  by  Western  politicians  over  the  national  security  legislation  for  HK.

HSBC,  Jardines  back  proposed  security  law  for  HKSAR. Peter  Wong  signed  a  petition  in  support  of  the  proposed  legislation,  according  to  comments  posted  on  the  bank's  official  WeChat  account.

Finance  chief:  HK  well-prepared,  fearless  in  face  of  US  threats. Paul  Chan  said  the  impact  of  the  US  revoking  Hong  Kong's  special  customs  status  would  be  limited  as  the  super  power  has  huge  interests  in  the  city.

HK-ASEAN  free  trade  agreement  effective  on  July  4  for  Indonesia. Once  the  pact  comes  into  force  with  Indonesia,  there  will  be  a  total  of  8  ASEAN  member  states  with  free  trade  and  investment  pacts  with  HK.

Justice  chief:  Security  law  will  not  affect  HK's  legal  system. Teresa  Cheng  refuted  ungrounded  claims  that  the  national  security  law  will  undermine  Hong  Kong's  common  law  system  and  judicial  independence.

Protest  against  HK  Bar  Association  letter  to  American  Bar  Association. Simon  Chiu  said  that  the  Hong  Kong  Bar  Association  is  currently  engaged  in  a  campaign  in  inviting  global  interference  into  Hong  Kong  affairs  in  the  name  of  the  "Rule  of  Law"  on  matters  which  they  consider  objectionable.

HK's  private  sector  contraction  slows  in  May. The  seasonally  adjusted  IHS  Markit  Hong  Kong  Purchasing  Managers’  Index    rose  to  43.9  in  May  from  36.9  in  April,  its  highest  in  four  months.

Lam:  Beijing  to  welcome  diverse  views  on  framing  legislation. CE  Carrie  Lam  made  the  remarks  after  offering  views  on  the  proposed  national  security  law  to  the  central  government  in  a  three-hour  meeting  in  Beijing.

Report:  HK  AmCham  employees  allege  unfair  dismissal. The  three  employees  alleged  that  AmCham  president  Tara  Joseph  dismissed  them  after  they  leaked  confidential  information  about  her  pay.

HK  tycoon  Li's  HKT  said  to  mull  US$1b  unit  sale. HKT  Ltd,  which  is  controlled  by  tycoon  Richard  Li,  is  said  to  be  considering  selling  PCCW  Global,  which  could  be  valued  at  as  much  as  US$1  billion.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  1.37%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  329.68  points,  or  1.37  percent,  to  24,325.62  points.
Hong  Kong  stocks  recover  from  US$210  billion  selloff. The  Hang  Seng  Index  closed  up  1.4  percent  on  Wednesday,  surpassing  its  24,280.03-point  close  from  May  21.

HK  hedge  fund  offers  100%  coverage  on  losses  for  a  fee. Infini  Capital  Management  Ltd  is  offering  to  cover  any  losses  in  exchange  for  a  performance  fee  as  high  as  50  percent,  more  than  double  the  industry  standard.
Tam  backs  mainland  agency  for  national  security  in  HKSAR. Mainland  personnel  are  more  experienced  in  dealing  with  national  security  investigations,  Tam  Yiu-chung  pointed  out.

Security  law  ensures  prosperity  for  HK. China's  proposed  national  security  legislation  for  HK  will  not  only  keep  the  city  politically  stable  but  also  secure  its  standing  as  a  global  financial  center.

Security  legislation  needed  in  Hong  Kong,  Lam  says. Carrie  Lam  and  high-level  officials  are  to  visit  Beijing  Wednesday  to  offer  views  on  the  proposed  legislation  being  drafted  by  the  Standing  Committee  of  the  NPC.

NPC  deputy  decries  US  hypocrisy  over  riots. Tam  Yiu-chung  says  US  politicians’  different  attitudes  toward  violent  protests  in  HK  and  the  riots  in  the  US  showed  their  double  standards.

Security  law  needed  to  'tackle  dire  situation'. Central  authorities  are  determined  to  enact  such  a  law  for  HK  as  national  security  in  HK  is  on  the  verge  of  being  compromised,  Tam  Yiu-chung  said.

Lam:  Foreign  sanctions  'double  standards'. The  CE  said  foreign  sanctions  over  the  proposed  national  security  law  represent  double  standards  and  are  acts  of  "double  swords"  that  would  backfire.

Philippine  govt  says  HKSAR  affairs  'purely  Chinese  matter'. Philippine  Presidential  Spokesperson  Harry  Roque  said  "we  respect  the  exercise  of  China's  sovereignty  over  Hong  Kong."

NetEase  starts  taking  investor  orders  for  its  US$2.6b  HK  float. NetEase  said  it  would  make  its  debut  on  June  11.  Pricing  at  HK$126  a  share  would  give  it  a  market  valuation  of  over  HK$21  billion.

HK  extends  gathering,  entry  curbs  as  new  cluster  emerges. Hong  Kong  will  extend  eight-person  limit  on  group  gatherings  by  two  weeks  and  restrictions  on  foreign  visitors  by  another  three  months.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  1.11%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  263.42  points,  or  1.11  percent,  to  23,995.94  points.

HKJC  vows  to  continue  helping  city  during  pandemic. The  Hong  Kong  Jockey  Club  is  working  on  a  US$12.9m  virus  relief  fund  to  offer  assistance  to  the  elderly,  the  needy  and  students  in  local  communities.

HKMA  says  deposits  stable  according  to  large  banks'  data. Eddie  Yue  made  the  remarks  after  the  city's  financial  secretary  said  the  People's  Bank  of  China  could  help  HK  defend  the  peg  with  the  US  dollar  if  needed.

China's  US  envoy:  New  security  law  will  make  HK  safer  place. Cui  Tiankai  offered  reassurance  to  US  citizens  living  in  HK  after  reports  were  rife  in  some  foreign  media  over  China's  national  security  legislation  for  HK.

China  says  US  scheme  to  impede  its  development  'to  fail'. Foreign  Ministry  spokesperson  Zhao  Lijian  said  any  attempt  by  the  US  to  harm  China's  interests  will  be  met  with  resolute  countermeasures.

Hong  Kong's  retail  sales  continue  to  slump  in  April. HK  retail  sales  continued  to  decline  in  April  due  to  the  pandemic  and  violent  incidents  since  last  year,  with  sales  in  department  stores  dropping  18  percent.

Liaison  Office  opposes  US  interference  in  HK  affairs. The  Liaison  Office  voiced  resolute  opposition  to  the  US  interference  in  Hong  Kong  affairs  and  urged  the  US  side  to  correct  the  wrongdoing.

​Security  chief:  Hong  Kong  preparing  for  new  law. The  city's  government  has  started  preparatory  work  to  implement  the  national  security  law  for  Hong  Kong  once  it  is  enacted,  John  Lee  Ka-chiu  said.
US  sanctions  on  HK  blasted. HKMAO  said  the  national  security  legislation  for  Hong  Kong  won't  undermine  the  city's  autonomy.
Liaison  office:  US  sanctions  against  HK  will  backfire. A  spokesperson  for  the  office  said  that  the  city's  economic  status  would  ultimately  not  be  affected  by  the  US  move.

Financial  chief:  National  security  law  to  benefit  HK  in  long  run. Paul  Chan  said  a  national  security  law  for  Hong  Kong  is  urgently  needed  to  preserve  the  city’s  social  economic  and  political  stability.
HK  retail  sales  fall  36.1%  year-on-year  in  April. Slump  a  slight  improvement  from  a  42  percent  decline  in  March  as  pandemic  eases.

China  calls  for  further  support  to  WHO,  rejects  US  power  politics. China  said  the  international  community  disagreed  with  the  "selfish,  responsibility-evading"  US  act  that  is  harmful  to  fight  against  COVID-19.

Hong  Kong  reports  3  new  local  COVID-19  cases. The  HK  Centre  for  Health  Protection    reported  three  new  local  COVID-19  cases  on  Monday--two  women,  aged  36  and  40,  and  a  male  paramedic.

US  to  sell  Hong  Kong  consulate  housing. The  US  State  Department  said  it  was  selling  the  property,  estimated  to  be  worth  US$400  million,  as  part  of  its  global  reinvestment  program.

Nearly  3m  HK  residents  support  national  security  legislation. The  signature  campaign,  launched  on  May  24,  gathered  1.84  million  signatures  at  street  stands  across  HK  while  another  1.09  million  people  signed  online.

UK's  Capco  buys  HK  billionaire's  stake  in  Shaftesbury. Capco  has  agreed  to  buy  the  26.3  percent  stake  in  Shaftesbury  from  Hong  Kong  tycoon  Samuel  Tak  Lee  for  436  million  pounds  (US$540.7  million).

Hong  Kong  stocks  close  3.36%  higher. The  Hang  Seng  Index  rose  as  much  as  3.7  percent  Monday  morning  on  volume  that  was  almost  three  times  the  30-day  average  for  this  time  of  day.

HK  finance  secretary  says  no  plans  to  change  US  dollar  peg. Paul  Chan  said  that  authorities  were  confident  in  defending  the  HK  dollar​  exchange  rate,  adding  that  capital  will  continue  to  flow  freely  in  and  out  of  HK.

Sources:  NetEase  aims  to  raise  US$2-3  billion  in  HK  listing. NetEase’s  deal  will  be  Hong  Kong’s  largest  listing  so  far  in  2020,  according  to  Refinitiv  data,  and  one  of  the  largest  in  the  world,  depending  on  the  final  size.

HKEX  plans  suite  of  new  exchange-traded  products. HKEX  is  considering  4  new  types  of  ETPs,  including  leveraged  and  inverse  products  that  track  mainland  A  share  indexes  and  fixed  income  exchange-traded  funds.

SAR  govt  unconcerned  over  US  sanctions. Hong  Kong's  trade  status  is  guaranteed  by  multiple  international  agreements,  instead  of  being  a  "gift"  from  another  jurisdiction,  a  govt  spokesman  said.

Security  law  in  HK  backed  by  countries. The  DPRK,  Serbia,  Pakistan,  Cuba,  Russia  and  Iran  have  all  voiced  their  support  for  China's  decision  on  national  security  legislation  for  Hong  Kong.

‘Urgent’  need  for  security  law  in  HK. Teresa  Cheng  stresses  it  will  protect  China’s  sovereignty,  territorial  integrity  and    development  interests  after  months  of  violence  and  social  unrest  in  the  SAR.
Cheng  laments  increasing  number  of  young  offenders. The  justice  secretary  warned  that  if  these  young  people  were  convicted,  then  a  criminal  record  would  damage  them  for  life.
Pandemic:  HK  to  bring  home  residents  stranded  in  Nepal. Two  special  flight  are  tentatively  scheduled  to  depart  Kathmandu  Monday  with  about  330  Hong  Kong  residents.

HKMA:  Capable  of  maintaining  monetary,  financial  stability. Hong  Kong's  de  facto  central  bank  made  the  remarks  on  social  media  after  noticing  rumors  that  the  city  might  impose  foreign  exchange  control.

US  scholar:  Law  to  protect  'one  country,  two  systems'  in  HK. It  is  false  to  say  that  by  passing  this  national  security  law  that  'one  country,  two  systems'  is  being  denigrated,  said  Sourabh  Gupta.

HKSAR  govt  refutes  Trump's  claim,  says  sanction  unjustified. The  HKSAR  government  has  refuted  a  claim  by  US  President  Donald  Trump  that  the  financial  hub  now  operated  under  "one  country,  one  system".

Taiwan's  legislature  warned  not  to  interfere  in  HKSAR  affairs. The  spokesperson  was  responding  to  a  so-called  "statement"  by  the  island's  legislature,  which  claims  to  "rescue  Hong  Kong  people"

Envoy  urges  US,  UK  to  stop  interfering  in  HKSAR  affairs. China's  permanent  representative  to  the  UN  has  refuted  the  fallacy  on  the  Hong  Kong  SAR  made  by  the  United  States,  Britain,  and  some  other  countries.

Justice  chief  refutes  claim  that  HKSAR  has  lost  autonomy. The  accusations  Trump  leveled  at  the  practice  of  "one  country,  two  systems"  in  HK  is  a  gross  misrepresentation  of  the  ground  situation,  said  Secretary  for  Justice  Teresa  Cheng.

Residents  brave  rain  to  support  national  security  legislation. Thousands  of  Hong  Kong  residents  braved  heavy  rain  on  Saturday  to  sign  a  petition  in  support  of  the  national  security  legislation  for  the  HKSAR.

Hong  Kong  reports  3  new  imported  COVID-19  cases. All  three  new  patients  returned  to  Hong  Kong  on  Qatar  Airways'  QR818  from  Pakistan  via  Doha,  according  to  the  Centre  for  Health  Protection.

DPRK  supports  China's  decision  on  national  security  legislation. The  DPRK's  Foreign  Ministry  said  it  fully  supports  China's  decision  on  national  security  legislation  for  the  HKSAR,  the  official  KCNA  reported.

​HK  LegCo  approves  HK$5.4b  bailout  for  Ocean  Park. The  bailout  will  be  used  to  support  the  theme  park  to  operate  for  another  12  months,  repay  loans  and  settle  the  costs  for  completing  a  development  project.

China  urges  US  to  stop  political  maneuvers  over  SAR's  legislation. China  has  slammed  the  US  for  demanding  a  conference  by  the  UNSC  on  national  security  legislation  for  HK,  calling  the  US  demand  "utter  nonsense".

Attempts  to  derail  legislation  'violations  of  international  law'. HKSAR  govt  said,  threats  of  sanctions  &  unwarranted  allegations  over  HK's  proposed  national  security  legislation  are  "violations  of  international  law".
Endorsements  pour  in  for  security  bill. Over  2.14  million  people  have  signed  a  petition  in  six  days  in  support  of  the  proposed  law  for  the  Asian  financial  hub.

2,600  celebrities  back  national  security  legislation  for  HK. Movie  stars  Jackie  Chan,  Eric  Tsang,  Kara  Wai  and  singer  Alan  Tam,  along  with  100  arts  and  culture  groups,  have  voiced  their  support  for  the  legislation.

National  security  law  for  HK  'constitutional  and  reasonable'. Critics  are  wrong  to  deny  the  SAR's  responsibility  to  safeguard  national  security  and  even  more  wrong  to  deny  Beijing's  responsibility,  an  expert  says.

Experts:  National  security  law  conducive  to  HK's  stability. An  Australian  professor  with  the  University  of  Hong  Kong  said  the  national  security  law  will  contribute  to  HK's  stability  and  development.

JD.com,  NetEase  'win  Hong  Kong  approval  for  listings'. HKEX  approved  the  secondary  listing  applications  by  the  US-listed  mainland  tech  companies,  according  to  people  familiar  with  the  matter.

Fitch  remains  'confident'  about  HK's  financial  autonomy. The  agency  said  it  believes  HK's  high  degree  of  autonomy  and  allure  as  a  world-renowned  financial  hub  will  be  retained.
HK  overall  exports  down  3.7%  in  April,  exports  to  mainland  up. Economist  warns  of  worse  to  come  due  to  on-going  impact  of  coronavirus  on  US  and  European  markets.

COVID-19:  Hong  Kong  sees  13  new  imported  cases. All  13  patients  were  imported  cases  from  Pakistan,  involving  four  females  and  nine  males,  according  to  Hong  Kong's  Center  for  Health  Protection.

HK  govt  warns  US  that  sanctions  could  be  'double-edged  sword'. A  spokesperson  for  the  HK  govt  said  that  any  sanctions  "will  not  only  harm  the  interests  of  Hong  Kong  but  also  significantly  those  of  the  US".

HK  commerce  chief  says  threatened  sanctions  hurt  both  sides. Scrapping  HK's  special  trade  status  with  the  US,  as  threatened  by  Washington,  would  harm  the  interests  of  both  sides,  the  city's  commerce  chief  said.

Book  on  'one  country,  two  systems'  published. The  Original  Intent  of  "One  Country,  Two  Systems"  –  An  Informal  Chat  on  "One  Country,  Two  Systems",  will  be  available  at  HK  bookstores  from  next  week.

HK  lawyer  beaten  by  mob  for  disapproving  violence,  vandalism. The  Hong  Kong  lawyer,  Chan  Tze-chin,  has  said  every  country  has  national  security  legislation  and  that  is  the  basic  practice  to  protect  the  people.

HK  services  sector  to  gain  more  access  to  mainland  from  June  1. An  amendment  agreement  was  signed  between  HK  and  the  mainland  last  year  to  boost  the  mainland's  level  of  liberalization  on  trade  in  services  for  HK.

Full  text  of  CE's  letter  to  Hong  Kong  citizens. Carrie  Lam  published  a  letter  to  local  citizens  a  day  after  the  third  session  of  the  13th  NPC  adopted  a  decision  on  a  national  security  law  for  Hong  Kong.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.74%  lower. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  down  171.29  points,  or  0.74  percent,  to  22,961.47  points.

Business  sector:  National  security  law  a  guarantee  of  HK's  future. The  decision  by  China's  top  legislature  on  the  national  security  legislation  for  HK  is  welcomed  and  supported  by  the  business  community  in  the  city.

Over  1.85m  HK  residents  sign  petition  supporting  national  security  laws. More  than  1.85m  HK  residents,  including  Chief  Executive  of  the  HKSAR  Carrie  Lam,  have  signed  a  petition  in  support  of  the  national  security  legislation  as  of  Thursday.

National  security  legislation  set  to  bolster  HK  stability. The  legislation  is  designed  to  ensure  steady  implementation  of  "one  country,  two  systems"  in  HKSAR  as  well  as  uphold  its  long-term  stability,  Premier  Li  said.

US  denounced  for  vilifying  security  legislation  for  HK. A  spokesperson  for  the  Commissioner's  Office  said  it  was  "imperious,  unreasonable  and  shameless"  for  US  to  demonize  China's  just  measures.

Parents,  teachers  called  out  as  students  make  up  half  of  arrests. About  80  of  the  396  arrests  made  during  unauthorized  rallies  on  Wednesday  against  the  National  Anthem  Bill  were  juveniles.  The  youngest  was  only  12.

What  foreign  people  in  HK  think  of  national  security  legislation. Three  foreign  people  familiar  with  HK  recognized  the  necessity  of  the  legislation  to  safeguard  national  security  and  stop  prolonged  violence  in  HK.

Carrie  Lam  welcomes  NPC  decision  on  HK  legislation. Lam  said  her  govt  will  fully  cooperate  with  the  Standing  Committee  of  the  NPC  to  complete  the  relevant  work  on  legislation  as  soon  as  possible.

Premier  Li:  'One  country,  two  systems'  faithfully  implemented. Noting  that  it  is  state  policy,  Premier  Li  Keqiang  said  the  central  government  has  been  fully  and  faithfully  implementing  "one  country,  two  systems".

Liaison  Office  welcomes  passage  of  decision  on  national  security  legislation  for  HK. A  spokesman  for  the  office  said  that  the  law  would  contribute  greatly  to  the  city's  long-term  stability  and  prosperity.

Second  reading  of  national  anthem  bill  passed. Under  the  law,  anyone  who  insults  or  belittles  the  dignity  of  the  national  anthem  is  liable  to  a  fine  of  HK$50,000  and  imprisonment  for  three  years.

HK  manufacturers  back  national  security  legislation. Chinese  Manufacturers'  Association  President  Ng  Wang-pun  says  business  interests  will  be  better  protected  in  a  safer,  more  stable  environment.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.72%  lower. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  down  168.60  points,  or  0.72  percent,  to  23,132.76  points.

HK  residents  from  across  societal  spectrum  endorse  NPC  decision. Various  sectors  of  the  HK  society  hailed  the  nation's  top  legislature's  approval  of  a  draft  decision  to  introduce  national  security  legislation  for  Hong  Kong.
NPC  adopts  decision  on  national  security  law  for  HK. The  13th  National  People's  Congress  adopted  the  decision  at  the  closing  meeting  of  its  annual  session  on  Thursday.

HK  regulator:  Banks'  remote  working  raises  operational  risks. The  remarks  from  the  head  of  HK's  top  securities  watchdog  come  as  banks  around  the  world  are  reviewing  practices  put  in  place  during  remote  work.

Tencent  raises  US$6b  in  HK  in  Asia's  biggest  bond  deal  of  '20. The  deal  finalized  early  Thursday  included  a  40-year  debt,  a  term  sheet  showed,  the  first  time  the  firm  raised  40-year  money  in  its  history.
Security  law  to  aid  confidence  in  Hong  Kong. Business  tycoons  in  HK  believed  the  national  security  legislation  would  create  a  more  favorable  business  and  social  environment.

HKSAR  govt:  National  security  law  won't  affect  investors'  rights. A  HKSAR  government  spokesman  has  responded  to  a  statement  by  the  US  Chamber  of  Commerce  on  May  26  on  the  national  security  law  in  Hong  Kong.

Venture  capitalists  'seizing  opportunities  from  adversity'. Inspite  of  the  coronavirus'  devastating  effect,  venture  capitalists  are  good  at  maximizing  opportunities  during  a  crisis,  an  industry  expert  says.

Protest  violence  chokes  the  heart  of  HK. Unauthorized  rallies  against  LegCo's  second  reading  of  the  National  Anthem  Bill  culminate  in  fires  and  sounds  of  explosion  on  blocked  streets  in  Mong  Kok.

More  consumers  using  digital  payments  due  to  coronavirus. Experts  predict  after  the  pandemic,  most  countries  will  likely  become  more  digitized,  because  patterns  of  consumer  behavior  are  being  changed.
Economic  rebound  'relies  on  global  cooperation'. China,  US  must  work  together  against  pandemic  for  the  benefit  of  the  world.

Anthem  bill:  Over  300  arrested  in  renewed  violence  in  HK.   Hong  Kong  police  made  more  than  300  arrests  and  fired  pepper  pellets  to  disperse  protesters  in  the  heart  of  the  Asian  financial  hub  on  Wednesday.

Pro-establishment  lawmakers  condemn  attempts  to  block  National  Anthem  Bill. Bill  to  be  put  to  a  vote  next  week  at  the  earliest  after  filibusters  in  LegCo  by  opposition  camp  who  'collaborated'  with  participants  of  unauthorized  rallies  on  the  streets.

Tencent  seeks  US$6  billion  in  bond  sale  in  Hong  Kong. The  deal  is  the  biggest  international  offering  by  an  Asian  company  this  year  and  will  be  the  first  time  Tencent  has  offered  ultra-long  40-year  debt.

Mainland  traders  are  buying  HK  stocks  like  never  before. Mainland  investors  now  own  about  2.9%  of  the  total  market  value  of  HK  stocks  eligible  for  cross-border  trading,  the  highest  since  March  2017.

Li  Ka-shing  ups  stake  in  property  flagship  twice  this  week. The  purchases  was  at  the  average  share  price  of  HK$46.8140,  HK$43.1890,  HK$41.4146  and  HK$42.5361  on  May  21,  May  22,  May  25  and  May  26.

National  security  legislation  'purely  China's  internal  affair'. ​A  Foreign  Ministry  spokesman  said  the  national  security  legislation  for  Hong  Kong​  is  purely  China's  internal  affair,  which  allows  no  foreign  interference.

HKEX  CEO  calls  for  confidence  in  HK’s  status  as  financial  hub. HKEX  revealed  a  licensing  agreement  with  MSCI  Inc.  to  offer  37  futures  and  options  contracts  based  on  MSCI  equity  indexes  in  Asia  and  emerging  markets.

SGX  plunges  most  in  17  years  as  MSCI  signs  pact  with  Hong  Kong. Shares  in  Singapore  Exchange  plunged  12  percent  after  MSCI  announced  it  will  move  licensing  for  derivatives  products  on  a  host  of  gauges  to  Hong  Kong.

HK  political  advisors  'can  play  role'  in  security  legislation. National  political  advisers  from  HK  can  play  their  role  in  interpreting  the  national  security  legislation  for  local  people,  said  CPPCC  member  Eliza  Chan.

More  consumers  using  digital  payments  amid  pandemic. Digital  payments  have  been  increasing  during  the  pandemic  because  of  the  ease  with  which  they  allow  people  to  pay  for  goods  and  services.
Hong  Kong  shares  close  0.36%  lower. The  Hang  Seng  Index  lost  83.30  points  to  close  at  23,301.36  points  on  Wednesday.

Cheung:  National  anthem  legislation  SAR's  duty. The  HKSAR,  as  an  inseparable  part  of  China,  has  the  constitutional  duty  to  legislate  on  the  national  anthem,  said  Matthew  Cheung.

HK  justice  chief:  Draft  legislation  enshrined  in  law. Secretary  for  Justice  Teresa  Cheng  said  in  an  online  article  that  national  security  is  never  part  of  Hong  Kong's  autonomy.
Better  integration  reduces  barriers. Deputies  urge  more  policies  for  smooth  flow  of  talent  and  funds.

HK  leader  vows  support  for  legislation. Carrie  Lam  dismissed  speculation  that  the  draft  decision  on  national  security  legislation  in  HK  would  "erode"  the  "one  country,  two  systems"  principle.
HK  further  eases  virus  curbs,  airport  transit  from  June  1. The  move  to  ease  the  restrictions  comes  as  Hong  Kong  has  seen  no  new  local  cases  for  11  straight  days.

Commander:  PLA  HK  garrison  to  carry  out  central  govt's  policies. Chen  Daoxiang,  commander  of  the  PLA  HK  Garrison,  said  his  troops  will  firmly  execute  the  central  govt's  policies  and  strive  to  safeguard  the  city's  stability.
Gambling  tycoon  Stanley  Ho  dies  at  98. Stanley  Ho,  a  onetime  kerosene  trader  who  built  a  casino  empire  in  Macao,  has  died  at  age  98.

Bocom  International  chairman  says  national  security  law  will  boost  Hong  Kong. Introducing  national  security  legislation  is  conducive  to  enhancing  HK's  capital-market  certainty  and  boosting  HK's  status  as  a  global  financial  hub:  Tan.

Speculators  target  Hong  Kong's  currency  on  outflow  concern. Volume  on  HK  dollar  options  soared  to  US$3.7b  on  Friday,  with  a  third  of  the  trades  betting  the  currency  would  hit  or  break  the  weak  end  of  its  trading  band.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  1.88%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  432.42  points,  or  1.88  percent,  to  23,384.66  points.

Beijing:  US  should  stop  meddling  in  HK  affairs. China  has  made  solemn  representations  to  the  US  over  "the  noises  some  US  politicians  have  made"  over  the  national  security  legislation  in  the  SAR.

15-year-old  boy  gets  18-month  probation  for  arson. The  Form  Three  student,  unnamed  because  he's  a  minor,  was  arrested  after  throwing  petrol  bombs  on  a  street  in  Yuen  Long  around  1  am  on  Jan  8,  2020.

HK  police  arrest  193  people  involved  in  Sunday's  violence. A  total  of  122  males  and  71  females  were  arrested,  mainly  for  offenses  of  taking  part  in  a  riot,  unlawful  assembly  and  possession  of  offensive  weapons.

HK  justice  department  stresses  independence  of  judiciary. The  Department  of  Justice  urged  against  unwarranted  speculation  on  the  content  of  a  draft  legislation  on  national  security  tabled  in  the  National  People's  Congress.

Tung:  National  security  law  to  cure  the  city's  chaos. Tung  Chee-hwa  on  Monday  called  on  the  public  in  HK  to  voice  their  support  for  the  national  security  law  proposed  by  the  nation's  top  legislature.

Foreign  politicians  blasted  for  double  standards. The  HKSAR  govt  lambasted  those  who  questioned  the  legitimacy  of  the  central  authorities  introducing  national  security  legislation  for  the  city.

Liaison  Office  slams  protest  violence  in  HK. What  transpired  at  Sunday’s  unlawful  assembly  was  yet  more  proof  that  Hong  Kong  is  in  urgent  need  of  a  national  security  law,  the  liaison  office  said.

HK  exports  tumble  in  April  as  virus  disrupts  commerce. Exports  fell  3.7%  from  a  year  earlier  to  HK$309.5  billion  while  imports  fell  6.7%  to  HK$332.8  billion  for  17th  straight  month  of  declines.

Man  gets  a  year  for  possessing  petrol  bombs. A  man  was  sentenced  to  one  year  in  prison  on  Monday  after  he  joined  an  unlawful  assembly  in  Mong  Kok  and  was  caught  with  hammers  and  petrol  bombs.

Full  text  of  Commissioner's  speech  on  draft  legislation. Commissioner  Xie  Feng  made  a  opening  remarks  at  the  press  conference  on  the  HK-related  agenda  of  the  National  People's  Congress  session  on  Monday.

Hong  Kong  reports  no  new  COVID-19  cases;  1,065  in  all. The  HK  Centre  for  Health  Protection  reported  no  new  COVID-19  cases  as  of  Monday  afternoon  while  1,030  patients  have  been  discharged  upon  recovery.

Pulitzer  Prize-winning  photo  on  HK  riots  hammers  in  hard  truth. A  picture  of  Shenzhen-based  small  business-owner  Yang  Xuezhi  standing  dazed  in  Mong  Kok  was  one  of  images  that  won  the  2020  Pulitzer  Prize.

Tung:  National  security  law  a  cure  for  HK’s  chaos. Tung  believed  that  NPC's  decision  to  introduce  a  national  security  legislation  has  lifted  the  spirit  of  many  people  in  the  city  who  see  this  as  the  break  of  dawn.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.10%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  22.10  points,  or  0.10  percent,  to  22,952.24  points.

Sources:  Mainland  retail  tycoon's  Wumei  considers  HK  IPO. Wumei  Holdings,  the  Chinese  mainland  retail  group  that  owns  one  of  the  country's  biggest  supermarket  chains,  is  considering  an  IPO  in  Hong  Kong.

HK  security  chief  says  'terrorism  growing',  backs  legislation. John  Lee  Ka-chiu  made  the  remarks  following  Sunday's  illegal  protests  and  as  the  NPC  is  deliberating  a  draft  decision  on  national  security  legislation  in  HK.

Cambodia  backs  draft  HK  national  security  legislation. The  Cambodian  Foreign  Ministry  said  the  draft  decision,  meant  to  safeguard  national  security,  is  the  sovereign  right  of  China  as  an  independent  country.

HK  officials  voice  support  for  national  security  law. CE  Carrie  Lam  said  the  public  have  been  urging  her  for  a  long  time  to  implement  such  legislation  to  end  the  unrest  and  violence  in  the  city.

Law  to  better  protect  rights  in  Hong  Kong. Enacting  a  national  security  law  for  HK  will  uphold  the  long-lasting  peace,  stability  and  prosperity  of  the  SAR,  Vice-Premier  Han  Zheng  said.

HK  deputies  applaud  Beijing's  resolve  to  plug  loopholes. HK  deputies'  remarks  came  after  Vice-Premier  Han  Zheng  met  with  36  Hong  Kong  delegates  in  Beijing  earlier  in  the  day.
HK  violence  'vindicates  need  for  security  law'. Anti-government  protesters  paralyzed  Causeway  Bay  and  Wan  Chai  on  Hong  Kong  Island  —  two  busy  shopping  districts.

Residents  hope  legislation  quells  violence. ​Meanwhile,  an  online  petition  in  support  of  the  legislation  launched  on  Saturday  in  Hong  Kong  has  collected  over  90,000  signatures  by  6  pm.
HK  govt  condemns  illegal,  violent  acts  of  rioters. The  Hong  Kong  government  strongly  condemned  rioters'  unlawful  assemblies  and  extremely  violent  and  illegal  acts  on  Sunday.

Campaign  supporting  national  security  legislation  launched. More  than  2,000  political,  social  and  business  leaders  in  Hong  Kong  have  established  a  united  front  to  support  the  national  security  legislation  in  the  SAR.

HK  finance  chief:  Legislation  will  help  restore  business  confidence. National  security  legislation  in  HK  will  help  quell  concerns  about  unrest  in  the  SAR,  the  main  threat  to  confidence  in  the  city's  financial  sector,  said  Paul  Chan.

Wang:  External  interference  in  HKSAR  affairs  won't  be  tolerated. Wang  Yi  was  responding  to  a  question  on  national  security  legislation  for  the  HKSAR  at  a  press  conference  on  the  sidelines  of  the  annual  NPC  session.

HK  reports  no  new  COVID-19  cases,  tally  stands  at  1,065. Hong  Kong  reported  no  new  cases  of  COVID-19  caused  by  a  novel  coronavirus  with  the  city's  infecting  tally  standing  at  1,065.

Q&A  on  NPC's  draft  decision  on  HK  national  security  legislation. Hong  Kong's  Tomorrow  Concern  Group  answers  20  questions  about  the  nation's  top  legislature's  decision  on  the  national  security  legislation  in  Hong  Kong.

HK  CPPCC  member  calls  for  national  education. Tu  Haiming  called  for  the  strengthening  of  national  education  in  Hong  Kong  while  showing  support  of  the  proposed  national  security  law.

7  things  to  know  about  national  security  legislation  in  HK. Based  on  interviews  with  experts,  Xinhua  reporters  attempt  to  answer  some  of  the  most  frequently  asked  questions  about  the  national  security  legislation  in  HK.

Education  chief:  Schools  to  play  role  in  security  law. Kevin  Yeung  said  the  SAR  government  fully  supports  the  nation's  top  legislature's  decision  to  introduce  the  national  security  law  in  the  SAR.

HK  delegates  support  national  security  legislation. Members  of  the  national  legislature  and  top  political  advisory  body  from  HK  have  voiced  support  for  a  draft  decision  on  national  security  legislation  for  the  SAR.

Foreign  countries  urged  to  stop  meddling  in  HKSAR  affairs. The  Commissioner's  Office  of  the  Foreign  Ministry  in  the  HKSAR  has  opposed  unwarranted  remarks  made  by  some  countries  on  proposed  national  security  legislation  being  drawn  up  for  the  city.

Taiwan's  DPP  urged  to  stop  attacking  NPC  draft  decision. The  DPP  authority  must  stop  its  political  manipulation  over  HK  affairs,  said  Ma  Xiaoguang,  a  spokesperson  for  the  Taiwan  Affairs  Office  of  the  State  Council.

Exam  body  pulls  controversial  question  from  DSE  exam. Candidates  involved  will  be  given  a  score  on  the  question  based  on  their  overall  performance  in  the  same  paper,  the  HKEAA  said.

HKTB  plan  to  encourage  locals  to  explore  region,  boost  tourism. HKTB  said  it  planned  to  launch  a  scheme  from  the  middle  of  June  aiming  to  encourage  local  residents  to  explore  the  region,  and  boost  Hong  Kong  tourism​.
Pandemic  may  change  fitness  industry  forever. Online  fitness  classes  boom  with  gyms  shuttered  during  lockdown  —  a  trend  some  say  is  here  to  stay  in  the  post-pandemic  world.

Zeman:  Security  law  needed  in  wake  of  violence  in  HK. Businessman  Allan  Zeman  said  the  implementation  of  national  security  legislation  became  inevitable  following  a  resurgence  of  the  violence  in  HK.
CE:  National  security  legislation  protects  investors'  interests. Business  confidence  in  Hong  Kong  will  improve  as  the  place  will  be  safer,  Carrie  Lam  said.
HKSAR  govt  to  fully  cooperate  with  NPC  on  national  security  legislation. Chief  executive  says  legislation  is  within  the  purview  of  the  central  authorities.

Sources:  NetEase  and  JD.com  set  dates  for  US$5b  HK  listings. The  two  transactions  could  raise  a  combined  US$5  billion  and  the  deals  would  be  the  largest  for  the  HKSAR's
equity  capital  markets  so  far  this  year.

China  urges  no  foreign  meddling  in  its  internal  affairs. The  national  security  legislation  for  HKSAR  is  purely  a  matter  of  China's  internal  affairs  and  no  foreign  country  has  the  right  to  interfere,  a  Foreign  Ministry  spokesperson  said.
US-listed  mainland  tech  giants  ‘moving  back  to  HK’. Some  of  the  Chinese  mainland’s  tech  giants  listed  in  the  United  States  may  be  making  a  beeline  back  to  Hong  Kong.

Pro-establishment  lawmakers  welcome  NPC's  proposal. Pro-establishment  lawmakers  welcomed  the  NPC  decision  to  introduce  a  national  security  law  in  Hong  Kong  since  it  is  in  the  interest  of  the  country  and  the  city.

Hong  Kong  reports  2  new  COVID-19  cases,  tally  at  1,065. The  Center  for  Health  Protection  has  urged  the  public  to  continue  practice  social  distancing  and  avoid  social  activities  to  reduce  the  risk  of  infection.

Li  Ka-shing  continues  to  buy  shares  in  flagship  property  company. Tycoon  Li  Ka-shing  is  continuing  to  buy  shares  in  his  flagship  property  company  to  show  his  confidence  in  the  business.
Draft  decision  on  HK  national  security  legislation  tabled. The  draft  decision  was  submitted  to  China's  national  legislature  for  deliberation  on  Friday.

The  doctor’s  no  longer  at  the  door. With  the  mainland  leading  the  pack  in  online  medical  consultations  and  treatment,  HK's  healthcare  sector  is  wasting  no  time  embracing  the  shift  but,  seemingly,  at  a  much  slower  pace.

HKMAO,  liaison  office  say  draft  decision  on  HKSAR  imperative. The  deliberation  by  the  NPC  of  a  draft  decision  on  establishing  and  improving  the  legal  system  of  the  HKSAR  is  crucial  to  "one  country,  two  systems".

IPCC  chairman:  Report  on  protests  fact-based. The  report  is  based  on  a  wide  range  of  sources,  including  the  police,  the  hospital  authority  and  people  from  all  walks  of  life,  Anthony  Neoh  said.

CE  vows  cooperation  with  NPC  on  national  security  legislation. Carrie  Lam's  pledge  came  on  Friday,  as  the  NPC  will  deliberate  a  draft  decision  to  add  a  national  security  law  in  the  Annex  III  of  the  Basic  Law  of  Hong  Kong.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  5.56%  lower. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  down  1,349.89  points,  or  5.56  percent,  to  22,930.14  points.

Leung:  Don’t  underrate  central  government’s  resolve. China’s  top  legislature,  the  National  People’s  Congress,  will  deliberate  a  draft  bill  to  add  a  national  security  law  in  Annex  III  of  the  Basic  Law  of  the  HKSAR.

Full  text:  CE's  statement  on  draft  decision. Carrie  Lam  has  issued  a  statement  in  response  to  the  deliberation  by  the  NPC  of  a  draft  decision  on  the  HKSAR's  national  security  legislation.

HK  govt  seeks  to  highlight  Ocean  Park's  'innate  advantages'. The  HKSAR  government  plans  to  reposition  cash-strapped  Ocean  Park  to  highlight  its  innate  strengths  on  conservation,  education  and  leisure.
