HK  man  recovers  from  virus,  discharged. The  25-year-old  patient  had  tested  negative  twice,  with  both  tests  conducted  more  than  24  hours  apart.

2  bomb  hoaxes  reported  in  one  day  amid  crisis. Online  posts  have  said  that  bombs  have  been  placed  in  major  transportation  facilities  to  protest  the  government’s  handling  of  the  epidemic.

HK  confirms  1  more  coronavirus  case,  1  patient  discharged. The  latest  patient,  a  51-year-old  man,  has  been  working  with  the  37th  patient  in  a  restaurant  kitchen,  health  authorities  said  on  Wednesday.

4  more  arrested  in  relation  to  illegal  protest  funding  platform. The  arrests  were  made  during  a  police  investigation  into  Spark  Alliance,  whose  account  had  been  frozen  for  alleged  money  laundering.
Daikiya  Group  cancels  share  listing  due  to  coronavirus  outbreak. Protests  and  riots  in  the  city  since  June  also  have  taken  a  toll  on  the  group’s  business.

HK  coronavirus-hit  property  market  grinds  to  a  halt. Just  13  homes  were  sold  in  the  first  three  weekends  after  Chinese  New  Year  in  the  10  largest  housing  estates,  according  to  Centaline  Property  Agency  Ltd  data.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.87%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  239.78  points,  or  0.87  percent,  to  27,823.66  points.

China  Life  Group  'seeks  Hong  Kong  listing  via  unit'. China  Life  Insurance  is  planning  a  backdoor  listing  of  its  key  businesses  in  Hong  Kong  as  early  as  this  year,  people  with  knowledge  of  the  matter  said.

10  HK  residents  in  Hubei  infected  with  coronavirus. The  10  patients  from  three  families  are  receiving  treatment  in  local  hospitals  and  are  reported  to  be  in  relatively  stable  condition,  according  to  the  HKSAR  govt.
Bomb  hoaxes  briefly  disrupt  train  services. Bomb-like  objects  were  found  near  Tai  Po  Market  and  Sha  Tin  Wai  stations  Wednesday  morning.  No  people  have  been  arrested  yet.
HK  aid  for  Wuhan  wins  kudos  from  vice-premier. Concerted  efforts  demonstrate  the  nation's  strong  cohesion  and  vitality,  Vice-Premier  Sun  Chunlan  said.

Small  Hong  Kong  businesses  count  the  cost  of  coronavirus. As  the  spread  of  coronavirus  sends  jitters  across  Hong  Kong,  usually  bustling  shopping  malls  are  deserted,  leaving  some  small  business  owners  contemplating  their  future  in  the  global  financial  hub.
HK  stocks  rise  on  the  back  of  bullish  A-shares. Investors  more  rational  about  impact  of  the  coronavirus,  with  bearish  sentiment  easing.

‘Negative’  outlook  for  HK  banking  sector  as  epidemic  spreads. Fitch  Ratings  report  said  the  negative  rating  reflects  profitability  pressures  from  weaker  economic  growth  since  the  beginning  of  last  year.

New  coronavirus  may  do  more  damage  to  economies  than  SARS,  experts  say. UBS  research  house  lowered  its  whole-year  growth  forecast  for  the  Chinese  economy  to  5.4  percent,  down  from  6  percent.

Mass  quarantine  after  5  show  symptoms  in  HK  housing  estate. Some  100  residents  of  Hong  Mei  House  in  Tsing  Yi  were  evacuated  and  quarantined  after  5  residents  living  in  the  estate  were  showing  symptoms.

HK  expert:  Hong  Mei  House  case  not  a  repeat  of  Amoy  Gardens. Microbiologist  Yuen  Kwok-yung  said  infections  at  Hong  Mei  House  were  "absolutely"  not  a  copy  of  Amoy  Gardens  that  saw  the  SARS  outbreak  in  2003.

New  PolyU  system  can  detect  virus  in  an  hour. The  new  technology  can  identify  more  than  30  bacteria  and  viruses  which  cause  respiratory  infectious  diseases,  including  the  novel  coronavirus.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  1.26%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  342.54  points,  or  1.26  percent,  to  27,583.88  points.

Sources:  Alibaba  blocked  from  HK-mainland  stock  link. The  exclusion  of  firms  with  secondary  listings  and  weighted  voting  rights  from  the  stock  connect  was  agreed  before  Alibaba's  HK  debut,  the  sources  said.

HK  donates  US$143m,  medical  gear  to  help  mainland  fight  virus. Liaison  Office  voiced  full  support  for  the  HKSAR  govt  and  the  city's  various  sectors  as  they  take  effective  measures  to  prevent  and  control  the  disease.

Geely  surges  in  HK  on  proposed  merger  with  Volvo  Cars. Geely  and  Volvo  cars  have  started  discussions  and  the  plan  is  for  the  combined  entity  to  be  listed  in  HK  and  Stockholm,  according  to  a  statement.

HK  economy  seen  to  slip  further  as  epidemic  takes  its  toll. Economists  warned  that  the  coronavirus  outbreak  could  further  dampen  the  tourism  and  retail  industries,  and  also  disrupt  HK's  trade  sector.

Govt  calls  for  concerted  efforts  to  curb  spread  of  virus. The  govt  called  for  concerted  efforts  from  the  public  to  stop  the  spread  of  the  novel  coronavirus  pneumonia  as  the  city  reported  six  more  cases.

Medical  volunteer  rises  to  challenge  in  battle  against  coronavirus. Being  positive,  united  and  faithful  is  the  key  to  facing  up  to  the  fear  of  an  epidemic  outbreak,  a  front-line  medical  worker  said.
HK  stocks  inch  lower,  tracking  Wall  Street  losses. The  Hang  Seng  Index  closed  down  at  27,241  on  a  market  turnover  of  HK$107.7  billion.
Hot  pot  stocks  slide  after  family  gets  coronavirus  in  HK. Haidilao  ended  4.8%  lower,  while  Xiabuxiabu  fell  as  much  as  8.3%  before  closing  down  7.1%.
HK  govt  advises  against  family  gatherings. Infections  spike  following  nine  confirmed  cases  linked  to  a  reunion  meal  of  19  people.

Number  of  coronavirus-infected  people  in  HK  rises  to  38. There  were  2  more  cases  reported  on  Monday,  including  another  participant  of  a  family  gathering  in  which  nine  others  already  had  tested  positive  for  infection.

HK  tycoon  Li  Ka-shing  donates  US$13  million  to  Wuhan. The  Li  Ka  Shing  Foundation,  a  charitable  organization  founded  by  the  Hong  Kong  billionaire,  donated  HK$100  million  to  help  Wuhan.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.59%  lower. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  down  162.93  points,  or  0.59  percent,  to  27,241.34  points.
Biotech  company  to  donate  testing  kits. Guangdong  Hybribio  Biotech  senior  consultant  said  the  preliminary  test  kit's  accuracy  rate  is  higher  than  99.9  percent.
'Not  in  my  backyard'  protests  alarm  experts. Leung  Chi-chiu  says  any  gathering  of  large  crowds  increases  the  risk  of  virus  transmission.

HSBC  offers  US$3.9b  liquidity  relief  to  Hong  Kong  firms. Banks  across  the  city  are  considering  loan  relief  to  help  struggling  customers  and  businesses  as  the  outbreak  crimps  spending  and  travel.
Hong  Kong  NCP  infections  now  29. The  newly  confirmed  cases  include  a  24-year-old  man  and  his  over-90-year-old  grandma  and  a  70-year-old  man,  who  has  chronic  disease.
Coronavirus:  All  of  quarantined  cruise  crew  test  negative. All  of  the  1,800-plus  crew  members  of  quarantined  cruise  ship  World  Dream  could  leave  the  ship  now.

'Hong  Kong  economic  outlook  worse  than  SARS-hit  2003'. Retail,  catering  and  tourism  industries  have  been  battered  severely  by  the  outbreak  of  the  novel  coronavirus,  said  Financial  Secretary  Paul  Chan  Mo-po.

Arrests  after  vandalism  in  Tseung  Kwan  O. Radicals  damaged  traffic  lights,  dug  up  bricks  on  the  sidewalk  and  threw  them  on  the  thoroughfare  in  Tseung  Kwan  O  before  police  moved  in.

Travel  ban:  25,000  Filipino  maids  in  danger  of  losing  jobs  in  HK. The  Filipino  workers  are  stranded  in  Manila  after  the  govt  imposed  a  travel  ban  to  and  from  the  mainland,  Macao  &  HK  to  curb  the  spread  of  the  coronavirus.

HK:  Visitor  arrivals  drop  as  mandatory  quarantine  kicks  in. Carrie  Lam  said  the  mandatory  quarantine  that  came  into  effect  on  Saturday  has  effectively  reduced  people  flow  between  HK  and  the  mainland.

Local  coronavirus  infections  remain  at  26. The  number  of  novel  coronavirus  infections  in  the  city  remained  at  26  as  no  new  cases  were  reported  on  Saturday,  health  authorities  said.

Virus  screening  for  1,800  crew  on  quarantined  ship  in  HK. Novel  coronavirus  screening  for  some  1,800  crew  members  abroad  a  quarantined  ship  docked  at  Kai  Tak  is  expected  to  complete  by  Tuesday.

Ex-security  chief  for  mandatory  quarantine  to  contain  epidemic. Former  security  chief  Lai  Tung-kwok  described  the  latest  measure  as  "thorough  and  effective"  in  curbing  the  spread  of  the  disease.

Ex-security  chief  calls  for  emergency  laws  against  fake  news. Emergency  laws  are  needed  to  deal  with  fake  news  and  rumors  to  avoid  panic  and  confusion  in  the  community,  Lai  Tung-kwok  said.

Medical  workers'  strike  has  'no  legal  mandate'. Medical  workers  must  not  forget  their  pledge  to  take  care  of  patients  when  they  first  joined  the  profession,  former  security  chief  Lai  Tung-kwok  said.

Government  to  prosecute  those  who  violate  quarantine  order. The  govt  has  set  penalty  for  breaching  a  14-day  mandatory  quarantine  requirement  at  up  to  six  months'  imprisonment  and  a  fine  of  HK$25,000.
Xie:  We're  confident  in  fighting  virus. Commissioner  appeals  for  rationality,  fairness  in  viewing  country’s  efforts  to  curb  epidemic.

Quarantine  violation  in  HK  will  attract  6  months  in  jail. Any  person  found  violating  quarantine  will  face  up  to  six  months  in  jail  and  a  fine  of  HK$25,000  upon  conviction,  announced  the  chief  secretary.

HK  medical  workers  end  strike  after  vote. Hospital  Authority  Employees  Alliance  said  on  Friday  that  more  than  3,600  members  of  the  group  had  voted  against  the  continuation  of  the  strike.

Hong  Kong  Airlines  to  cut  10%  of  workforce. The  company  will  lay  off  400  employees  and  ask  its  Hong  Kong  ground  crew  to  take  at  least  two  weeks  of  unpaid  leave  each  month  until  June.

Art  Basel  Hong  Kong  called  off  over  coronavirus  fears. Switzerland's  MCH  Group  has  cited  safety  concerns,  logistical  challenges  and  escalating  difficulties  in  international  travel  for  the  cancellation  of  the  event.
Online  rumor  leads  to  bulk  buying  of  household  products  in  HK. Govt,  companies  assure  HK  people  that  supplies  of  food  and  other  goods  are  stable.
Tsui  Wah  managers  to  take  30%  pay  cut  to  reduce  costs. Restaurant  chain  among  companies  bracing  for  tough  times  and  'extremely  chilly  winter'  ahead.

Commissioner  pledges  supply  to  HK. Central  govt’s  top  diplomat  in  HK  reassured  the  supply  of  necessities  to  Hong  Kong  from  the  Chinese  mainland  amid  the  novel  coronavirus  outbreak.
More  banks  plan  relief  measures  to  weather  economic  woes. ​These  include  fee  reductions  for  credit  card  borrowing  and  restructuring  of  repayment  schedules  for  corporate  loans.

HK  residents  hoard  toilet  paper  as  coronavirus  fears  mount. The  Hong  Kong  government  has  condemned  “malicious  rumors”  about  shortages  which  have  led  to  panic  buying  “and  even  chaos".

Commissioner:  China  confident  in  containing  virus  spread. More  than  66  billion  yuan  has  been  allocated  and  over  20  tons  of  medical  supplies  are  delivered  hour-by-hour  to  support  efforts  to  contain  the  epidemic.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.33%  lower. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  down  89.43  points,  or  0.33  percent,  to  27,404.27  points.

Ex-WHO  official  affirms  China's  virus  control  measures. Keiji  Fukuda  said  China  has  made  effort  that  has  never  been  made  by  any  country  in  recent  years  to  contain  the  deadly  novel  coronavirus  outbreak.

China's  central  bank  to  issue  30  billion  yuan  of  bills  in  HK. Bills  worth  20  billion  yuan  will  mature  in  three  months,  while  the  remaining  bills  will  mature  in  one  year,  according  to  the  People's  Bank  of  China.
Rising  local  infections  spur  concern  in  HK. Concerns  over  community  transmission  of  the  novel  coronavirus  are  growing,  the  Hong  Kong  government  said  on  Thursday.

Alliance  formed  to  contain  spread  of  coronavirus  in  HK. About  30  doctors  and  dignitaries  from  various  sectors  formed  an  alliance  on  Thursday  to  unite  residents  in  the  battle  against  the  novel  coronavirus.

Taiwan  to  suspend  most  visa  requests  from  HK,  Macao  SARs. Taiwan  on  Thursday  also  banned  all  international  cruise  ships  from  docking  at  the  island,  as  the  number  of  confirmed  coronavirus  cases  rose  to  13.

HK  banks  offer  loan  help,  staff  perks  amid  virus  outbreak. Banks  in  Hong  Kong  are  considering  loan  relief  to  help  struggling  customers  and  businesses  as  the  coronavirus  outbreak  threatens  to  spread  in  the  city.

Sa  Sa  reports  big  drop  in  sales  as  coronavirus  scares  off  shoppers. Hong  Kong's  largest  cosmetics  chain  operator  said  its  retail  sales  have  plummeted  as  the  novel  coronavirus  continues  to  spread  across  the  region.

HK  checks  quarantined  ship  for  virus,  3  crew  hospitalized. Local  authorities  quarantined  World  Dream  for  a  second  day  on  Thursday  as  they  checked  thousands  of  passengers  and  crew  for  the  novel  coronavirus.

Community  transmission  risk  rises  as  HK  confirms  24th  case. Concerns  over  community  transmission  of  the  novel  coronavirus  are  growing  as  health  authorities  suspected  eight  patients  had  been  infected  locally.
Police  receive  109  fraud  cases  involving  face  masks. Police  said  six  men  and  two  women  have  been  arrested  on  suspicion  of  obtaining  property  by  deception.

Stocks  rally  amid  hopes  for  coronavirus  treatment. The  markets  extended  the  gains  after  the  Chinese  Ministry  of  Finance  announced  it  will  cut  tariffs  on  $75  billion  of  US  imports  by  half.

Hospital  Authority  chief  to  seek  more  govt  support  for  staff. Henry  Fan  said  he  would  ask  the  government  for  additional  support  to  frontline  staff  who  remain  in  their  posts  amid  a  strike  by  some  5,000  staff.

HK  stocks  nearly  recover  post-holiday  losses  with  rally. The  Hang  Seng  Index  finished  2.6  percent  higher,  the  largest  gain  in  five  months  and  leaving  it  1.6  percent  below  its  closing  level  before  last  month's  holiday  break.

Microbiologist  says  priority  is  to  sever  transmission  chain. Yuen  Kwok-yung,  the  University  of  Hong  Kong  microbiology  professor,  mentioned  that  there  is  no  need  for  Hong  Kong  to  ban  trading  and  shut  down  the  SAR.

62-year-old  woman  suspected  of  contracting  MERS  in  HK. Health  authorities  will  classify  people  who  recently  visited  the  Middle  East  and  developed  relevant  symptoms  within  14  days  as  suspected  MERS  patients.

HK  government  provides  30,000  masks  for  private  clinics. At  least  10  private  clinics  have  been  forced  to  closed  while  others  have  shortened  opening  hours  due  to  the  shortage  of  face  masks.

HKUST’s  invention  to  speed  up  diagnoses  of  novel  coronavirus. Hong  Kong  scientists  have  developed  a  new  device  that  can  shorten  the  testing  time  for  the  novel  coronavirus  to  40  minutes  from  up  to  three  hours.

Shortage  rumors  spark  toilet  paper  panic  buying  in  HK. The  Hong  Kong  government  said  that  steps  to  contain  the  coronavirus  would  not  affect  the  movement  of  freight  across  the  border.

City  chief  remains  optimistic  about  controlling  coronavirus. Hong  Kong  Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  Cheng  Yuet-ngor  expresses  confidence  as  HK  moves  to  quarantine  all  arrivals  from  the  mainland.

Patients  groups  condemn  medical  strike,  call  for  unity. The  strike  has  further  burdened  the  already-strained  public  hospitals  and  threatened  the  welfare  of  patients,  patient  activist  groups  say.
Police:  Frequent  bomb  attacks  close  to  terrorism. Hong  Kong  in  January  recorded  four  homemade  bomb  attacks  and  15  bomb  hoaxes  —  an  average  of  one  case  every  other  day.
3,600  on  cruise  ship  face  quarantine  after  reaching  HK. The  health  authorities  said  90%  of  the  passengers  were  Hong  Kong  locals  and  the  rest  were  foreigners.

Cathay  Pacific  asks  27,000  employees  to  take  unpaid  leave. The  carrier  said  that  it  planned  to  cut  about  30%  of  capacity  over  the  next  two  months,  including  about  90%  of  flights  to  the  Chinese  mainland.

Restaurant  sector  records  1st  decline  in  revenue  in  16  years. The  total  revenue  of  HK's  restaurant  sector  in  2019  decreased  by  5.9%  from  the  previous  year,  the  first  annual  decline  in  16  years,  government  data  showed.

​CE:  All  arrivals  from  mainland  to  be  quarantined  for  14  days. The  new  arrangement,  which  also  applies  to  Hong  Kong  residents,  will  take  effect  on  Feb  8,  said  Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam.

Union  shows  support  for  frontline  medical  staff. Hong  Kong  Medical  and  Health  Care  Staff  General  Union  and  Hong  Kong  Chinese  Enterprises  Association  offered  medical  supplies  to  frontline  staff.

Medical  staff  urged  to  end  strike. Scheduled  non-emergency  surgeries,  including  cesarean  sections,  have  been  delayed  as  some  4,600  medical  staff  went  on  strike  for  a  third  day.

HK  residents  advised  to  check  insurance  claim  coverage  arising  from  coronavirus. Some  insurance  companies  have  prioritized  and  simplified  outpatient  and  hospitalization  claims  relating  to  the  novel  coronavirus.
Cathay  Pacific  to  ask  staff  to  take  3  weeks  unpaid  leave. Airline  says  these  voluntary  arrangements,  to  cope  with  coronavirus  outbreak,  will  affect  27,000  employees.
HK  stocks  end  day  0.42%  higher. The  benchmark  Hang  Seng  Index  opened  nearly  200  points  up  in  the  morning  and  picked  up  110.76  points  during  the  day,  at  26,786.74.

Private  sector  slowdown  softens  after  bumpy  start  to  2020. ​But  HK  firms  still  remain  pessimistic  about  year  ahead  due  to  negative  factors  such  as  trade  tensions  and  weak  demand,  expert  says.

Police:  Frequent  bomb  attacks  resemble  acts  of  terrorism. Police  said  there  were  4  cases  of  bomb  attacks  and  15  cases  of  bomb  hoax  in  public  places  in  January,  an  average  of  one  case  every  other  day.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.42%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  110.76  points,  or  0.42  percent,  to  26,786.74  points.
25-yr-old  HK's  youngest  patient  as  community  outbreak  feared. According  to  information  shared  by  the  patient,  he  didn't  travel  during  the  incubation  period.

Credit  Suisse  scraps  Hong  Kong  conference  on  virus  outbreak. The  decision  by  the  Zurich-based  private  bank  marks  the  biggest  cancellation  in  Hong  Kong’s  financial  industry  after  the  outbreak  of  the  virus.

Bomb  hoax  at  Tai  Po  Market  station  disrupts  train  service. Police  strongly  condemned  the  act  which  they  said  posed  a  threat  to  the  safety  of  thousands  of  passengers  using  that  line.
Coronavirus:  HK  braces  for  possible  community  outbreak. Four  infections  with  unknown  sources  trigger  alarm  over  mass  infection  as  1st  fatality  emerges.
Doctor  slams  medical  strike  as  ‘unethical’. Veteran  doctor  who  fought  SARS  17  years  ago  recalled  a  time  when  doctors  who  fled  their  posts  would  be  sneered  at.

Ex-WHO  chief  praises  China’s  prompt  efforts  in  virus  control. Margaret  Chan  Fung  Fu-chun  praised  China  for  its  prompt  and  transparent  efforts  in  effectively  controlling  the  spread  of  the  novel  coronavirus.

Coronavirus:  Police  offer  camp  for  quarantine  center. The  police  have  offered  to  turn  the  Junior  Police  Call  Permanent  Activity  Centre  in  Pat  Heung  into  HK's  5th  coronavirus  quarantine  center.
Hong  Kong  retail  sales  slide  for  11th  month. The  full-year  figure  for  Hong  Kong's  retails  sales  dropped  11.1  percent  to  HK$431.2  billion.

Cathay  to  cut  90%  of  flights  to  Chinese  mainland  due  to  virus. Cathay  Pacific  plans  to  cut  around  30%  of  its  capacity,  including  around  90%  of  its  flights  to  the  Chinese  mainland,  as  it  grapples  with  the  coronavirus  epidemic.

Dining  giant  Tansh  closes  5  HK  restaurants  as  coronavirus  rages. Tansh  temporarily  closed  five  of  its  12  restaurants  as  it  seeks  to  ensure  the  safety  of  its  employees  and  customers  during  the  novel  coronavirus  spreading.

Financial  experts  wary  of  interest-only  mortgage  repayments. Financial  analysts  cautioned  that  HK's  banking  sector  could  be  burdened  if  the  city  allows  principal-free,  interest-only  repayments  for  mortgage  loans.

Striking  hospital  staff  urged  to  return  to  work. More  than  4,400  public  hospital  staff,  including  some  2,500  nurses  and  350  doctors,  took  part  in  a  strike,  Hong  Kong's  Hospital  Authority  said.

Home  construction  pace  slows  down  in  HK. The  total  number  of  completed  private  home  units  in  2019  recorded  at  a  four-year  low  at  13,700  —  34%  fewer  than  what  had  been  built  a  year  ago.

CE:  Online  vetting  of  patient  travel  history  by  this  week. The  measure  will  help  doctors  counter  a  general  tendency  among  patients  to  suppress  health  information,  especially  with  infections  from  the  coronavirus.

HK  reports  first  death  from  new  coronavirus  infection. The  39-year-old  man  with  underlying  illness  was  admitted  to  Princess  Margaret  Hospital  on  Jan  31  after  he  was  confirmed  to  be  infected  with  the  virus.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  1.21%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  319.00  points,  or  1.21  percent,  to  26,675.98  points.

Condemnation  mounts  after  medical  strike. The  strike  came  as  the  city  took  further  precautions  against  the  coronavirus  that  has  infected  15  in  Hong  Kong  and  over  17,000  on  the  Chinese  mainland.
CE:  Extremism  will  not  succeed. Lam  says  HK  government  will  not  bow  to  threats  of  the  city's  general  welfare.

Strike  continues  in  HK  despite  closure  of  more  checkpoints. The  Hospital  Authority  called  on  medical  staff  to  end  their  strike,  after  thousands  of  them  threatened  to  join  the  industrial  action  on  Tuesday.

HK  economy  slips  1.2%  in  2019,  first  contraction  in  a  decade. HK  economy  dropped  1.2%  yoy  in  2019  as  months-long  unrest  and  chaos  dealt  a  crushing  blow  to  a  wide  range  of  industries  from  tourism  to  catering.

Initial  test  shows  woman  has  novel  coronavirus. The  woman,  a  Hong  Kong  resident,  had  no  travel  history  for  the  past  two  weeks  and  may  have  been  infected  locally,  according  to  media  reports.

HK  listed  firms  may  win  delay  on  earnings  reports. Verifying  final  accounts  of  the  mainland  firms  listed  in  HK  has  become  difficult  as  companies  reduced  travel  schedules  to  prevent  the  spread  of  the  disease.

Hong  Kong  closes  more  border  checkpoints  for  virus  control. HK  will  close  5  more  checkpoints  at  the  border  with  the  mainland  starting  from  Feb  4,  in  an  attempt  to  curb  the  spread  of  the  novel  coronavirus  pneumonia.

Hang  Seng  Index  ekes  out  slight  gain,  ending  three-day  slump. HK  stocks  seesawed  on  Monday  before  ending  0.17  percent  higher  despite  ongoing  fears  of  the  Wuhan-originated  novel  coronavirus  outbreak.

Hospital  Authority  calls  on  staff  to  stay  on  duty. The  Hospital  Authority  has  called  on  healthcare  staff  to  stay  on  duty  and  join  hands  to  cope  with  the  challenge  of  the  service  surge.

Govt  introduces  smart  wristband  for  forced  home  confinement. Hong  Kong  residents  returning  from  Hubei  will  be  required  to  wear  smart  wristbands  during  the  newly  introduced  14-day  home  confinement.

DAB  calls  for  further  tightening  of  border  control  amid  epidemic. HK's  largest  political  party  in  the  legislature  urged  the  govt  to  further  tighten  control  of  the  border  with  the  mainland  amid  the  epidemic.

HK  health  official  warns  of  local  transmission  of  novel  coronavirus. HK  health  official  warns  that  the  public  should  be  prepared  for  the  possible  spread  of  novel  coronavirus  in  the  local  community.

Explosives  found  at  HK  station  near  Shenzhen  amid  epidemic. The  bomber  has  threatened  further  attacks  if  the  government  does  not  order  a  complete  lockdown  to  contain  the  coronavirus  spread.
Planned  strike  by  HK  medical  staff  draws  protest. Protesters  said  the  proposed  strike  from  Monday  could  put  hospital  patients’  lives  at  risk.

Virus:  HK  confirms  2  more  cases;  source  of  as  many  unclear. Health  authorities  couldn't  rule  out  the  possibility  that  the  12th  and  14th  cases  contracted  novel  coronavirus  locally.

HK  govt  goes  all  out  to  secure  face  masks. Hong  Kong  govt  has  ramped  up  its  efforts  to  source  supplies  of  face  masks  to  meet  the  surging  demand  amid  the  threat  of  the  coronavirus  outbreak.

Virus:  HK  man  tests  positive  after  short  mainland  visit. The  respiratory  sample  of  an  80-year-old  man  was  tested  positive  for  the  novel  coronavirus  after  he  caught  fever  and  cough.

Virus:  HK  firms  donate  money,  medical  supplies  to  mainland. Several  HK  firms  have  donated  millions  of  dollars  &  protective  gears  to  Hubei  province,  the  epicenter  of  the  deadly  novel  coronavirus.

Pro-establishment  camp  hands  out  80,000  free  face  masks. The  DAB  and  FTU  on  Saturday  gave  away  a  total  of  80,000  face  masks  that  are  in  short  supply  amid  heightened  fears  of  the  novel  coronavirus.

HK  may  have  identified  first  local  infection  of  coronavirus. Hong  Kong  may  face  the  spread  of  the  novel  coronavirus  in  the  community  as  health  authorities  identified  the  first  case  of  local  infection  Saturday.

Whampoa  Garden  resident  13th  coronavirus  patient  in  HK. The  patient,39,  took  high-speed  rail  train  from  Hong  Kong  to  Wuhan  on  Jan  21  and  from  Changsha  to  Hong  Kong  on  Jan  23.
HK  rules  out  complete  lockdown. Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  said  such  a    move  would  run  contrary  to  the  World  Health  Organization’s  recommendations.

HK  home  prices  see  sharpest  decline  in  3  months  in  December. HK's  home  prices  end  tumultuous  year  with  a  month-on-month  drop  of  1.66  percent,  with  those  of  large  apartments  down  2.45  percent.
HK  exports  record  worst  performance  in  10  years. Momentum  behind  the  4.1  percent  drop  in  2019  seen  to  continue  in  2020  given  the  uncertainty  of  global  economic  development.

HK  further  postpones  reopening  of  schools,  public  services. Primary  and  secondary  schools  and  preschools  in  HK  will  remain  closed  until  March  2  while  civil  servants  will  be  allowed  to  work  from  home  until  Feb  9,  said  Hong  Kong  CE  Carrie  Lam.

Hong  Kong  universities  suspend  on-campus  classes. Several  varsities  said  Friday  they  would  further  postpone  the  start  of  the  spring  semester  to  early  March  due  to  the  heightened  threat  of  the  virus  outbreak.

HK  banks  start  closing  branches  to  limit  virus  spread. ​About  20-30%  of  bank  branches  are  expected  to  be  closed  temporarily  and  some  of  the  remaining  ones  will  have  restricted  hours.

HK  visitor  arrivals  drop  32%  after  partial  border  closure. Visitor  arrivals  fell  to  160,923  Thursday  from  236,350  a  day  before  after  the  closure  of  6  checkpoints  as  a  precaution  to  prevent  the  spread  of  the  coronavirus.

HK  customs  seize  68,000  fake  masks,  coronavirus  cases  hit  12. The  Department  of  Health  said  Friday  2  more  people  had  tested  positive  for  the  novel  coronavirus,  bringing  the  confirmed  cases  in  the  city  to  12.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.52%  lower. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  down  136.50  points,  or  0.52  percent,  to  26,312.63  points  on  Friday.

Govt  says  37  million  surgical  masks  to  be  available  in  HK  for  sale  soon. About  37  million  surgical  masks  will  be  put  on  the  Hong  Kong  market  soon,  Chief  Secretary  for  Administration  Matthew  Cheung  said  on  Thursday.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  2.62%  lower. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  down  711.50  points,  or  2.62  percent,  to  26,449.13  points.

Hong  Kong  exports  grow  3.3%  in  Dec,  full  year  shows  decline. Exports  expanded  to  HK$351.3  billion  during  the  month,  up  3.3  percent  from  a  year  ago,  snapping  a  13-month  streak  of  declines  that  was  the  longest  since  2016.

Virus  outbreak  risks  delaying  earnings  reports  across  HK. If  companies  with  a  Dec  31  year-end  fail  to  file  their  accounts  by  the  March  31  deadline,  they  will  be  suspended  from  trading.

2  HK  residents  contract  coronavirus  in  Guangdong. One  of  the  Hong  Kong  residents  who  contracted  the  virus  works  in  Wuhan,  while  the  other  had  recently  traveled  to  Hubei  province  for  sightseeing.

HA  to  report  to  police  patients,  kin  who  suppress  health  facts. The  decision  was  made  after  several  patients  failed  to  disclose  relevant  information  to  medical  personnel,  said  the  head  of  HK's  Health  Authority.

Hong  Kong  stocks  tumble  on  coronavirus  fears. The  Hang  Seng  Index  fell  as  much  as  3%  Wednesday  on  the  first  day  of  trading  after  the  Lunar  New  Year  before  paring  declines  to  end  the  day  2.8%  lower.

East  Rail  Line  services  resume  after  disruptions. The  MTR  said  debris  was  found  on  the  tracks  near  University,  Sheung  Shui  and  Lo  Wu  stations  in  the  early  hours  of  Wednesday.

Central  govt  supports  HK,  Macao  in  curbing  virus  spread. The  central  authorities  have  paid  high  attention  to  the  spread  of  the  virus  in  HK  and  Macao,  said  HKMAO  spokesperson  Xu  Luying.

Flight  passengers  from  mainland  must  make  health  declarations. ​All  flight  passengers  arriving  from  the  Chinese  mainland  must  make  a  health  declaration,  the  HK  government  announced  on  Tuesday.

HK  suspends  transport  links  to  contain  coronavirus  spread. ​The  HKSAR  government  is  temporarily  closing  six  of  the  city's  14  immigration  checkpoints  to  halt  the  spread  of  the  novel  coronavirus  that  started  in  Wuhan.

Major  HK  public  services  halted  under  epidemic. Major  government  departments  and  the  judiciary  in  Hong  Kong  announced  the  suspension  of  non-emergency  public  services  through  at  least  Sunday.

Banks  tell  HK  staff  to  work  at  home  after  mainland  visit. Global  banks  from  Credit  Suisse  to  Morgan  Stanley  are  telling  Hong  Kong  staff  to  work  from  home  for  two  weeks  if  they've  just  visited  the  mainland.

Bomb  threat  at  public  toilet  at  Shenzhen  Bay  Port. The  incident  happened  after  a  bomb  went  off  at  a  hospital  in  HK  Monday,  and  a  public  toilet  in  Kowloon  was  set  ablaze  in  a  suspected  bombing  Monday  night.

HK  allows  civil  servants,  govt  staff  to  work  from  home. The  govt  said  Tuesday  that  civil  servants  &  govt  employees  will  be  allowed  to  work  from  home  until  Feb  2,  in  a  bid  to  reduce  the  risk  of  spreading  of  the  virus.

HK  suspends  mainland  rail  &  ferry  links,  travel  scheme. Hong  Kong  will  also  shut  down  6  checkpoints  and  suspend  the  Individual  Visit  Scheme  involving  49  mainland  cities,  the  CE  announced  Tuesday.

Hubei  suspends  exit-entry  permits  to  HK,  Macao  &  Taiwan. Hubei  province  will  also  suspend  services  for  the  application  of  ordinary  passports  and  endorsements  to  Hong  Kong,  Macao  and  Taiwan.

'Homemade'  bomb  explodes  at  HK  hospital,  no  injuries. The  device  exploded  in  a  toilet  cubicle  at  the  Caritas  Medical  Centre  at  about  2.30  am  local  time,  police  said  in  a  statement.

HK  confirms  8  now  infected  with  novel  coronavirus. Hong  Kong's  Centre  for  Health  Protection  has  been  investigating  3  additional  imported  cases  of  the  novel  coronavirus  infection  since  Sunday.

HK  denies  entry  to  people  who  have  been  to  Hubei. Hong  Kong  residents  will  be  exempted  from  the  new  arrangement  announced  in  response  to  the  escalation  in  the  novel  coronavirus  spread.

11  arrested  as  violence  erupts  amid  virus  fear. They  were  variously  charged  with  unlawful  assembly,  obstructing  police  officers  and  possessing  of  instrument  fit  for  unlawful  purposes,  police  said.

HKSAR  govt  assuages  public  concern  over  quarantine  sites. Hong  Kong's  Centre  for  Health  Protection  assuaged  public  concern  by  saying  it  will  halt  plans  to  use  Fai  Ming  Estate  in  Fanling  as  a  possible  site.

HK  Disneyland  and  Ocean  Park  to  be  closed  from  Sunday. HK  Chief  Secretary  Matthew  Cheung  Kin-chung  said  in  a  blog  that  the  SAR  government  was  on  full  alert  even  as  the  city's  amusements  parks  closed.

HK  confirms  1  new  coronavirus  infection,  total  now  6. According  to  the  Department  of  Health,  the  47-year-old  man,  a  Hong  Kong  resident,  had  been  working  in  Wuhan  since  early  January.

Virus:  HK  declares  emergency,  schools  to  be  closed  till  Feb  17. HK  raised  its  response  level  to  the  coronavirus  outbreak  to  "emergency"  and  will  extend  school  holidays  for  non-tertiary  students  to  Feb  17.

HK  police  condemn  violent  acts  on  Lunar  New  Year's  day. As  radical  protesters  threatened  public  security,  police  had  no  choice  but  to  adopt  minimum  force  necessary  to  stop  them,  HK  police  said  in  a  statement.

Coronavirus:  HK  confirms  3  more  cases,  city  total  now  5. The  three  latest  patients,  two  women  and  man,  are  all  residents  of  Wuhan,  Hubei  province.  All  of  them  have  been  admitted  to  an  isolation  ward.

Hong  Kong,  Mexico  sign  investment  agreement. Hong  Kong  and  Mexico  have  signed  an  Investment  Promotion  and  Protection  Agreement  (IPPA)  to  strengthen  mutual  economic  ties,  HKSAR  govt  announced.

HK  agencies  suspend  mainland  group  tours. The  decision  by  travel  agencies  to  cancel  group  tours  comes  as  Hong  Kong  confirmed  two  cases  of  a  novel  virus  that      had  its  origin  in  Central  China's  Wuhan.

HK,  Macao  on  full  alert  after  4  confirmed  cases. Hong  Kong​  and  Macao  have  announced  new  measures  against  a  possible  outbreak  of  the  novel  coronavirus  that  originated  in  Wuhan.
Hong  Kong  stocks  open  0.09%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  gained  26.30  points,  or  0.09  percent,  to  open  at  27,935.42  points  on  Friday.

Macao,  Zhuhai  to  tighten  immigration  controls  to  fight  epidemic. Macao  is  tightening  immigration  controls  at  its  land  ports,  announced  Macao  CE  who  cautioned  the  pandemic  could  get  worse  after  Lunar  New  Year.
Cathay  to  temporarily  suspend  flights  to  and  from  Wuhan. Affected  passengers  were  be  eligible  for  refund  bookings  or  postpone  travel  plans.
HK  shares  slip  over  Wuhan  coronavirus  fears. Hang  Seng  Index  falls  1.52pc  to  end  the  day  at  27,909.12.

HK  Exchange  Fund  posts  the  second-highest  annual  return. HK's  investment  income  in  2019  registered  HK$247.2  billion,  the  second-highest  in  fund's  history,  while  expert  cautions  of  uncertainties  this  year.

HK  unveils  new  measures  to  address  possible  coronavirus  pneumonia  disease. SAR  govt  on  Thursday  announced  measures  to  cope  with  the  outbreak  of  the  Wuhan  pneumonia-like  disease  after  the  city  confirmed  two  infected  cases.

Hong  Kong  confirms  first  two  cases  of  novel  coronavirus. Both  male  patients,  aged  39  and  56,  had  been  to  Wuhan  within  the  past  week.  They  have  been  put  in  quarantine  at  Princess  Margaret  Hospital.

Cathay  suspends  flights  to  Wuhan  until  Feb  29. In  Hong  Kong,  rail  operator  MTR  announced  that  it  was  suspending  high-speed  rail  ticket  sales  between  HK  and  Wuhan  and  promised  full  refund.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  1.52  pct  lower. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  down  431.92  points,  or  1.52  percent,  to  27,909.12  points  on  Thursday

HKSAR  CE  highlights  'one  country,  two  systems'  in  Davos. Carrie  Lam  highlighted  the  importance  of  understanding  &  implementing  the  "one  country,  two  systems"  principle,  as  well  as  upholding  the  rule  of  law.

Two  men  in  HK  test  positive  for  coronavirus. A  mainland  tourist  and  a  Hong  Kong  resident,  both  having  made  trips  to  the  city  of  Wuhan,  returned  positive  test  results  for  coronavirus  infection.

HK  scales  up  cross-border  trade  settlement  technology. HK  &  Thailand  have  developed  a  cross-border  blockchain  network  prototype  to  facilitate  payments  arising  from  trade  activities  between  the  two  places.

Fitch  predicts  rebound  of  HK's  economy  in  2020. HK's  economic  growth  will  rebound  slightly  to  1%  in  2020,  as  improvement  in  the  external  environment  could  benefit  the  economy,  Fitch  Ratings  said.

HK  should  diversify  its  appeal  to  attract  visitors,  expert  says. HK  should  diversify  its  appeal  to  visitors  rather  than  relying  too  heavily  on  its  reputation  as  a  "shopping  paradise",  an  expert  in  tourism  &  hotel  sector  said.

Coronavirus:  HK  commerce  secretary  says  city  on  high  alert. The  HK  govt  is  on  high  alert  to  deal  with  a  new  flu-like  coronavirus  that  killed  nine  on  the  Chinese  mainland,  said  the  city's  commerce  secretary  in  Davos.

Initial  test  shows  Wuhan  tourist  in  HK  has  new  coronavirus. ​The  Hong  Kong  government  confirmed  that  an  initial  test  shows  that  a  male  tourist  from  Wuhan  has  tested  positive  for  the  new  coronavirus.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  1.27%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  355.71  points,  or  1.27  percent,  to  28,341.04  points.
Travel  documents  of  HK,  Macao  carry  more  benefits. Mainland  services  in  immigration  bring  convenience  in  all  aspects  of  life.

Mainland  buyers  cool  on  HK  property  following  protests. Chinese  mainland  buyers,  once  the  driving  force  behind  HK’s  stratospheric  home  prices​,  are  now  shunning  the  city  after  months  of  protests.

HK  govt  condoles  accidental  death  of  3  Customs  officers. 5  Customs  officers  fell  to  the  sea  as  their  vessel  capsized  after  ramming  an  unknown  object  while  patrolling  the  waters  near  Sha  Chau  on  Tuesday.

HK  residents  urged  to  avoid  Wuhan  as  epidemic  worsens. Leading  Hong  Kong  epidemiologist  said  the  new  coronavirus  is  less  harmful  than  that  of  SARS,  but  warned  the  epidemic  enters  the  3rd  round  of  transmission.

Privacy  watchdog  seeks  legal  teeth  to  combat  'doxxing'. Hong  Kong’s  privacy  watchdog  is  seeking  law  amendments  that  would  give  it  powers  to  investigate  and    prosecute  offenders  of  doxxing.

PLA  Hong  Kong  Garrison  pays  tribute  to  HK  compatriots. The  PLA  Hong  Kong  Garrison  on  Tuesday  paid  tribute  to  local  compatriots  who  have  safeguarded  the  rule  of  law  and  "one  country,  two  systems"  in  HK.

HK’s  jobless  rate  tipped  to  hit  4.8%  by  yearend. HK's  unemployment  rate  may  swell  to  4.8%  by  the  end  of  this  year  as  the  local  economy  is  tipped  to  contract  1.5%  for  the  full  year,  economists  warned.

Pneumonia,  rating  downgrade  rattle  stock  market. HK's  stocks  went  into  a  tailspin  on  Tuesday  investors  harbor  fears  over  the    Wuhan  pneumonia  outbreak  and  Moody's  credit-rating  downgrade  on  HK.

Acting  CE:  HK  govt  on  highest  alert  against  Wuhan  virus. The  HK  govt  is  on  its  highest  alert  against  the  threat  of  the  Wuhan  virus  as  the  city's  chance  of  reporting  its  first  confirmed  case  is  far  from  negligible.

HK  residents  urged  not  to  visit  Wuhan. Medical  experts  from  the  HKU  estimated  that  as  of  Jan  17  the  new  coronavirus  might  have  infected  over  1,300  people  in  Wuhan  and  another  300  outside  the  city.

Privacy  watchdog  seeks  legal  teeth  to  combat  'doxxing'. The  privacy  commissioner  for  personal  data  proposed  to  amend  the  Personal  Data  (Privacy)  Ordinance  to  gain  sanctioning  powers  on  offenders.

HK  govt  strongly  disagrees  with  Moody's  move  to  cut  rating. The  SAR  govt  strongly  disagreed  with  Moody's  assessment  of  HK's  current  situation  after  the  agency  downgraded  the  city's  credit  rating  to  "Aa3"  .
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  2.81%  lower. The  benchmark  Hang  Seng  Index  traded  between  27,980.5  and  28,492.03.

China  Water  Environment  to  eye  US$500m  IPO  in  Hong  Kong. China  Water  Environment  Group  is  considering  an  initial  public  offering  in  Hong  Kong  that  could  raise  more  than  US$500m,  according  to  sources.

186  arrested  in  new  year's  anti-triad  operation. Hong  Kong  police  said  Tuesday  that  186  people,  including  68  men  and  118  women,  aged  between  14  and  71,  were  arrested  in  connection  with  triad.
HK's  liaison:  SAR  can  learn  from  Macao. New  chief  vows  to  help  ensure  ‘one  country,  two  systems’  implemented.

HK  steps  up  fight  against  pneumonia  outbreak. Hong  Kong  has  boosted  preventive  measures  against  a  pneumonia  outbreak  that  originated  in  the  central  mainland  city  of  Wuhan  last  month.
HK’s  jobless  rate  rises  to  3.3  percent. Labor  secretary  says  market  will  continue  to  suffer  if  overall  economy  stays  weak.

HK  is  ‘least  affordable  housing  market’  for  10th  year  running. HK  has  been  ranked  as  the  world’s  least  affordable  housing  market  for  2019  –  for  the  10th  consecutive  year  –  according  to  a  survey  released  on  Monday.
HK  jobless  rate  rises  for  3rd  month  in  longest  run  in  decade. The  unemployment  rate  rose  to  3.3%  for  the  October  to  December  period,  the  highest  since  March  2017.

HKIFA:  Retirees  should  learn  to  manage  investment  risks  after  retiring. HKIFA  recommends  local  pensioners  learn  to  manage  investment  risk  as  investment  returns  play  a  pivotal  role  in  their  post-retirement  finance.

Organizer  arrested  after  HK  rally  turns  violent. Ventus  Lau  was  arrested  on  Sunday  evening  on  charges  of  "obstruction  of  police  administration"  &  violating  terms  set  when  the  rally  was  allowed.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.90%  lower. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  down  260.51  points,  or  0.90  percent,  to  28,795.91  points.

Call  for  mandatory  health  declarations  at  HK  checkpoints. Ho  Pak-leung,  president  of  the  Centre  for  Infection  at  the  HKU,  suggested  the  government  start  accepting  mandatory  health  declarations  at  checkpoints.

Violence  takes  toll  on  tourism,  retail  in  HK. Hong  Kong  recently  as  the  impact  of  lingering  violence  and  chaos  in  the  Asian  financial  hub  loomed  large  on  service  sectors  such  as  tourism.
5  to  represent  HK  in  national  English-speaking  contest. Education  secretary  welcomes  the  contest  as  a  channel  to  equip  local  students  with  21st  century  learning  skills.
HKSAR  government:  Respect  constitutional  order. Spokesman  condemns  calls  for  foreign  intervention  in  city’s  affairs  after  violent  protests  on  Sunday.
Rally  organizer  ‘irresponsible’  in  encouraging  radicals  to  attack  officers. Senior  police  superintendent  condemns  assaults  and  also  comments  by  rally  organizer.
E-services  to  be  restored  at  Cross-Harbour  Tunnel. E-services  at  Cross-Harbour  Tunnel  will  be  restored  from  7  am  on  Monday,  announced  the  Hong  Kong  government.

HKSAR  govt  urges  respect  for  constitutional  order. The  govt  iterated  its  position  as  hundreds  of  radicals  gathered  in  Central  on  Sunday  afternoon,  blocking  roads  and  assaulting  police  officers.

Finance  chief:  HK  mustn't  lose  faith  in  youth. Hong  Kong  must  not  give  up  on  its  youth  and  should  invest  in  future  generations,  the  city's  Financial  Secretary  Paul  Chan  said  at  a  forum  on  Saturday.

5  to  represent  HK  in  national  English-speaking  contest. The  regional  contest  of  the  "21st  Century  Cup"  National  English  Speaking  Competition  saw  a  record  number  of  thousands  of  participants  this  year.

Housing  chief  says  government  open  to  rent  control  options. Frank  Chan  said  the  task  force  to  be  set  up  to  study  the  tenancy  control  of  subdivided  units  will  be  given  latitude  to  work.

10  initiatives  are  for  long-term,  says  HK  chief  secretary. The  10  initiatives  announced  by  the  chief  executive  earlier  this  week  were  meant  to  be  institutional  changes  and  not  one-off  measures,  said  the  city's  chief  secretary.

Transport  sector  to  get  HK$1.5b  relief  aid. Hong  Kong  govt  plans  to  help  transport  services  operators  ride  out  financial  difficulties  caused  by  social  unrest  that  has  disrupted  their  operations.

HKMA:  Banks'  profitability  may  be  squeezed  by  uncertainty. Banks'  profitability  may  be  squeezed  by  uncertain  global  economic  environment,  a  slowing  mainland  economy  and  persistent  low  interest-rate  environment.

Resilient  'rat'  seen  to  bring  sparkle  to  stock  market. Feng  Shui  Index:  Hang  Seng  Index  will  get  off  to  a  good  start  in  the  Year  of  the  Rat,  with  the  property,  resources,  healthcare  and  consumer  sectors  seen  as  good  bets.

Pistol  'ready  for  use'  found  in  arrestee's  Sha  Tin  residence. ​Police  said  they  seized  a  fully  functional  pistol  "ready  for  use"  and  92  bullets  on  Friday  at  the  residence  of  a  27-year-old  man  who  was  arrested.

Govt  proposes  HK$1.5b  relief  fund  to  help  transport  sector. The  proposal  was  made  by  Secretary  for  Transport  and  Housing  Frank  Chan  Fan  at  the  Legislative  Council’s  transport  panel  meeting  on  Friday.

Tuen  Ma  Line  Phase  1  to  open  on  Feb  14. Secretary  for  Transport  and  Housing  Frank  Chan  Fan  said  Friday  that  the  line  has  met  all  safety  standards  and  is  ready  for  operation.

HKMA:  No  'massive'  capital  outflow  from  banks  amid  unrest. Hong  Kong's  banks  are  profitable  and  are  maintaining  "good  asset  quality,”  HKMA  Deputy  Chief  Executive  Arthur  Yuen  said  Friday.

HK-Australia  free  trade  agreement  enters  into  force. The  trade  pack  will  offer  HK  traders  and  investors  better  legal  certainty  and  more    market  access  while  creating  business  flows  between  the  city  and  Australia.

HK  environment  chief  opens  dialogue  on  social  media. Asked  about  the  level  of  dioxins  in  air  in  view  of  tear  gas  used  by  the  police,  Wong  Kam-sing  said  the  index  recorded  showed  little  change  in  level.

HK  ramps  up  pneumonia  prevention  ahead  of  holiday. The  Hong  Kong  government  has  stepped  up  precautions  against  the  Wuhan  pneumonia  ahead  of  the  peak  travel  season  of  the  Chinese  New  Year.

Carrie  Lam  to  lead  HK  delegation  to  WEF  Davos  meet. Lam  will  head  to  the  forum  with  the  aim  of  reassuring  that  HK's  strengths  and  advantages  continue  to  serve  the  city  well,  the  Chief  Executive's  Office  said.

Cathay's  traffic  slide  eases  but  significant  challenges  remain. Cathay  Pacific  said  travel  bookings  show  a  "significant  shortfall"  later  this  month  as  protests  have  discouraged  people  from  coming  to  Hong  Kong.
LegCo  plans  to  fast-track  maternity  leave  bill. Motion  to  approve  idea  was  passed  38-20  with  1  abstention.

Lam  espouses  'one  country,  two  systems'. HK  CE  Carrie  Lam  Cheng  Yuet-ngor  calls  on  people  to  back  the  "one  country,  two  systems"  principle  ,  which  she  expects  to  continue  after  2047.

Stock  market  greets  trade  deal  with  ‘cautious  optimism’. Hong  Kong  stocks  ended  trading  on  Wednesday  with  a  touch  of  cautious  optimism  among  investors  following  the  signing  of  the  China-US  trade  deal.

HK  surpasses  Shanghai  to  become  world’s  priciest  city  for  luxury  consumers. Hong  Kong  is  now  the  world’s  most  expensive  city  for  luxury  consumers,  
according  to  a  new  report  released  on  Thursday.
HK  police  chief  rejects  allegations  protesters  being  sent  to  mainland. Chris  Tang  Ping-keung  said  some  District  Councilors  preferred  angry  outbursts  to  rational  discussions.

2  more  arrested  after  explosives  found  in  Sheung  Shui. The  women,  who  are  suspected  of  manufacturing  explosives,  are  the  wife  and  the  mother  of  a  man  arrested  two  days  ago  in  relation  to  the  case.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.38%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  109.45  points,  or  0.38  percent,  to  28,883.04  points.

HK  is  months  behind  on  tax  collection  after  protest  chaos. Only  about  one-third  of  tax  assessments  for  individuals  have  been  made  as  of  Dec  31,  according  to  the  city’s  Inland  Revenue  Department.

Hong  Kong  ranked  most  expensive  city  for  luxuries. Hong  Kong  was  cited  frequently  in  a  report  by  Julius  Baer  in  the  top  10  most  expensive  municipalities  for  categories  such  as  fine  dining  and  luxury.

CE:  'One  country,  two  systems'  can  continue  beyond  2047. Carrie  Lam  was  speaking  in  a  question-and-answer  session  at  the  Legislative  Council,  her  first  appearance  in  the  LegCo  this  year.

Singapore  companies  abandon  home  to  list  in  Hong  Kong. In  2019,  10  Singapore  firms  debuted  in  Hong  Kong,  raising  US$155  million,  a  25  percent  increase  from  2018,  according  to  data  compiled  by  Bloomberg.
Homemade  pipe  bomb:  Six  more  arrested. Suspects  are  believed  to  belong  to  a  low-profile  radical  group  with  plans  to  detonate  the  bomb  at  a  mass  public  event.
Luo  calls  for  upholding  'one  country,  two  systems'. Luo  Huining  appeals  to  people  to  cherish  Hong  Kong  and  uphold  rule  of  law.
Govt:  Human  rights,  freedom  fully  protected  in  HKSAR. A  spokesman  for  the  HKSAR  govt  was  responding  to  media  enquiries  about  a  report  issued  by  Human  Rights  Watch.
HK  total  visitor  arrivals  in  2019  down  14.2%  amid  unrest. HKTB  chairman  says  industry  faced  ‘exceptional  challenges’  last  year.

HK  calls  off  Lunar  New  Year  fireworks  display  amid  unrest. This  is  the  third  fireworks  display  canceled  since  the  protests  that  began  in  June.  The  National  Day  and  New  Year's  Eve  fireworks  had  also  been  canceled.

Health  official:  Wuhan  disease  has  2-week  incubation  period. As  of  Tuesday,  the  Hospital  Authority  has  reported  76  cases  that  might  be  related  to  the  Wuhan  outbreak.  Sixty  of  the  patients  have  since  been  discharged.

New  liaison  chief  calls  for  cherishing  Hong  Kong. Luo  Huining,  director  of  the  central  government's  liaison  office  in  HK,  made  the  remarks  at  the  office's  annual  Spring  Festival  reception  on  Wednesday.

HK  on  course  for  first  deficit  in  15  years:  PwC. Hong  Kong  is  on  course  to  record  its  first  deficit  in  15  years,  yet  the  city's  overall  fiscal  standing  remains  strong,  according  to  expert  at  PwC.

Financial  secretary  expects  limited-partnership  fund  regime  to  attract  capital. HK's  proposed  new  limited-partnership  fund  regime  is  expected  to  attract  more  private  equity  funds  and  venture  capital  funds  to  the  city,  FS  said  on  Wednesday.

Hong  Kong,  Macao  deputies  briefed  on  top  legislature's  work. Deputies  from  HK  and  Macao  to  the  13th  National  People's  Congress  were  asked  to  make  preparations  for  the  upcoming  annual  session  of  the  NPC.
Hong  Kong  shares  falter  before  Sino-US  trade  deal. At  the  close  of  trade,  the  Hang  Seng  index  was  down  0.4%  at  28,773.59.

HK  govt  warns  of  homemade  bombs  as  explosives  seized. Police  on  Tuesday  defused  a  pipe  bomb  found  in  a  Mong  Kok  flat  and  arrested  four  men  on  suspicion  of  manufacturing  explosives.

Hong  Kong  IPOs  come  alive  thanks  to  some  sauerkraut  fish. Jiumaojiu  International  Holdings  Ltd  soared  56%  after  pricing  at  the  high  end  of  expectations.  Before  its  debut,  just  2  of  six  firms  rose  on  their  first  day  in  2020.
HK  govt  to  spend  extra  HK$10b  to  address  livelihood  issues. To  cope  with  economic  downturn,  CE  announces  new  measures  to  help  elderly  and  low-income  people.

Lam  promises  resources  for  courts,  updates  virus  alert. CE  Carrie  Lam  said  her  administration  will  allocate  additional  resources  to  the  judiciary  if  the  courts  need  help  to  deal  with  unrest-related  cases  expeditiously.

Fintech  hub  vision  calls  for  talent,  collaboration. HK  can  flex  its  muscles  in  capital  access,  nurturing  talents  and  beefing  up  collaboration  with  the  mainland  to  cement  its  status  as  fintech  services  hub.
Marching  toward  a  greener  future  for  mankind. Experts  urge  private  investors  to  play  key  role  in  confronting  risks  posed  by  climate  change.

China  ups  the  stakes  in  green  bond  push. China  is  making  good  progress  in  aligning  itself  with  international  standards  for  green  bonds,  expert  in  green  and  sustainable  financing  says.

Get  'private  sector'  more  involved  in  agriculture. In  an  age  when  digital  agriculture  is  being  actively  promoted,  greater  private  capital  should  be  injected  into  the  agriculture  industry,  an  academic  says.

Risks  may  spur  climate  change  investments. Climate  change  related  investments  are  poised  to  climb  rapidly  in  coming  years  as  risks  associated  with  the  problem  intensify,  Hannah  Routh  reckons.

EDB  to  start  vetting  private  school  fees  after  watchdog  flak. The  Education  Bureau  said  it  would  start  vetting  refundable  fees  charged  by  private  schools,  which  could  amount  to  a  few  thousand  to  a  few  million  dollars.

Chow  Tai  Fook  to  shut  down  stores  with  tourism  at  record  low. About  40  stores  will  have  their  leases  expire  in  the  financial  year  starting  in  April  and  the  company  plans  to  shut  about  mid-teens  of  those.

Yum  China  'to  work  with  CICC,  Goldman  on  HK  listing'. A  successful  share  sale  by  New  York-listed  Yum  China  would  bolster  Hong  Kong’s  push  to  lure  marquee  mainland  firms  to  raise  funds  in  the  city.
HK  pins  hopes  on  trade,  finance  to  restore  economy. Economists  expect  investor  sentiment  in  Hong  Kong  to  remain  strong  this  year.

Hong  Kong  stocks  fall  from  8-month  high  as  investors  book  profits. The  Hang  Seng  index  closed  lower  0.2%  at  28,885.14  after  rising  as  much  as  0.7%  to  an  eight-month  high,  while  the  China  Enterprises  Index  lost  0.4%  to  11,355.37.
HK  government  pledges  another  HK$10  billion  in  economic  relief. The  proposed  new  spending  brings  the  global  financial  hub's  total  stimulus  to  HK$35  billion  since  this  summer.

Yuan  rally  gives  HK  stock  traders  another  reason  to  buy. Forecasters  are  raising  their  targets  on  Hong  Kong  stock  market  as  it  has  gone  from  pariah  to  darling  in  under  half  a  year.

HK  fashion  label  maker  SML  explores  US$500  million  sale. The  closely  held  garment  label  maker  for  global  fashion  brands  and  retailers  is  reportedly  working  with  Citigroup  to  seek  a  buyer  for  the  business.

CE:  Govt  to  offer  extra  resources  if  courts  need  so. Lam's  remarks  came  a  day  after  HK's  chief  justice  said  a  task  force  had  been  set  up  to  study  how  courts  could  handle  effectively  surging  volume  of  cases.

Tse  explores  ways  out  of  House  Committee  deadlock. Paul  Tse  Wai-chun  is  considering  ways  to  resolve  the  gridlock  the  House  Committee  is  facing  after  failing  to  elect  its  leaders  in  12  meetings  since  October.

Politicized  local  councils  worrying. Paul  Tse  Wai-chun  said  it  is  unfortunate  some  hardworking  and  experienced  pro-establishment  candidates  failed  to  be  elected  in  the  2019  DC  elections.

Lawyer:  The  city's  core  values  under  threat. Paul  Tse  Wai-chun,  a  legislator  and  a  lawyer,  is  saddened  that  the  rule  of  law  and  judicial  independence  —  HK's  core  values  —  are  now  under  threat.

Exercising  one's  rights  no  'excuse'  for  violence. Hong  Kong’s  legal  heavyweights  stressed  on  Monday  that  exercising  one’s  rights  has  limits  within  the  law,  and  does  not  justify  violence.

Lam:  HK's  financial  setup  solid  despite  volatilities. Hong  Kong  remains  the  business  bridge  between  Chinese  mainland  and  the  world  despite  all  uncertainties,  senior  officials  told  AFF  on  Monday.

Securitization  hub  plan  to  open  new  chapter  for  SAR. Anthony  Francis  Neoh  said  there's  much  scope  for  creating  jobs  in  the  financial  sector  through  securitization  proposals  made  in  a  newly  released  white  paper.

Ocean  Park  gets  HK$10.6b  lift  to  boost  fortunes. Cash-strapped  Ocean  Park  Hong  Kong  will  get  HK$10.64  billion  cash  injection  from  the  SAR  government  as  part  of  a  major  revamp  to  lift  its  fortunes.

PolyU  starts  new  term  despite  damaged  facilities. Heavily  damaged  HK  PolyU  reopened  on  Monday  as  schedule,  marking  the  start  of  its  spring  semester,  while  10  percent  of  its  facilities  remained  closed.

Carrie  Lam  says  financial  hub's  strengths  intact  despite  protests. The  chief  executive  added  she  was  confident  the  city  will  bridge  divisions,  and  realise  its  goals  of  a  reunited  community  and  "flourishing"  economy.

Chief  Justice:  HK  judiciary  plans  to  accelerate  protest  trials. HK's  judiciary  has  made  plans  to  facilitate  the  process  of  dealing  with  the  cases  related  to  protests,  said  Chief  Justice  Geoffrey  Ma  Tao-li  on  Monday.

Sale  of  Asia  ex-Japan  G3  bonds  in  HK  sees  3-year  high  in  2019. AxJ  G3  bond  issuance  hit  a  3-year  high  in  2019  amid  low  interest  rates  and  a  possible  resolution  to  US-China  trade  tensions,  according  to  an  bank  official.
HK  shares  close  at  8-month  high  ahead  of  Sino-US  trade  deal. The  Hang  Seng  index  rose  1.1%  to  28,954.94,  the  highest  close  since  May  8,  2019.

CE  backs  disciplinary  action  for  wayward  teachers,  civil  servants. The  Hong  Kong  leader  backed  on  Sunday  a  call  for  firmly  handling  teachers  ​and  civil  servants  suspected  to  be  involved  in  violent  protests.

Liaison  office  to  boost  ties  between  HK,  Guangdong. Both  sides  agreed  to  jointly  promote  the  development  of  the  Greater  Bay  Area  and  to  further  enhance  cross-border  cooperation  based  on  mutual  benefits.

It's  only  going  to  get  wilder  for  Hong  Kong  dollar  traders. Volatility  in  the  city’s  interbank  rates  has  been  especially  acute  since  mid  Dec,  2019,  stoking  a  nearly  0.8%  gain  for  the  Hong  Kong  dollar  in  a  month.

Unrest  in  Hong  Kong  has  silenced  the  music. Citing  safety  and  traffic  concerns  due  to  ongoing  social  unrest  in  the  city,  concert  organizer  ESL  on  Nov  21  called  off  all  the  singer's  25  shows  in  Hong  Kong.

HK's  first  digital  bank  offers  6%  rate  that  dwarfs  HSBC's. ZA  Bank  has  begun  a  trial  run  that  pays    depositors  over  3  percentage  points  more  than  established  banks  such  as  HSBC  and  Standard  Chartered.
Govt,  local  party  join  to  improve  people’s  lives. Livelihood  problems  in  Hong  Kong  are  expected  to  be  addressed  more  comprehensively.

HK  pro-police  actor  firm  after  being  targeted  by  rioters. Actor  Mat  Yeung  has  been  keeping  his  stance  firmly  to  support  HK  police    for  their  hard  works  to  keep  peace  and  stability  of  the  society.

DAB  kicks  off  service  day. DAB  launched  its  service  Day  to  fulfill  its  promise  to  serve  all  Hong  Kong  residents  despite  losing  a  number  of  seats  in  the  District  Council  election.
HK's  first  digital  bank  offers  6%  rate  that  dwarfs  HSBC's. ZA  Bank  Ltd  is  offering  the  6  percent  rate  for  three-month  Hong  Kong  dollar  deposits  capped  at  US$25,000.

Hong  Kong's  small  business  sentiment  gets  a  holiday  bump. The  rise  in  business  sentiment  in  December  signaled  that  the  Christmas  shopping  season  had  brought  some  stabilization  to  the  sector.

Wuhan  disease:  New  strain  '80%  similar  to  SARS  coronavirus'. The  SAR  government  has  stepped  up  temperature  screening  of  travelers  at  all  border  control  points  as  one  patient  with  viral  pneumonia  has  died  in  Wuhan.

Local  talents  shine  at  creative  writing  competition. Organized  by  the  Hong  Kong  Federation  of  Journalists  jointly  with  China  Daily  Hong  Kong,  the  competition  received  over  4,000  Chinese  and  English  entries.

CE  visits  wife  of  man  set  ablaze. Carrie  Lam  has  passed  a  donation  of  HK$300,000  raised  by  the  construction  sector  to  the  wife  of  the  man,  who  is  still  being  treated  in  hospital.

Cheung  vows  closer  ties  with  district  councils. The  Hong  Kong  government  pledged  on  Friday  to  work  more  closely  with  district  councils  after  holding  its  first  meeting  with  newly  elected  councilors.

Opposition  accused  of  halting  city's  progress  with  filibustering. Civil  leaders  accused  the  opposition  of  using  all  political  means  to  undermine  the  government's  administration  at  the  expense  of  HK  people's  benefits.

New  liaison  chief  meets  HK  political  heavyweights. Luo  Huining  is  proactively  fulfilling  his  duty  after  taking  office  on  Jan  4,  visiting  local  influential  figures  to  exchange  views  on  how  to  put  HK  back  on  track.

HKSAR  government  issues  red  outbound  travel  alert  on  Iran. The  alert  came  after  a  Ukraine  flight  to  Kiev  from  Tehran  crashed  on  shortly  after  taking  off  on  Wednesday,  killing  all  176  people  on  board.

SHKP  joins  drive  to  resolve  HK  housing  woes. ​Sun  Hung  Kai  Properties  has  said  it  would  lease  three  plots  of  land  in  the  New  Territories  at  a  nominal  cost  for  the  building  for  transitional  housing.

Hong  Kongers  more  depressed  than  ever  after  months  of  unrest. The  Lancet  article  says  1  in  5  adults  reports  probable  depression  or  suspected  PTSD,  comparable  to  those  experiencing  armed  conflicts.

Swire  cuts  HK  rents  as  protests  slam  retail,  tourism. HK-based  real-estate  and  aviation  group  Swire  Pacific  is  offering  rent  concessions  to  its  tenants  on  a  case-by-case  basis,  said  its  finance  director.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.27%  higher. The  benchmark  Hang  Seng  Index  closed  up  77.20  points,  or  0.27  percent,  to  28,638.2  points  on  Friday.

31  HK  civil  servants  suspended  for  roles  in  protests. HK's  secretary  for  civil  service  said  the  govt  had  suspended  the  31  people  in  public  interest  &  in  consideration  of  how  their  conduct  reflected  on  the  cadre.

2020:  Stopping  the  ‘downpour’  and  fixing  the  ‘leaking  roof’. HK’s  tourism  and  retail  sectors,  in  particular,  have  been  caught  up  in  a  tumultuous  year.  Economists,  however,  are  holding  out  hope  if  the  social  unrest  can  end  soon.

Hong  Kong  peg  architect  slams  'naive'  Bank  of  England  report. The  Bank  of  England  should  apologize  for  a  report  which  warned  risks  of  fund  outflows  after  the  city's  protests,  said  an  architect  of  HK's  dollar  peg.

Sunac  joins  mainland  developers'  share  sale  push  in  HK. Sunac  China  Holdings  plans  to  sell  new  shares  worth  HK$8  billion  (US$1.03  billion)  to  third  party  investors  through  its  placement  agent  Morgan  Stanley.
New  liaison  office  chief  pledges  support  for  HK. Luo  meets  SAR  chief  executive,  expresses  high  regard  for  her  courage,  commitment.

Stay  clear  of  wild  animal  meat,  warn  medical  experts. Experts  warned  against  consuming  game  meat  after  preliminary  research  shed  more  light  on  the  virus  responsible  for  a  pneumonia-like  disease  outbreak.
Govt:  Mask  ban  in  line  with  Basic  Law. Barrister  representing  Department  of  Justice  says  the  anti-mask  law  was  a  proportional  response  to  the  state  of  affairs  in  the  city.

Xie:  Separating  HK  from  China  'wishful  thinking'. Any  attempt  to  separate  HK  from  the  nation  and  turn  it  into  an  independent  or  semi-independent  political  entity  is  nothing  but  wishful  thinking,  Xie  said.

Innovative  'chef'  with  a  balanced,  'ready-to-go  meal'. Metta  Communications'  managing  director  said  the  company's  model  of  providing  readily  available  services  was  like  having  fine  dining  in  a  restaurant.

HK  finance  chief  pledges  bold  spending  to  boost  growth. Paul  Chan  pledged  the  annual  budget  due  on  Feb  26  will  maintain  spending  on  infrastructure  and  public  services  even  as  it  includes  additional  stimulus.

Commissioner:  Plot  to  split  HK  from  China  'wishful  thinking'. Xie  Feng,  commissioner  of  the  Foreign  Ministry  of  the  People's  Republic  of  China  in  the  HKSAR,  made  the  remarks  
at  the  office’s  annual  spring  reception.

HKEx  chief  warns  of  economic  'devastation'  from  protests. HK-based  companies  are  expected  to  show  the  scars  of  the  sometimes  violent  protests  in  the  next  few  weeks  when  they  report  their  annual  results.

New  liaison  office  chief  says  to  fully  support  HKSAR  govt. The  central  government's  new  liaison  office  chief  in  Hong  Kong  Luo  Huining  met  with  the  city's  Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  on  Thursday.

Wuhan-wary  mainlanders  in  HK  conned  into  taking  vaccine  shots. Medical  experts  cried  foul  after  mainland  tourists  were  tricked  into  taking  standard  pneumococcal  vaccine  shots  in  Hong  Kong  to  fend  off  the  Wuhan  disease.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  1.68%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  473.08  points,  or  1.68  percent,  to  28,561.0  points.
Silver  linings  amid  fear,  anguish. The  long-escalating  tension  in  Hong  Kong  has  taken  a  toll  on  the  Asian  financial  hub  and  its  residents.

Opposition  filibuster  blocks  maternity  leave  extension  bill. The  government  had  hoped  the  bill  could  pass  by  Thursday  so  that  the  new  14-week  maternity  leave  would  take  effect  by  2021.

Commissioner's  office:  US  not  qualified  to  point  fingers  at  HK. The  remarks  from  the  office  were  made  in  response  to  a  US  congressional  report  that  distorted  facts  and  interfered  in  Hong  Kong  affairs.

Hong  Kong  City’super  owner  explores  majority  stake  sale. The  majority  shareholder  of  City  Super  Group,  the  Fenix  Group,  is  exploring  a  sale  of  the  high-end  supermarket  chain  that  could  fetch  US$300m  to  US$400m.

New  liaison  chief  meets  SZ  leaders,  vows  closer  ties. This  is  Luo  Huining’s  first  public  meeting  with  mainland  officials  since  his  appointment  as  liaison  chief  in  the  HKSAR  on  Saturday.
Further  decline  in  HK  retail  sales  predicted. Annual  retail  sales  for  2019  are  estimated  to  decline  by  11.2  percent  to  HK$431  billion.

Education  secretary  stands  by  position  on  teacher  misconduct. Kevin  Yeung  Yun-hung  has  warned  that  teachers  engaging  in  illegal  activities  and  getting  arrested  face  both  disciplinary  and  legal  action.

HKSAR  govt  shoots  down  inaccurate  US  house  panel  report. The  govt  expressed  regret  Thursday  that  a  report  related  to  HK  issued  by  the  US  Congressional-Executive  Commission  on  China  distorted  ground  reality.
Time  to  review  Liberal  Studies:  Yeung. Secretary  for  Education  said  it  cannot  be  concluded  that  Liberal  Studies  played  a  big  part  in  the  social  unrest  in  Hong  Kong,
Politics  should  have  no  place  in  schools. Schools  are  for  teaching;  politicized  campuses  breed  conflict  and  isolation  of  students.
Silver  lining  seen  despite  market  rout. The  Hang  Seng  Index  sank  0.83  percent,  or  234.14  points,  to  close  at  28,087.92  points  on  Wednesday.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.83%  lower. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  down  234.14  points,  or  0.83  percent,  to  28,087.92  points.

HKEx  remains  world's  top  IPO  market  in  2019. Hong  Kong  Exchanges  and  Clearing  topped  the  world's  IPO  league  table  for  a  second  straight  year  in  2019,  also  the  seventh  time  in  the  last  11  years.

Repairs  to  HK  traffic  signals,  footpaths  set  to  cost  HK$65m. The  Transport  and  Housing  Bureau  confirmed  that  repair  work  on  740  sets  of  traffic  lights  damaged  by  radicals  had  been  completed  Thursday.

HK  eye  hospital  acquires  plot  to  build  third  unit  in  Shenzhen. C-Mer  Eye  Care  has  invested  209  million  yuan  to  secure  a  plot  of  land  in  Pingshan,  where  it  will  set  up  a  new  hospital  to  serve  as  its  Bay  Area  headquarters.

Disney  faces  pressure  to  help  ease  Hong  Kong's  housing  crisis. HK's  secretary  for  transport  and  housing  said  he  wants  to  build  homes  on  a  60-hectare  plot  of  land  Disney  holds  for  potential  expansion  of  its  Disneyland.

HK  unrest  sees  luxury  brands  shutting  shop. The  prolonged  social  unrest  and  losses  in  retail  sales  for  months  in  Hong  Kong  have  resulted  in  luxury  international  brands  closing  their  flagship  stores.

Hong  Kong's  foreign  currency  reserve  assets  up  in  Dec. The  official  foreign  currency  reserves  of  Hong  Kong  expanded  to  US$441.3  billion  at  the  end  of  Dec  2019  from  that  of  US$434.2  billion  at  the  end  of  Nov.
Shenzhen  advisers  urge  stronger  links  with  Hong  Kong. Political  advisers  in  Shenzhen,  Guangdong  province,  called  for  enhanced  youth  exchanges  between  the  city  and  Hong  Kong.
CE  has  legitimate  powers  to  invoke  ERO:  Basic  Law  expert. Ruling  of  ERO  and  anti-mask  law  as  inconsistent  with  Basic  Law  is  highly  controversial:  ​Priscilla  Leung  Mei-fun.
Lawmaker  condemns  attacks  on  judiciary. Priscilla  Leung  Mei-fun  says  that  the  SAR  government  and  police  should  protect  the  personal  safety  of  the  judges.

SAR  chief  executive  calls  for  fresh  start  in  2020. Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  vowed  to  lead  society  to  a  fresh  start  in  2020  amid  economic  woes  and  as  unemployment  continues  to  rise.

HK  unveils  measures  to  prevent  spread  of  pneumonia-like  disease. Patients  suspected  of  having  symptoms  of  pneumonia  as  they  enter  HK  from  Wuhan  will  be  mandatorily  quarantined,  banned  from  leaving,  from  Wednesday.

HK  to  hold  4-day  carnival  to  celebrate  Chinese  New  Year. The  Tourism  Board  announced  on  Tuesday  that  a  carnival  instead  of  a  float  parade  will  be  held  from  Jan  25-28  to  celebrate  the  Chinese  New  Year.
Bonanza  for  MPF  members  in  2019. MPF  Scheme  members  reaped  an  average  of  HK$24,441  ($3,133)  through  their  investments  last  year,  partly  thanks  to  quantitative  easing  policies.

Many  mainland  companies  to  have  secondary  listing  in  HK. More  firms,  originally  US-listed,  will  follow  Alibaba's  example,  planning  for  a  secondary  listing  this  year  in  HK,  which  would  boost  confidence  in  local  market.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.34%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  95.87  points,  or  0.34  percent,  to  28,322.06  points.

Lam  vows  to  steer  society  into  path  of  recovery  in  new  year. Hong  Kong  Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  pledged  to  work  with  the  new  Hong  Kong  liaison  chief  to  bring  the  city  back  on  track.

HK  to  put  symptomatic  Wuhan  travelers  in  mandatory  isolation. The  govt  will  amend  the  Prevention  and  Control  of  Disease  Ordinance  so  that  medical  staff  can  place  suspected  patients  under  mandatory  quarantine.

HK  dollar  is  best  Asia  carry  trade,  on  tight  cash  supply. Elevated  local  rates  are  increasing  the  appeal  of  owning  the  currency  as  HK  dollar  has  risen  to  a  three-year  high  after  years  of  depreciation  wagers.

Wuhan  outbreak:  DAB  calls  on  liaison  office  for  coordination. DAB  hoped  the  office  could  ensure  that  Hong  Kong  received  daily  updates  of  developments  related  to  research  into  &  management  of  the  virus,  Starry  Lee  said.

Hong  Kong  landlords  face  tough  times  as  shop,  office  rents  sink. According  to  the  Hong  Kong  Retail  Management  Association,  over  5,600  jobs  could  be  lost  &  thousands  of  stores  may  shut  over  the  coming  six  months.

CE  expects  new  start  for  Hong  Kong  in  2020. Carrie  Lam  said  she  is  confident  that  HK  will  be  able  to  overcome  current  difficulties  and  embrace  a  new  start,  and  urged  all  residents  to  reunite  and  move.

Luo:  'One  country,  two  systems'  remains  HK's  biggest  advantage. New  Hong  Kong  liaison  chief  Luo  Huining  vows  to  carry  out  'one  country,  two  systems'  principle,  saying  he's  confident  to  bring  the  city  back  on  track.
Ip  sees  'qualitative  change'  in  politicized  DC  elections. DAB  adviser  says  defeated  party  members  will  stay  on  to  continue  serving  residents.

HK  courts  'have    no  power'  to  declare  laws  unconstitutional. Ip  Kwok-him  points  out  the  power  to  declare  a  Hong  Kong  law  as  inconsistent  with  the  Basic  Law  rests  with  the  Standing  Committee  of  the  NPC.
New  liaison  chief  expected  to  help  deal  with  crisis. Ip  Kwok-him  believes  "stopping  violence  and  chaos"  will  remain  the  guiding  principle  of  governance  in  Hong  Kong.

DAB  calls  for  more  financial    support  for  police  and  courts. DAB  appealed  to  the  government  to  increase  funding  in  the  upcoming  budget  for  the  city's  police  force  and  courts  after  prolonged  social  unrest.

Private  sector  remains  gloomy  despite  rise  in  PMI. HK's  private  sector  ended  2019  mired  in  a  serious  downturn,  with  December  PMI  data  showing  business  activity  and  new  sales  still  falling  sharply  amid  unrest.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.79%  lower. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  down  225.31  points,  or  0.79  percent,  to  28,226.19  points.

New  HK  liaison  chief  stresses  'one  country,  two  systems'. Luo  Huining  was  appointed  by  the  State  Council  to  replace  Wang  Zhimin  as  the  new  director  of  the  Liaison  Office  of  the  Central  People's  Govt  in  the  HKSAR.

Survey  shows  HK's  private  sector  still  in  severe  downturn. London-based  consulting  firm  IHS  Markit  said  the  rate  of  deterioration  remained  sharp  as  the  average  PMI  reading  for  the  fourth  quarter  of  2019  stood  at  40.

Swiss  daily  sees  US  media's  hypocrisy  in  HK  reportage. Western  media  companies  which  have  no  reporters  in  Hong  Kong  tend  to  resort  to  "half-truth",  according  to  the  Swiss  paper  Neue  Zurcher  Zeitung.

Educators  hail  plan  to  review  HK  textbooks. Experts  and  educators  in  Hong  Kong  hailed  the  Legislative  Council's  latest  proposal  to  set  up  a  task  force  to  review  the  teaching  materials  and  textbooks.

New  top  liaison  official  named  for  Hong  Kong. The  State  Council,  China’s  cabinet,  appointed  Luo  Huining  as  top  liaison  official  in  HKSAR,  replacing  former  director  Wang  Zhimin.

Finance  chief:  Violence  dents  Hong  Kong's  global  image. Unrest  harmed  Hong  Kong’s  reputation  as  a  reliable  aviation  hub  and  dented  the  confidence  of  foreign  businesses  in  the  city,  said  Paul  Chan  Mo-po.
HK  reports  8  more  suspected  cases  of  Wuhan  pneumonia. The  HK  government  has  stepped  up  monitoring  the  health  of  travelers  at  the  airport  and  high-speed  train  station.

Luo  Huining  appointed  director  of  Liaison  Office  in  HKSAR. The  State  Council  on  Saturday  appointed  Luo  Huining  as  Director  of  the  Liaison  Office  of  the  Central  People's  Government  in  the  HKSAR.

2  missing  after  fishing  boat  sinks  in  Hong  Kong. Two  people  were  missing  and  seven  others  rescued  after  a  fishing  boat  sank  in  waters  off  Lantau  Island  in  Hong  Kong  on  Saturday  evening.

Cheung:  Stopping  violence  crucial  to  economic  recovery. A  senior  HK  official  said  on  Saturday  that  stopping  violence  and  restoring  order  are  crucial  to  the  recovery  of  Hong  Kong  economy.

HK  steps  up  response  as  Wuhan  reports  more  pneumonia  cases. The  Hong  Kong  government  raised  the  response  level  for  infectious  diseases  to  “serious”on  Saturday  in  response  to  the  outbreak  of  pneumonia  in  Wuhan.
