HKSAR  govt  refutes  UK  report,  opposes  foreign  meddling. The  HKSAR  govt  categorically  refuted  allegations  made  in  the  Six-monthly  Report  on  Hong  Kong  issued  by  the  UK's  Foreign  and  Commonwealth  Office.

​Hong  Kong  govt  condemns  Halloween  violence. HKSAR  govt  strongly  condemned  the  violent  acts  on  Thursday,  criticizing  such  illegal  acts  "disrupted  social  order  and  jeopardized  people's  safety."

Painting  our  way  out  of  the  climate  change  corner. Two  eminent  scientists  have  started  a  project  to  tackle  global  climate  change  by  capturing  greenhouse  gas  emissions,  with  the  aim  of  making  China  a  world  leader  in  eliminating  air  pollution.

Hong  Kong  High  Court  bans  online  incitement  of  violence. Lawmaker  believes  the  injunction  order  makes  it  easier  for  prosecutor  to  make  a  case  of  incitement  and  will  help  the  police  in  law  enforcement  operations.

FM  commissioner  blasts  UK’s  interference  with  report  on  HK  affairs. Chinese  Foreign  Ministry’s  Commissioner’s  Office  in  the  SAR  says  Britain  has  no  right  to  interfere  in  China’s  affairs.
Experts  decry  lenient  sentence  for  flag  defilement. Community  service  sentence  ignores  seriousness  of  flag  desecrating  offender's  crime,  legal  experts  say.

Calls  mount  to  halt  violence  or  shelve  upcoming  polls. People  from  a  wide  section  of  community  call  for  the  SAR  government  to  put  off  the  upcoming  DC  polls,  out  of  concerns  over  the  election's  fairness.
HK  is  officially  in  a  recession. The  city's  economy  takes  a  severe  battering,with  negative  full-year  growth  expected  amid  trade  row  and  enduring  protests.

HK  chief  justice  says  he  wants  to  retire  in  2021. Carrie  Lam  expressed  "profuse  gratitude"  to  Ma  Tao-li  for  his  exemplary  leadership  in  maintaining  the  highest  professional  standards.

HK  police  fire  tear  gas  as  protesters  gatecrash  Halloween. Police  fired  tear  gas  to  break  up  protests  in  Mong  Kok  and  Central  on  Thursday  as  masked  demonstrators  gathered  to  join  Halloween  fancy-dress  clubbers.

HK  falls  into  first  recession  in  10  years. The  economy  shrank  3.2%  in  the  3rd  quarter  from  the  preceding  period,  contracting  for  a  2nd  straight  quarter,  according  to  preliminary  govt  data.

HSBC,  StanChart  cut  Hong  Kong  prime  rates. HSBC  cut  its  best  lending  rate  by  12.5  basis  points  to  5%,  while  Standard  Chartered  also  reduced  its  best  lending  rate  by  12.5  basis  points  to  5.25%.

ICAC  head  calls  for  clean,  fair  district  council  election. As  of  Thursday,  the  ICAC  has  received  77  complaints  in  relation  to  the  election  slated  for  Nov  24,  said  ICAC  Commissioner  Simon  Peh.
Survey  shows  employees  still  enjoying  pay  rises  in  2019. It  finds  that  more  than  half  of  Hong  Kong  companies  will  offer  average  pay  increases  of  3  percent  next  year.

HK  rate  cuts  a  ‘timely  boost’  for  fragile  economy. The  HKMA  lowered  its  base  lending  rate  by  25  basis  points  to  2%  after  the  US  Federal  Reserve  cut  rates  for  the  third  time  this  year  on  Wednesday.

Sources:  Alibaba  targets  Nov  window  for  US$10  billion  listing. Alibaba  is  deciding  between  launching  a  sharply  reduced  US$10b  HK  share  sale  in  November  or  delaying  the  deal  till  next  year,  people  familiar  with  the  matter  say.

CE  respects  Chief  Justice  Geoffrey  Ma's  decision  to  retire. Chief  Justice  of  the  Court  of  Final  Appeal  Geoffrey  Ma  Tao-li  is  to  retire  on  Jan  11,  2021  upon  reaching  the  statutory  retirement  age  of  65.

Hong  Kong  banking  giants  defy  dire  predictions  amid  protests. ​There  may  be  tear  gas  and  occasional    burning  along  the  street,  but  inside  HK's  biggest  financial  firms  the  outlook  for  business  is  surprisingly  status  quo.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.90%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  239.01  points,  or  0.90  percent,  to  26,906.72  points.

Hong  Kong  cuts  base  rate  after  Fed  as  city  faces  recession. The  HKMA  on  Thursday  lowered  its  base  rate  to  2.00%  from  2.25%,  hours  after  the  US  Fed’s  quarter  point  cut,  according  to  the  institution’s  page  on  Bloomberg.

1,090  valid  candidates  for  district  election  gazetted. The  1,090  candidates  will  compete  for  the  452  seats  in  the  18  districts  in  the  2019  District  Council  Ordinary  Election  slated  for  Nov  24.
HK's  top  judge  tells  youth  to  respect  rights  of  others. Chief  justice  urges  HK's  future  leaders  to  develop  a  'sense  of  community'.
'Trophy  buildings'  lose  shine  as  tenants  pull  out. Vacancy  rates  in  HK's  top-notch  commercial  buildings  are  in  dramatic  upclimb  as  social  turmoil,  trade  row  bite.

HKMAO:  Barring  Wong  from  DC  polls  reasonable. A  spokesman  for  the  State  Council  Hong  Kong  and  Macao  Affairs  Office  said  on  Wednesday  it  was  reasonable  and  lawful  to  disqualify  Joshua  Wong  from  DC  polls.
Local  small  businesses  brave  storm  of  abuse. Small  businesses  in  HK  got  a  shock  from  the  abuse  of  anti-government  protesters.

Veteran  Malaysian  journalist  decries    deficiencies  in  HK  education  system. Former  editor  believes  the  city's  schools  share  much  of  the  blame  for  breeding  anti-government  sentiment.
Ending  violence  'top  priority'  for  govt. Chief  executive  pledges  to  combat  internal  and  external  challenges  and  to  restore  peace  to  HK.
Transport  industry  confident  about  Bay  Area  freight  business. Hong  Kong-Zhuhai-Macao  Bridge  also  expected  to  boost  SAR's  status  as  a  global  transshipment  hub.

HK  'black  terror'  nurtured  online. Amid  increasingly  ugly  violence  by  black-clad  riotous  mobs  in  Hong  Kong  since  June,  some  online  platforms  have  become  places  where  riots  are  plotted,  rumors  are  spread  and  "black  terror"  is  nurtured.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.44%  lower. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  down  119.05  points,  or  0.44  percent,  to  26,667.71  points.

Eco  Expo  Asia  opens  in  HK  with  focus  on  latest  green  tech. The  four-day  expo,  organized  by  the  Hong  Kong  Trade  Development  Council  and  Messe  Frankfurt,  features  over  300  exhibitors  from  17  countries  and  regions.
CE:  It's  a  distressing  time  for  HK's  trade,  businesses. Carrie  Lam  was  speaking  at  the  Asia  House  Future  of  Trade  Conference  on  Tuesday.

Former  CE  says  sentence  for  desecrating  national  flag  light. The  Sha  Tin  Magistrates’  Courts  on  Tuesday  sentenced  a  21-year-old  technician  to  200  hours  of  community  service  for  desecrating  the  national  flag.

District  election:  Central  govt  supports  disqualifying  separatist. Joshua  Wong,  leader  of  a  political  group  advocating  "Hong  Kong  independence,"  has  been  disqualified  from  the  2019  District  Council  election  in  Hong  Kong.

Shenzhen's  development  plan  sparks  HK  entrepreneurs'  dreams. The  guideline  ensures  that  people  from  Hong  Kong  and  Macao  working  and  living  in  Shenzhen  receive  the  same  treatment  as  local  residents.

HK  official  urges  end  to  violence  ahead  of  district  council  poll. Constitutional  and  mainland  affairs  secretary  Patrick  Nip  urged  opposing  sides  to  work  together  for  the  Nov  24  election.

Joshua  Wong  barred  from  DC  polls. Localist  activist  Joshua  Wong  was  disqualified  for  the  upcoming  DC  polls  on  Tuesday  for  the  concern  that  he  can't  pledge  allegiance  to  HKSAR.

Wong’s  disqualification  lawful,  predictable:  Jurists. The  decision  to  disqualify  Joshua  Wong    from  running  in  an  upcoming  District  Council  election  was  reasonable,  lawful  and  not  surprising,  political  analysts  said.

Life  turns  upside  down  for  many  as  unrest  continues  unabated. Nearly  five  months  of  social  turmoil  in  Hong  Kong  has  upended  residents'  lives,  and  has  been  notoriously  distressing.
HK's  economy  faces  a  'severe  situation':  Lam. Carrie  Lam  calls  for  concerted  effort  to  curb  violence,  and  says  it  is  the  only  solution.

HK  housing  sales  jump  as  first-time  buyers  given  boost. Sales  in  the  secondary  market  have  more  than  doubled  since  mortgage  rules  for  first-time  buyers  were  eased  mid-October,  Midland  Realty  Ltd  said.

Industry  leaders  praise  tax  concessions  for  maritime  businesses. ​The  logistics  and  transportation  sector  said  the  tax  concessions  would  fortify  Hong  Kong’s  status  as  a  strategic  hub  in  intra-Asia  trade.

US  asset  manager:  No  surge  of  capital  flow  from  HK  to  US. Charles  Schwab  said  it  hadn’t  seen  a  surge  of  capital  flow  from  Hong  Kong  to  the  US  despite  14  weeks  of  protests.

Principal:  Young  people  should  learn  to  tell  right  from  wrong. Chan  Cheuk-hay,  principal  of  Hong  Kong  College  of  Technology,  expressed  his  views  during  an  interview  with  Xinhua  on  Monday.
CE  to  visit  Shanghai,  Nanjing  for  key  events. Hong  Kong's  Chief  Executive  will  be  showcasing  the  city's  art  and  culture  and  foster  cooperation  with  Jiangsu  province.

HK  bank  profits  seen  falling  67%  in  JPMorgan's  worst  case. A  stress  test  performed  by  JPMorgan  projected  that  local  lenders  could  see  earnings  slump  24%  to  45%  next  year  and  39%  to  67%  in  2021.

Joshua  Wong  disqualified  from  running  for  district  election. An  electoral  officer  on  Tuesday  ruled  that  Wong's  nomination  for  the  2019  District  Council  Ordinary  Election  was  invalid.

Hundreds  of  thousands  of  jobs  on  the  line  as  unrest  continues. Industry  insiders  fear  a  recession  is  inevitable  as  the  unrest  in  Hong  Kong  continues,  setting  off  a  wave  of  job  losses.

Carrie  Lam  sees  HK  recording  negative  growth  in  2019. Lam's  remarks  came  two  days  after  Financial  Secretary  Paul  Chan  said  Hong  Kong​  has  fallen  into  recession  and  was  unlikely  to  achieve  any  growth  this  year.

TVB  seeks  injunction  against  assaults  on  crew. HK  television  broadcaster  TVB  on  Monday  applied  for  an  interim  injunction,  seeking  to  ban  assaults  on  its  employees  and  damage  to  its  facilities.

HK  police  unveil  ID  system  that  will  prevent  doxxing. The  Hong  Kong  Police  Force  introduced  new  a  mechanism  to  identify  officers  performing  their  duties  while  protecting  their  confidentiality.

Three  remain  in  custody  for  assaulting  mainland  journalist. The  trio  attacking  Global  Times  reporter  Fu  Guohao  during  an  August  protest  at  HKIA  were  remanded  into  custody,  with  the  hearing  due  for  Nov  12.

HK  GDP  forecast  downgraded  amid  social  unrest. Financial  institutions  are  bearish  on  HK's  economy  for  the  second  half  of  2019,  as  the  SAR  govt  will  announce  its    estimates  for  the  third  quarter  on  Thursday.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.84%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  223.87  points,  or  0.84  percent,  to  26,891.26  points.

Hong  Kong  turmoil  slams  AIA  as  mainland  visitors  decline. The  value  of  new  business  of  its  largest  unit,  a  measure  of  future  profitability  of  new  policies,  fell  by  double-digits  in  the  third  quarter,  AIA  said.

HK's  biotech  IPO  craze  continues  as  Ascentage  soars  57%. The  developer  of  cancer  and  hepatitis  B  therapies  soared  as  much  as  57%  on  Monday  before  paring  the  gain  to  9.9%  at  the  close.

Continued  violence  condemned  by  Hong  Kong  people. All  sectors  of  Hong  Kong  were  called  on  to  jointly  oppose  any  form  of  violence  in  a  bid  to  resume  the  safe  and  stable  business  environment.

Kuwaiti  deputy  FM:  HK  affairs  purely  China's  internal  issue. Kuwait  reaffirms  that  Hong  Kong  is  the  internal  affairs  of  China  and  that  China  is  capable  of  containing  the  demonstrations,  unrest  and  instability.

China  baby  fomula  maker  Feihe  seeks  up  to  US$1.14b  in  IPO. The  Beijing-based  company  is  offering  893.3  million  shares  at  HK$7.50  to  HK$10  apiece,  according  to  terms  of  the  deal  obtained  by  Bloomberg.

Hong  Kong  leading  global  IPO  market  since  September. The  total  value  of  first-time  share  sales  at  the  Hong  Kong  stock  exchange  since  Sept  1  is  US$7.9b,  more  than  Nasdaq's  US$7b  and  the  NYSE's  US$3b.
Time  is  money:  US$14-m  Patek  Philippe  up  for  sale  soon  in  HK. A  18-carat  pink  gold  Patek  Philippe  timepiece  is  scheduled  for  sale  in  a  Christie's  auction  on  Nov  27.

FS  warns  of  'technical  recession'  as  protests  persist. HK  financial  chief  warned  on  Sunday  the  city  is  on  the  cusp  of  a  "technical  recession"  with  negative  growth  this  year  as  four-month  long  turmoil  continues.

FTU  slams  'intimidation'  campaign,  calls  for  fair  elections  in  November. Hong  Kong's  largest  labor  group  is  concerned  that  sustained  violence  could  influence  the  outcome  of  the  Nov  24  election.

Academic:  Rioters'  separatist  agenda  doomed  to  fail. Briton  John  Ross  described  the  UK's  move  to  grant  citizenship  to  HK  residents  as  a  'bluff'  and  said  the  US  was  trying  to  support  anti-govt  activists.

Finance  chief:  Hong  Kong  economy  may  shrink  in  2019. Hong  Kong's  economy  continued  to  contract  in  the  third  quarter  and  significantly  expanded  its  negative  growth  rate,  according  to  Paul  Chan.

Vandalism  in  HK  as  radicals  paralyze  traffic,  hurl  bombs. Chaos  gripped  Hong  Kong  Sunday  as  vandals  participating  in  an  illegal  rally  in  Tsim  Sha  Tsui  area  paralyzed  traffic  and  attacked  police  with  petrol  bombs.

Building  a  cultural  bridge  between  China,  Philippines. Art  and  cultural  exchanges  furthered  friendship  and  deepened  cultural  bond  between  the  two  countries,  said  Chinese  and  Filipino  artists.

No  further  damage  to  MTR  urged. Mass  Transit  Railway  services  could  return  to  normal  soon  if  there  is  no  further  damage  inflicted  on  railway  facilities,  the  HKSAR  official  said.

SMEs  yearn  to  get  HK  back  to  normal  to  avoid  'bleak  winter'. Hong  Kong's  small  and  medium-sized  enterprises  bearing  the  brunt  of  the  chaos  yearned  to  quell  the  unrest  and  restore  order  as  soon  as  possible.

Exhibition  showcases  fruits  of  Chinese-Filipino  artistic  dialogue. An  exhibition  by  a  group  of  Chinese  and  Filipino  artists  kicked  off  in  Shenzhen  on  Saturday,  showcasing  the  collaborative  efforts  of  an  art  exchange  program.

Global  experts  slam  US'  HK-related  acts  as  groundless,  biased. Global  observers  slammed  the  so-called  Hong  Kong  Human  Rights  and  Democracy  Act  of  2019  and  other  related  acts  as  groundless  and  biased.

Quota  raised  for  vehicles  on  HK-Zhuhai-Macao  Bridge. The  quota  for  dual  plates  in  Guangdong  and  HK  has  been  increased  by  5,500,  with  an  aim  to  further  speed  up  the  integration  of  the  two  regions.

Taiwan  urged  to  'clear  hurdles'  for  murder  suspect's  surrender. The  HK  government  urged  Taiwan  to  respect  Hong  Kong's  adoption  of  the  territorial  principle  in  respect  to  its  judicial  system.
Hands  off,  SAR  tells  British  lawmakers. The  Hong  Kong  Special  Administrative  Region  government  on  Friday  told  the  United  Kingdom  Parliament

'No  noticeable  capital  outflow'  from  SAR  despite  unrest. James  Lau  said  HK  has  a  large  number  of  opportunities  to  collaborate  with  cities  in  Bay  Area  as  fintech  would  further  boost  HK's  edge  on  a  global  scale.
Vice-premier  meets  Macao  delegation. Vice  Premier  Han  Zheng  on  Thursday  met  with  a  delegation  from  Macao  at  the  Great  Hall  of  the  People  in  Beijing.

Private  housing  supply  in  HK  shrinks  31.25%  year-on-year. In  the  third  quarter  of  2019,  private  housing  supply  shrank  but  the  number  of  private  apartments  under  construction  soared.

High  Court  bans  doxxing  of  HK  police. The  court  ruling  forbids  anyone  from  using,  publishing,  distributing  or  disclosing  information  about  police  officers  and  their  family  members.

HK  markets  are  calm  as  protests  linger  and  a  recession  looms. Chinese  mainland  investors  are  buying  Hong  Kong  stocks,  while  initial  public  offerings  are  once  again  luring  capital.

Foreign  leaders,  analysts  call  for  HK's  return  to  normalcy. Govt  officials  and  political  analysts  of  Singapore,  Cambodia,  Timor  Leste,  Myanmar  and  Laos,  among  others,  backed  the  one-China  principle.

Man  charged  with  petrol  bombing  police  car,  denied  bail  in  HK. The  22-year-old  suspect  was  arrested  for  hurling  petrol  bombs  at  a  police  car  in  Mong  Kok  on  Oct.  20  and  was  charged  with  arson.

Policy  makers,  experts  see  Greater  Bay  Area  driving  growth. Analysts  agreed  that  cities  in  the  Greater  Bay  Area  will  reap  benefits  and  HK  in  particular  will  get  a  boost  to  overcome  the  current  economic  hardships.

HK  youths  chase  Greater  Bay  dreams. Preferential  polices,  increasing  business  opportunities  and  an  integrated  living  environment  has  made  the  Greater  Bay  area  a  cradle  for  startups.

Singapore  sees  cash  starting  to  flow  from  turbulent  Hong  Kong. Some  capital  has  moved  to  Singapore,  although  there  hasn’t  been  a  flood  of  inflows  from  Hong  Kong,  according  to  Singapore’s  central  bank.
Ex-official:  Talk  to  Beijing  for  solutions. Mike  Rowse  advises  protesters  not  to  look  abroad  for  cures  to  Hong  Kong's  problems.

HK  small  businesses  struggle  amid  social  unrest. Hong  Kong's  small  and  medium-sized  enterprises  (SMEs)  are  expecting  bleak  economic  prospects  for  the  rest  of  the  year,  report  cautioned.

District  Council  polls  session  thwarted  by  protest. HK's  open  event  to  brief  candidates  on  next  month's  District  Council  elections  ended  on  Thursday  evening  after  opposition  candidates  staged  a  protest.
Bay  Area  vision  a  global  blessing. City  cluster  will  provide  a  new  platform  for  win-win  cooperation,  forum  in  Hong  Kong  told.
Xie:  Rioters  seek  to  topple  HKSAR  govt. Top  diplomat  in  HK  calls  for  global  effort  in  battle  against  violence.

HK  is  world's  third  easiest  place  to  do  business. HK  rose  to  third  place  among  190  global  economies  in  the  World  Bank's  latest  rankings  of  the  easiest  places  to  do  business  –  up  one  notch  from  last  year.

Cross-sector  representatives  urge  end  to  violent  protests  before  DC  election. Wong  Kwok-hing  said  any  responsible  government  should  not  proceed  with  a  large-scale  election  before  law  and  order  had  been  restored.

Street  violence  in  Hong  Kong  deadlier  than  SARS,  says  official. Xie  Feng,  commissioner  of  the  Ministry  of  Foreign  Affairs  of  China  in  the  HKSAR,  warned  that  any  attempt  to  use  Hong  Kong  as  a  pawn  is  doomed  to  fail.

Hong  Kong-Zhuhai-Macao  Bridge  brings  convenience. One  year  on,  the  bridge  not  only  facilitates  people-to-people  exchanges  but  also  brings  social  and  economic  benefits  to  the  three  cities.

Hong  Kong  IPO  market  shows  revival  signs  amid  protests. A  mild  recovery  in  Hong  Kong  share  prices  is  giving  firms  confidence  to  venture  back  while  positive  post-IPO  performances  are  helping  to  bolster  investor  interest.
Tencent  sell-off  nears  US$100b  as  stock  loses  key  support. Tencent  is  now  trading  below  the  key  level  of  HK$320  that  supported  its  shares  on  three  occasions  this  year.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.87%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  231.22  points,  or  0.87  percent,  to  26,797.95  points.

Full  text  of  commissioner's  speech  at  GBA  forum  in  HK. Xie  Feng  delivered  a  speech  at  the  opening  ceremony  of  the  International  Forum  on  the  Guangdong-Hong  Kong-Macao  Greater  Bay  Area  in  HK  Thursday.

CE:  HK  making  steady  progress  in  realizing  GBA  vision. Carrie  Lam  shared  how  steady  progress  had  been  made  in  terms  of  policy  implementation  since  the  GBA  Outline  Development  Plan  was  unveiled  in  Feb.

Bargain  hunters  revel  as  HK  businesses  see  life  or  death. In  an  attempt  to  keep  their  businesses  afloat,  most  Hong  Kong  businesses  see  bottom-barrel  prices  and  deep  discounts  as  the  only  way  to  survive  in  the  city.

A  parking  space  in  Hong  Kong  just  sold  for  almost  US$1m. The  space  went  for  US$970,000,  making  it  the  most  expensive  place  to  park  an  automobile  in  the  city,  and  perhaps  anywhere  in  the  world.

HK  Act  dubbed  move  to  'cover  up  US  local  issues'. An  expert  on  China-US  relations  and  a  long-time  Hong  Kong  resident  criticized  the  passage  of  the  bill  as  a  move  to  "cover  up  domestic  issues"  in  the  US.

After  HK  violence,  flash  mobs  clean  up  the  mess. ​While  the  rampaging  mobs  left  a  trail  of  destruction  in  Hong  Kong,  the  flash  mobs  did  just  the  opposite:  clean  up  the  mess  left  by  radical  protesters.

Chinese  Americans  oppose  US  passing  of  HK-related  act. Some  100  people  from  the  Chinese  community  gathered  at  Manhattan's  Chinatown  Tuesday  to  express  their  grave  concerns  over  the  bill.

HK  police  groups  urge  CUHK  head  to  keep  campus  politics  free. The  appeal  came  after  Rocky  Tuan,  in  an  open  letter,  accused  HK  police  of  using  improper  violence  against  students,  shunning  violent  acts  of  those  students.

HKSAR  blasts  Taipei  for  wrangling  over  suspect. Secretary  for  Security  said  Taiwan  authorities  should  bear  responsibility  if  justice  can't  be  served  as  they  set  up  restrictions  to  obstruct  Chan's  surrender.

Spokesperson:  Report  of  HKSAR  CE  replacement  'political  rumor'. China  on  Wednesday  refuted  a  foreign  report  that  the  central  government  is  considering  replacing  Carrie  Lam  as  "a  political  rumor  with  ulterior  motives".

Filipino  artists  inspired  by  art-friendly  Chinese  town. Five  Filipino  artists  enjoyed  their  visit  to  Liling  in  Hunan,  a  town  boasting  of  sophisticated  porcelain  craftsmanship,  describing  it  as  "a  haven  for  artists".

HZMB  to  drive  Hong  Kong,  Macao  tourism,  logistics  sectors:  industry  insiders. Tourism  and  logistics  sectors  in  Hong  Kong,  Macao  and  western  Guangdong  hold  great  market  potential  driven  by  the  Hong  Kong-Zhuhai-Macao  Bridge  (HZMB),  observed  industry  insiders.

HK$100m  shot  in  the  arm  for  tourism  business. The  SAR  govt  will  grant  a  total  of  HK$100  million  to  local  travel  agencies  in  a  bid  to  help  them  resurrect  from  the  huge  loss  due  to  the  prolonged  turmoil.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.82%  lower. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  down  219.47  points,  or  0.82  percent,  to  26,566.73  points.

Hong  Kong  extradition  bill  officially  withdrawn. Secretary  for  Security  John  Lee  Ka-chiu  formally  announced  the  withdrawal  of  the  bill  to  lawmakers  at  the  Legislative  Council  on  Wednesday.

Murder  suspect  released,  HK  rejects  Taiwan's  request. Taiwan's  request  to  send  law  enforcement  officers  to  HK  to  fetch  a  fugitive  murder  suspect  has  been  turned  down  by  the  HKSAR  govt  Wednesday.

Lai:  Pro-establishment  camp  faces  tough  elections. The  upcoming  District  Council  elections  will  be  a  very  difficult  campaign,  as  anti-govt  sentiment  has  raged  in  society,  said  ex-security  chief  Lai  Tung-kwok.

Wang  Yi  denounces  violence,  foreign  interference  in  HK. Wang  Yi  expressed  the  hope  that  people  with  conscience  around  the  globe  will  view  the  situation  in  Hong  Kong  objectively  and  impartially.

Murder  suspect:  Full  text  of  HK  position  on  Taiwan's  request. The  HKSAR  govt  issued  a  statement  early  Wednesday  morning  over  Taiwan's  request  to  send  officers  to  HK  to  escort  fugitive  murder  suspect  Chan  Tong-kai.

HK  announces  new  economic  stimulus  of  HK$2b. Specific  measures  include  granting  fuel  subsidies  to  local  taxi  and  red  minibus  drivers  and  commercial  vehicle  drivers  for  six  months.

Macao  may  be  allowed  to  use  Hengqin  Port. The  top  legislature  began  deliberations  on  Tuesday  on  a  draft  decision  on  whether  to  grant  the  Macao  SAR  the  right  to  use  Hengqin  Port  in  Zhuhai.

All-around  smart  tourism'  needs  help  to  take  off,  industry  expert  says. General  manager  of  Tencent  Culture  Industry  calls  for  government's  to  aid  with  resource  integration,  public  services.

Taiwan's  refusal  of  Chan's  self-surrender  draws  fire. It  is  unthinkable  that  Taiwan  would  reject  the  voluntary  surrender  of  Hong  Kong  citizen  Chan  Tong-kai,  former  secretary  for  security  Lai  Tung-kwok  said.
Former  security  chief  urges  support  for  police. Lai  Tung-kwok  also  advises  members  of  public  to  disassociate  themselves  from  radical  protesters  and  shun  violence.

HK  seeing  more  emphasis  on  sustainable  investment. UBS  expects  more  Asian  countries  and  regions,  including  China,  Indonesia  and  the  Philippines,  to  join  the  list  of  ESG  reporting  by  2020.

HK  unveils  fresh  relief  measures  worth  HK$2b  to  boost  economy. The  new  measures  announced  Tuesday  aims  to  help  the  transportation  industry  &  travel  agents,  and  comes  after  a  HK$19.1b  stimulus  package  unveiled  in  Aug.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.23%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  60.52  points,  or  0.23  percent,  to  26,786.2  points.

HK:  Lack  of  judicial  protocol  no  hurdle  to  Taiwan  surrender. The  HK  govt  refuted  the  Taiwanese  authorities'  point  that  the  Taiwan  homicide  case  can  only  be  handled  within  the  mutual  legal  assistance  frame.

Govt  surveys:  HK  continues  to  attract  multinationals,  start-ups. The  surveys  were  jointly  conducted  by  InvestHK,  an  investment-promoting  department  of  the  HKSAR  govt  and  the  Census  and  Statistics  Department.

InvestHK:  Unrest  in  SAR  affecting  investment  by  overseas  firms. Investment  sentiment  of  overseas  companies  in  HK  has  been  weakened  by  prolonged  social  unrest,  says  InvestHK  which  has  tried  to  promote  HK's  profile.

Violence  on  Hong  Kong  streets  disgusts  visitors. The  wanton  destruction  of  property  in  Hong  Kong  by  violent  radicals  on  Sunday  has  "scared"  and  "saddened"  people  in  the  city,  including  visitors.
Distortion  of  facts  worries  media  expert. Veteran  journalist  says  HK  must  control  fake  news  and  unprofessional  reporting.
Western  media  slammed  for  biased  reports. Violent  unrest  in  Western  countries  becomes  'pursuit  of  democracy'  in  HK.

Water  cannon  deployment  was  to  protect  mosque,  police  say. HK  Police  Force  explained  that  the  deployment  of  water  cannon  and  spraying  of  the  Kowloon  Mosque  on  Sunday  was  an  unintended  result.

Varsity  heads:  Campuses  no  place  for  politics. Chiefs  of  eight  local  university  councils  make  it  clear  that  universities  must  steer  clear  of  political  activities  and  violence  in  a  joint  statement  issued  on  Sunday.
Fresh  relief  measures  on  the  way  to  rekindle  growth. Carrie  Lam  said  Hong  Kong's  economy  has  been  in  a  technical  recession  since  the  third  quarter.

Hong  Kong  sees  best  weekend  for  home  sales  since  April. The  10  biggest  housing  estates  tracked  by  Centaline  Property  Agency  Ltd.  recorded  20  sales  over  the  weekend,  more  than  3  times  the  weekend  before.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.02%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  6.10  points,  or  0.02  percent,  to  26,725.68  points.

Residents,  visitors  scared  and  saddened  by  rampaging  radicals. The  wanton  destruction  of  property  across  HK's  Kowloon  district  by  violent  radicals  has  "scared"  and  "saddened"  tourists  and  residents  in  the  city.

CE  apologizes  after  dye  sprayed  outside  Kowloon  Mosque. According  to  a  government  press  release,  CE  Carrie  Lam  emphasized  that  the  HKSAR  government  treasured  equality  and  inclusiveness  in  society.

ESR  seeks  US$1.45b  in  year's  second-biggest  Hong  Kong  IPO. ESR  Cayman  Ltd.  is  offering  653.7  million  shares  at  HK$16.20  to  HK$17.40  apiece  in  the  share  sale,  according  to  terms  of  the  deal.

Housing  hope. Hong  Kong  Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  showed  great  resolve  to  tackle  the  city’s  chronic  housing  problem  by  announcing  focused  measures  in  her  third  Policy  Address  on  Oct  16,  2019.  China  Daily  takes  a  deep  look.
Battered  Mong  Kok  picks  up  pieces. Hong  Kong  radicals  went  on  a  rampage  on  Sunday  targeting  multiple  stores  along  Nathan  Road  of  Mong  Kok.

HK  actress  known  for  reel  negativity  emerges  real  heroine. The  well-known  HK  actress  was  beaten  up  by  masked  mobs  about  two  weeks  ago  after  speaking  out  against  the  rioters'  acts  of  vandalism.

Battled  HK  firms,  lacking  riot  insurance,  pick  up  pieces. Businesses  will  likely  foot  the  bill  for  vandalism  inflicted  during  protests  as  few  of  them  bought  insurance  coverage  for  riot  damage,  industry  insiders  said.

Memories  in  70  years. The  Chinese  mainland  and  Hong  Kong  share  a  lot  of  common  memories.  For  many  people  who  grew  up  on  the  mainland,  Hong  Kong  has  been  the  doorway  to  the  newest  fashion  trends  and  pop  culture  since  the  establishment  of  the  People’s  Republic  of  China  in  1949.  Over  the  past  70  years,  the  interaction  has  become  a  two-way  flow  on  all  fronts,  with  the  nation’s  growing  influence  and  the  closer  links  between  the  mainland  and  Hong  Kong.  

​
HK  colonial  nostalgia  dismissed. Young  protesters  don’t  realize  that  city  is  more  democratic  now,  experts  say.

Vicious  attacks  on  police  in  latest  Kowloon  rampage. The  20th  straight  weekend  of  anti-government  protests  in  HK  again  saw  the  city's  police  force  as  a  major  target  as  rioters  rampage  in  Kowloon  on  Sunday.
Rioters  step  up  attacks  on  mainland-linked  businesses. Chinese  mainland-linked  stores,  banks  and  bookshops  in  Hong  Kong  were  again  singled  out  for  attack  by  rioters  on  Sunday.

HKSAR  govt  rejects  'manipulation'  allegations  in  murder  suspect's  case. The  SAR  government  on  Sunday  rejected  allegations  of  manipulation  in  the  decision  of    Chan  Tong-kai  to  surrender  himself  to  Taiwan,  calling  it  "groundless".

HKSAR  govt  strongly  condemns  malicious  acts  of  rioters. The  government  strongly  condemned  the  acts  of  the  rioters  which  completely  disregarded  law  and  order,  severely  undermining  social  order.

Hong  Kong  hit  again  by  weekend  destructive  rampage. Rioters  continued  their  destructive  rampage  across  Kowloon  of  Hong  Kong  Sunday,  attacking  shops,  public  facilities  and  firebombing  police  officers.

HKSAR  govt  issues  statement  on  Taiwan  murder  case. The  Hong  Kong  Special  Administrative  Region  government  on  Oct  20  issued  the  following  statement  on  the  Taiwan  homicide  case.

CE  to  attend  Emperor  Naruhito's  enthronement. Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  Cheng  Yuet-ngor  will  leave  for  Tokyo,  Japan  on  Monday  to  attend  the  enthronement  ceremony  of  Emperor  Naruhito.

Tung  Chee-hwa:  History  education  crucial  for  HK  youth. The  former  and  first  CE  stressed  that  HK  is  an  integral  part  of  China  and  any  acts  that  violate  China's  sovereignty  and  security  can  never  be  tolerated.

Violence  grips  HK  again  as  many  join  in  unlawful  march. Many  protesters  took  part  in  an  illegal  march  in  Kowloon  on  Sunday,  and  radical  protesters  blocked  the  road  and  started  another  weekend  of  vandalism.

Special  protection  at  high  speed  train  station  for  safety  reason. Passengers  entering  the  station  would  need  to  show  valid  tickets  departing  on  Sunday  and  their  travel  documents.

HK  CE  supports  police  use  of  appropriate  force  against  violence. Speaking  in  a  radio  program  on  Saturday,  Carrie  Lam  said  police  need  to  act  in  response  when  rioters  commit  violence.

HK  tour  guide  union  says  current  unrest  'worse  than  SARS'. Statistics  show  visitor  arrivals  in  August  dipped  by  nearly  40%  yoy  as  over  40  countries  and  regions  have  issued  traveling  advisories  for  Hong  Kong.

Hong  Kong  to  strengthen  ability  to  combat  climate  change. The  director  of  Hong  Kong  Observatory  said  the  city  had  been  hit  by  super  typhoons  in  recent  years  and  should  gear  up  to  combat  climate  change.
HK  suspect  in  Taiwan  murder  case  to  surrender  himself. Chan  Tong-kai,  20,  will  finish  his  29-month  jail  term  for  money  laundering  next  week.
Sunday  protest  banned  on  fears  of  deadly  attacks. Innocent  passersby  holding  different  views  were  left  bleeding  after  being  savagely  attacked  by  rioters.

MTR  wades  through  floods  of  crises. HK's  sole  rail  operator,  which  has  been  a  key  target  of  rioters  in  the  current  unrest,  is  battling  against  all  odds  to  maintain  its  high  efficiency.
HK  flag  carrier  flies  into  serious  'turbulence'. Cathay  cut  its  outlook  for  the  second-half  financial  results,  which  are  expected  to  be  lower  than  the  first  half.
HK  enterprises  turn  their  sights  on  the  Bay  Area. The  growing  enthusiasm  for  the  mainland  market  is  expected  to  boost  demand  for  office  space  in  the  Bay  Area.

Survey:  One-third  of  HK's  businesses  expect  worse  Q4. Only  7  percent  of  respondents  anticipated  a  better  business  situation  in  the  last  quarter  than  the  third  quarter,  a  government  survey  showed.

Hong  Kong  court  rules  against  same-sex  civil  partnerships. A  lesbian  identified  as  "MK"  has  launched  the  city's  first  judicial  challenge  on  the  issue,  stating  it  violated  her  constitutional  rights.

HK  hedge  funds  see  biggest  quarterly  outflow  since  2009. Analysts  said  the  outflow  was  in  keeping  with  redemptions  from  hedge  funds  globally  after  poor  returns  from  a  number  of  managers  in  2018.

Sharp  rise  in  unemployment  rates  in  tourism,  catering  in  HK. Unemployment  rate  in  food  and  beverage  service  activities  sector  rose  to  a  six-year  high  of  6  percent  over  the  past  three  months.

Cathay  cuts  earnings  outlook  as  travelers  avoid  HK. Second-half  financial  results  will  be  lower  than  those  of  the  first  half,  the  Hong  Kong-based  airline  said  in  a  statement  Friday.

Police  chief  confident  order  will  restore  in  HK. Lo  Wai-chung  made  the  remarks  during  the  Force  Remembrance  Day  to  commemorate  those  who  have  sacrificed  themselves  in  service  on  Friday.

1,104  candidates  for  HK  District  Council  election  to  be  validated. The  Returning  Officers  are  validating  the  eligibility  of  nominees  for  the  2019  District  Council  election,  slated  for  Nov  24,  2019.
Remake  in  forms,  not  substance. Textile  manufacturers  seek  to  resurrect  the  industry  in  HK  using  new  technology  that  creates  new  clothing  from  discarded  material.

Carrie  Lam:  Tackling  housing  'first  step'  to  end  impasse. Hong  Kong  CE  Carrie  Lam  refuted  claims  on  Thursday  that  her  Policy  Address  is  aimed  at  diverting  public  attention  from  the  current  political  impasse.
Carrie  Lam  responds  to  public  calls. HKSAR  govt  prioritizes  livelihood  issues  such  as  affordable  housing.

Bay  Area,  SE  Asia  poised  to  boost  links. Stronger  transport,  technology  connectivity  needed  to  promote  investment  and  collaboration  in  the  Bay  Area,  world  business  summit  heard.

Govt  anticipates  assessment  of  brownfield  sites  to  be  finished  by  2020. Housing  and  land  experts  applaud  CE's  promise  to  increase  the  supply  of  public  housing  and  subsidized  apartments,  but  worry  it  could  take  long  to  achieve  it.

CE:  Govt  to  enhance  measures  against  doxxing  targeting  police. Carrie  Lam  said  the  SAR  government  would  review  the  existing  laws  and  strengthen  measures  against  online  doxxing  and  bullying  of  police  officers.

HK  protest  demands  are  unrealistic,  says  Singapore  PM. Protesters  in  Hong  Kong  are  making  unrealistic  demands  in  an  effort  to  take  down  the  government,  Singaporean  Prime  Minister  Lee  Hsien  Loong  said.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.69%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  184.21  points,  or  0.69  percent,  to  26,848.49  points.

Heckling,  protests  mar  post-Policy  Address  LegCo  session. More  than  10  opposition  lawmakers  were  ejected  from  the  chamber  after  staging  noisy  protests  and  holding  up  placards  Thursday.

Hong  Kong’s  new  vision. The  chief  executive  unveils  a  series  of  proposals  for  housing,  land  supply,  trade  and  technology  that  aim  to  resolve  long-simmering  problems  and  spark  innovation  in  the  financial  center.

US  passage  of  HK-related  acts  slammed  by  residents. The  passage  of  Hong  Kong  related  bills  undermines  the  city's  prosperity  and  stability,  people  from  all  walks  of  life  here  said  on  Wednesday.

China's  top  legislature  slams  US  interference  in  Hong  Kong  affairs. The  move  is  "blatant  interference  in  HK  affairs  and  gross  intervention  in  China's  internal  affairs,"  according  to  a  statement  issued  by  the  NPC.
Lam:  Sovereignty  threats  intolerable. Hong  Kong  Chief  Executive  reiterated  her  adherence  to  the  "one  country,  two  systems"  principle  in  her  Policy  Address  on  Wednesday.

Bill  slammed  as  blackmail  attempt. HK  opinion  leaders  denounced  the  Hong  Kong  Human  Rights  and  Democracy  Act  passed  by  US  lawmakers,  calling  it  an  attempt  to  "blackmail"  the  SAR.

US  House  bill  on  HK  spurs  strong  protest  from  Beijing. Geng  Shuang  urged  the  US  to  clearly  understand  the  situation,  immediately  stop  advancing  the  act  and  stop  meddling  in  HK's  affairs.

Calls  mount  for  functioning  legislature  after  disruptions. Lam  urged  all  lawmakers,  especially  those  from  the  opposition  camp,  to  put  aside  political  disputes  and  show  more  concern  for  local  residents.

Easier  funding  to  get  SMEs  out  of  the  woods. Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  introduced  a  package  of  measures  in  her  Policy  Address,  catering  to  the  need  of  the  city's  battered  SMEs.

Affordable  housing  a  top  priority  in  CE's  strategy. Land  and  housing  experts  welcome  Lam's  offering  and  are  upbeat  about  its  prospect  of  helping  alleviate  the  current  social  unrest  .

Land  supply  lift  wins  kudos  from  pundits. Industry  pundits  applauded  the  SAR  government's  ambitious  package  of  proposals  to  address  one  of  the  city's  long-standing  housing  issues.

HK  police:  Rioters  planning  deadly  attacks. The  police  revealed  that  hardcore  rioters  are  plotting  deadly  attacks  in  Hong  Kong,  similar  to  those  carried  out  by  terrorists  around  the  world.

HK  banks  to  roll  out  support  measures  for  small  businesses. The  HKMA  announced  the  measures  after  meeting  the  nine  banks  under  the  newly  established  "Banking  Sector  SME  Lending  Coordination  Mechanism".

Pro-establishment  legislators  regret  approval  of  bill  on  HK. ​Pro-establishment  lawmakers  have  expressed  regret  at  the  passage  of  the  Hong  Kong  human  rights  act  in  the  US  House  of  Representatives.

China  condemns  US  House  approval  of  bill  on  Hong  Kong. A  spokesperson  for  the  Hong  Kong  and  Macao  Affairs  Office  of  the  State  Council  on  Wednesday  issued  a  statement  condemning  the  US  move.
HK  stocks  rise  to  1-month  high. The  Hang  Seng  index  rose  0.6%,  to  26,664.28  points,  while  the  China  Enterprises  index  gained  0.3%,  to  10,532.17  points.

Opposition  slammed  for  disrupting  Policy  Address. Pro-establishment  lawmakers  said  the  opposition  had  resorted  to  violent  means  to  block  the  CE  from  delivering  the  policy  address  at  the  LegCo.

'100,000  public  housing  units  on  HK  market  by  2024'. Govt  source  shares  plans  as  Carrie  Lam  says  buyers  may  borrow  up  to  90%  of  a  property's  value  to  a  maximum  of  HK$8  million,  up  from  HK$4  million  previously.

Lam  stresses  'one  country,  two  systems'  in  resolving  HK  impasse. Lam  pledged  that  HK  will  adhere  to  the  "one  country,  two  systems"  and  protect  people's  rights  and  freedoms  stipulated  in  the  Basic  Law.

Australia  seeks  to  ratify  trade  deals  with  HK,  Indonesia,  Peru. The  trade  deal  will  remove  many  of  the  tariffs  that  have  hindered  two-way  trade  between  Australia  and  the  three  regions.
Full  text  of  CE  Carrie  Lam's  2019  Policy  Address. Hong  Kong  Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  delivered  the  2019  Policy  Address  via  video  on  Wednesday.

Carrie  Lam  focuses  on  housing,  welfare  in  3rd  Policy  Address. Carrie  Lam  was  prevented  from  presenting  her  annual  policy  address  shortly  after  11  am  Wednesday  as  she  was  repeatedly  heckled  at  the  LegCo.

AmCham  fears  US  firms  affected  by  violence,  HK-related  bill. AmCham  HK  found  that  61%  of  surveyed  member  firms  have  seen  their  business  affected  by  protests  and  violence  in  HK  to  a  great  or  medium  extent.

Lo  Wu  in  70  years. ​The  Lo  Wu  checkpoint,  the  first  land  port  of  entry  between  Hong  Kong  and  the  Chinese  mainland,  came  into  service  in  1950.  Many  historic  moments  were  recorded  there,  amid  the  changes  taking  place  over  several  decades.

Lam  to  highlight  housing  in  annual  address. Hong  Kong's  Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  Cheng  Yuet-ngor  said  she  would  emphasize  the  city's  housing  shortage  in  her  annual  Policy  Address  on  Wednesday  amid  concerns  about  possible  disruption  by  protesters.

HKSAR  govt  regrets  US  Congress'  passage  of  bill. The  HKSAR  govt  expressed  regret  Wednesday  over  the  passage  of  the  so-called  Hong  Kong  Human  Rights  and  Democracy  Act  by  US  Congress.

Commissioner's  office:  Playing  HK  as  card  will  get  US  nowhere. US  politicians  are  urged  to  grasp  the  trend  of  the  times,  immediately  stop  advancing  the  bills,  and  refrain  from  meddling  with  Hong  Kong  affairs.
'Smart  tourism'  the  next  big  step. Technology  will  reshape  industry,  ultimately  offering  'tailor-made  experiences'  for  visitors.
Macao  seeking  diverse  tourism  in  Bay  Area  vision. For  the  long-term,  sustainable  development  of  Macao  as  a  travel  destination,  Senna  Fernandes  said.

Shenzhen  'ahead'  in  luring  tech  enterprises. General  manager  of  Youtu  Lab  suggested  that  HK  invest  more  in  developing  innovative  technology,  which  may  create  more  job  opportunities.

Democracy  Act  a  US  tactic:  Legal  expert. Lawrence  Ma  says  America  is  cynically  exploiting  unrest  in  HK  to  gain  an  unfair  
advantage  in  its  trade  war  with  the  mainland.

More  EV  chargers  at  estate  carparks  in  govt's  green  push. Electric-vehicle  chargers  will  be  installed  in  about  a  quarter  of  parking  spaces  in  HK's  private  estates  by  2022,  which  will  be  elaborated  in  CE's  Policy  Address.

Moderate  protesters  urged  to  'break  off’with  their  violent  counterparts. Moderate  protesters  should  draw  a  line  with  the  radicals,  to  help  contain  the  violence,  and  restore  peace  and  order:  Paul  Yeung.

CE  blasts  US  official  for  slandering  HK  police. Carrie  Lam  expresses  regret  over  some  
US  senators  for  judging  the  situation  
in  a  superficial  and  biased  manner.

AmCham  fears  'consequences'  from  HK  Act  on  US  businesses. The  American  Chamber  of  Commerce  in  Hong  Kong  has  expressed  reservations  on  key  provisions  of  the  Hong  Kong  Human  Rights  and  Democracy  Act.

Hong  Kong  retail  rents  fall  sharply  in  Q3,  says  consultancy. High  street  retail  rents  fell  by  10.5%  in  the  July-Sept  quarter  compared  to  the  previous  quarter,  consultancy  CBRE  said.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.07%  lower. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  down  17.92  points,  or  0.07  percent,  to  26,503.93  points.

HKMA  sees  HK$200b-HK$300b  credit  inflow  to  boost  SMEs. The  so-called  counter-cyclical  capital  buffer  was  lowered  to  2%  from  2.5%  with  immediate  effect,  the  authority  said  in  a  statement  on  Monday.

German  eye  clinic  operator  soars  102%  in  its  Hong  Kong  IPO. EuroEyes  International  Eye  Clinic  Ltd  shares  rose  as  much  as  102%  on  their  debut,  the  latest  example  of  frenzied  trading  in  small  IPOs  in  Hong  Kong.

HK  police:  Injunction  sought  to  stop  violence  targeting  quarters. The  High  Court  on  Monday  approved  the  police's  application  for  an  injunction  order  to  curb  escalating  violence  targeting  the  living  quarters  of  officers.

Carrie  Lam  slams  US  official  for  slandering  HK  police. Lam  has  strongly  refuted  comments  by  visiting  US  senator  Josh  Hawley  that  Hong  Kong  is  under  the  control  of  a  politically  motivated  police  force.

HK  CE  Lam  vows  to  address  housing  crunch  in  policy  speech. Hong  Kong  CE  Lam  held  up  a  copy  of  the  text  of  her  upcoming  annual  Policy  Address  and  said  she  would  present  200  new  initiatives.

German  community  reaffirms  strong  commitment  to  Hong  Kong. The  German  Industry  and  Commerce  Ltd  and  the  German  Chamber  of  Commerce,  HK  celebrated  the  opening  for  their  new  office  in  Causeway  Bay.
US  has  'hidden  agenda’with  democracy  act. Commentators  argue  America's  moves  are  really  all  about  stopping  China's  spectacular  rise.
Toursim  oils  economic  wheels  in  Macao. Tourism  industry  gets  spotlight  as  a  core  engine  for  development  in  the  Greater  Bay  Area.

Forum  hears  the  appeal  of  56  ethnic  groups  on  tourism. Speakers  at  Global  Tourism  Economy  Forum  discuss  new  ways  mainland  can  boost  tourism,  increase  investment  and  encourage  regional  cooperation.

HK  police:  Rioters  try  to  kill  officers. Police  officials  appealed  to  residents  to  distinguish  fact  from  fiction  amid  what  they  called  malicious  online  rumors  against  police  officers.

DOJ  gets  injunction  against  disruption  of  police  quarters. Disciplined  services  quarters  in  eastern  Kowloon  has  been  under  frequent  attacks  as  rioters  have  besieged  the  buildings  and  damaged  facilities.
HK  govt  will  be  proactive  on  land,  housing. Administration  says  it  has  had  LegCo  consider  a  tax  law  to  discourage  apartment-hoarding.

HK  govt:  Demand  for  passing  US  bill  on  SAR  regretful. A  spokesman  for  the  HKSAR  government  reiterated  that  foreign  legislatures  should  not  interfere  in  any  form  in  Hong  Kong’s  internal  affairs.

HK  police  find  IED  used  for  first  time  in  protests. The  detonated  radio-controlled  device  was  found  Sunday  in  Mong  Kok,    Kowloon,  police  told  reporters  Monday.  No  injuries  were  reported.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.81%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  213.41  points,  or  0.81  percent,  to  26,521.85  points.

HKSAR  govt  slams  radicals  after  renewed  violence  wreaks  havoc. A  spokesperson  for  the  HKSAR  govt  expressed  extreme  indignation  at  the  repeated  attacks  by  masked  radicals  who  went  on  a  rampage  again.

Educator  condemns  Western  media's  hypocritical  reporting. A  New  Zealand-born  educator  condemned  Western  media  for  hypocrisy  in  using  HK  issues  to  fit  into  narrative  of  portraying  China  as  an  evil  empire.

CS  seeks  support  of  lawmakers  in  tackling  deep-seated  problems. The  city's  No  2  official  Matthew  Cheung  calls  for  backing  for  measures  to  improve  livelihood  and  put  SAR  back  on  track.

Ban  on  masks  a  ‘legal  deterrent  to  violence’. Experts  on  the  Chinese  mainland  familiar  with  Hong  Kong  legislation  said  a  new  regulation  in  the  city  that  bans  facial  coverings  at  protests  and  assemblies  is  reasonable  and  in  compliance  with  legislative  procedure.
Rioter  slashes  police  officer  in  savage  attack. Brazen  assault  on  law  enforcer  condemned  in  escalation  of  radical  violence  to  new  heights.

HK  policeman  slashed  in  the  neck  as  metro,  shops  targeted. Flash  protests  with  violent  protesters  targeting  businesses  with  mainland  ties  at  different  shopping  centers  marked  the  demonstration  in  the  19th  straight  week.

'Human  rights  duly  considered  in  devising  HK  anti-mask  law'. The  regulation  won't  deprive  people  of  the  right  to  peaceful  assembly  as  they  are  free  to  participate  in  lawful  public  order  events,  says  Teresa  Cheng.

Continued  violence  bringing  HK  to  economic  abyss. Analysts  pointed  out  that  a  wide  range  of  industries  are  embracing  a  chilly  winter  as  the  continued  unrest  added  huge  pressure  on  the  financial  and  trade  hub.

HK:  US  Senator  told  to  stop  'running  amok  on  China's  land'. Office  of  the  Commissioner  of  the  Chinese  Foreign  Ministry  in  Hong  Kong  said  Ted  Cruz's  remarks  openly  trampled  upon  international  law  and  basic  norms  governing  international  relations.

Cheung  seeks  cooperation  to  address  socio-economic  issues. The  SAR  government  is  striving  to  improve  the  benefits  to  the  public  in  a  joint  effort  with  cross-spectrum  lawmakers,  said  Matthew  Cheung.

Vice-premier  stresses  education,  healthcare  for  Greater  Bay  Area. Sun  Chunlan  urged  efforts  to  boost  social  causes  such  as  education  and  healthcare  to  better  serve  the  Greater  Bay  Area.

Protesters  hurl  gasoline  bombs,  block  roads  in  illegal  assemblies. Black-clad  and  masked  protesters  went  on  the  rampage  again  in  Hong  Kong  on  Saturday  as  violence  entered  its  fifth  month.

Police  refute  murder  rumors,  to  probe  alleged  blackmail. HK  police  has  refuted  vicious  rumors​  spread  by  radicals  and  announced  the  launch  of  investigations  into  alleged  blackmail  on  certain  businesses.

Rights  violations  on  rise  in  HK  as  radicals  escalate  violence. Radicals  in  HK  infringed  others'  personal  safety,  stifled  freedom  of  speech  and  wrecked  private  property  under  the  guise  of  defending  human  rights.
HK  government  calls  for  rent  cuts  to  shore  up  retailers. MTR  said  it  will  subsidize  rents  on  a  proportional  basis  to  tenants  when  rail  stations  are  forced  to  close.

HK  drivers  concerned  about  their  safety  and  livelihood  amid  unrest. In  the  face  of  a  sharp  decline  in  tourist  arrivals,  hundreds  of  bus  drivers  have  either  lost  their  jobs  or  been  forced  to  take  long  unpaid  leaves.

HK  and  Shenzhen  have  ample  room  for  mutual  cooperation:  Expert. China  Development  Institute  spokesman  predicts  the  SAR  will  not  be  left  behind  as  Shenzhen  develops  into  a  leading  industrial  city.

Experts  defend  law  against  face  masks  in  HK. The  claims  that  HK's  recent  but  overdue  law  against  face  masks  affects  right  to  protest  and  violates  its  autonomy  are  ignoring  facts  and  law  practices.

HK  cancels  harbor  swimming  race  due  to  social  unrest. This  year's  New  World  Victoria  Harbor  Race  has  become  the  latest  sports  and  cultural  event  to  be  called  off  amid  monthslong  unrest  in  Hong  Kong.

HK  researchers  develop  world's  1st  AI  portable  blood  test  kit. The  novel  instrument  developed  by  the  CUHK  research  team  weighs  less  than  5  kg  and  is  a  size  similar  to  a  briefcase  that  can  be  carried  everywhere.
HK  stocks  have  best  day  in  over  a  month  on  trade  optimism. The  Hang  Seng  Index  added  2.3  percent  amid  rising  trade  optimism.

Tseung  Kwan  O  MTR  station  reopens  after  severe  damage. The  station  was  one  of  the  most  damaged  on  the  MTR  system  after  radicals  escalated  the  violence  to  a  level  not  previously  seen.
Accountant  group  condemns  violence,  appeals  for  calm. Some  500  accountants  called  for  dialogues  in  a  joint  statement  published  on  local  newspaper  Sing  Tao  Daily  on  Friday.

Hong  Kong  rues  extensive  damage  to  metro  system. Rioters  wantonly  smashed  MTR  stations,  left  1,200  turnstiles,  800  ticket  vending  machines,  900  CCTV  cameras,  40  lifts  and  70  entrance  rolling  gates  damaged.
CS:  Rampant  vandalism  must  end. Hong  Kong's  No  2  official  urged  radical  protesters  to  stop  vandalizing  public  facilities  and  disrupting  the  daily  commuting  of  residents.

HK-Shenzhen  partnership  'cooperation,  not  competition'. Shenzhen  is  poised  to  play  a  key  role  in  the  development  of  the  Bay  Area,  but  is  unlikely  to  replace  HK,  speakers  told  Great  Bay  Area  conference  on  Thursday.

Bay  Area  plan  'reinforces  all-round  team  work'. Hong  Kong,  along  with  the  Macao  and  nine  mainland  cities  involved  in  the  Bay  Area  project,  are  making  concerted  efforts  in  the  development  process.

Hospital  chief  hopes  for  a  medical  sector  free  from  politics. A  renowned  Hong  Kong  medical  expert  called  on  medical  practitioners  in  HK  to  stay  away  from  politics  and  maintain  professionalism  during  the  social  unrest.

Digitalization  to  innovate  healthcare  sector. Riding  on  development  of  technologies,  healthcare  service  industry  is  being  innovated  to  lift  its  efficiency  and  effectiveness,  enhance  user  experience.

'Right  decision'  for  Apple  to  remove  police-tracking  app. A  former  member  of  the  Fight  Crime  Committee  said  there  is  no  place  in  the  world  which  would  allow  apps  that  have  the  potential  to  destabilize  society.
Tourism  unions  call  for  govt  aid  amid  hardship. Sharp  decline  in  visitors  affects  livelihoods  of  many;  representatives  seek  subsidies.

Bringing  minds  together  to  achieve  a  'win-win'  across  the  Bay  Area. Govt  representatives,  business  executives  say  innovation  in  growth  and  development  is  necessary  to  best  integrate  region.

Bay  Area  people's  health  comes  into  greater  focus. A  professional  from  CUHK  suggests  healthcare  institutions  in  Bay  Area  seek  measures  to  help  HK  resolve  expensive  healthcare  and  growing  demand.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.10%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  25.12  points,  or  0.10  percent,  to  25,707.93  points.

Greater  Bay  Area  conference  held  in  Hong  Kong. The  5th  Greater  Bay  Area  conference  themed  "Inclusive  Growth  through  Innovation  and  Sustainability"  is  being  held  in  Hong  Kong  on  Thursday.

Great  things  ahead  for  Greater  Bay  Area. The  consensus  at  the  Greater  Bay  Area  conference  was  the  area  holds  great  promise,  but  there  is  much  to  untangle  before  all  can  tap  into  the  full  potential.

Roundtable:  Inclusive  growth  through  innovation,  sustainability. The  5th  Greater  Bay  Area  conference,  co-organized  by  China  Daily  and  Silk  Road  Economic  Development  Research  Center,  was  held  at  Hong  Kong  Ocean  Park  Marriott  Hotel  on  Thursday.

Full  text:  Leung's  keynote  address  at  GBA  conference. Leung  Chun-ying,  vice-chairman  of  the  CPPCC  National  Committee,  delivered  a  keynote  speech  at  the  5th  Greater  Bay  Area  conference  on  Thursday.

Education  group  condemns  abusing  lecturer  at  university  campus. An  education  group  in  HK  condemned  abusing  toward  a  lecturer  by  radical  collage  students  due  to  his  remarks  on    calling  for  an  end  to  violence.

High  Court:  Anti-mask  law's  aim  in  curbing  violence  'undisputed'. High  Court  acknowledged  the  purpose  of  the  city's  newly  enacted  anti-mask  law  as  "undisputed”  in  reducing  violence  and  restoring  public  order.
Report  works  Hong  Kong  world's  third-most  competitive  economy. In  the  health  pillar,  which  assesses  health-adjusted  life  expectancy,  Hong  Kong  received  the  top  score.
HK's  future  in  the  balance,  scholar  says. Protesters  seen  as  jeopardizing  city's  chance  to  be  vital  Greater  Bay  Area  hub

Anti-mask  law  empowers  police  in  curbing  violence:  Tang  King-shing. Former  Hong  Kong  police  commissioner  says  anti-mask  law  helps  police  restore  law  and  order  in  city  as  so-called  "peaceful"  protesters  escalate  violence.
Tang  slams  opposition's  double  standards. Former  police  chief  argues  'pan-democrats'  request  for  judicial  reviews  of  the  anti-mask  law  is  a  waste  of  time  and  money.

Leung's    jail  term    reasonable:  Prosecutor. HK's  top  public  prosecutor  said  on  Wednesday  the  heavy  punishment  handed  down  to  HK  independence  activist  Edward  Leung  Tin-kei  was  fair.

Disruptions  spread  to  campuses  across  HKSAR. Educators  urged  HK  schools  to  enhance  regulations  to  make  students  responsible  for  their  behavior  as  political  wrangling  flare-up  on  school  campuses.

Film  reproduces  National  Day  pageantry  on  big  screen  in  HK. A  movie  that  documented  the  grand  military  parade  and  public  parade  at  the  Tian'anmen  Square  in  Beijing  on  Oct  1  made  its  HK  debut  on  Wednesday.

Competitiveness:  HK  ranked  3rd  as  Singapore  takes  top  spot. The  report's  index  maps  out  the  competitive  landscape  of  141  economies  based  on  more  than  100  indicators  in  a  dozen  categories.

Hong  Kong  police  dismiss  online  rumors  about  vandalism. Police  have  dismissed  online  rumors  which  alleged  some  officers  had  disguised  as  rioters  to  inflict  damage  to  facilities  in  Sheung  Shui  MTR  station  on  Tuesday  night.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.81%  lower. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  down  210.59  points,  or  0.81  percent,  to  25,682.81  points.
Guangzhou-Kowloon  train  halts  service. China  Railway  Guangzhou  Group  suspended  through-train  service  between  Guangzhou  and  Kowloon​,  according  to  a  statement  on  Tuesday.

Lam  warns  of  'chilly  winter'  for  HK. Carrie  Lam  warned  that  all  sectors  of  the  city  will  face  a  "chilly  winter",  as  violence  has  taken  a  heavy  toll  on  HK  economy  and  people's  livelihoods.

NBA  condemned  for  'free  speech'  excuse. NBA  was  criticized  for  applying  double  standards  in  defending  "free  speech"  after  a  tweet  from  an  executive  with  Houston  Rockets  basketball  team.
Vandalized  LegCo  back  in  business  on  Friday. Hk's  Legislative  Council  Complex,  which  was  severely  vandalized  by  rioters  will  resume  operations  on  Friday.

Liaison  Office  stresses  support    for  SAR  govt  to  curb  violence. Central  government  agencies  in  HK  and  mainland  enterprises  in  HK  have  been  urged  to  redouble  efforts  to  support  the  SAR  government  in  curbing  violence.

'Golden  Week'  fails  to  glitter  as  chaos  continues. A  big  drop  in  visitors  in  the  Golden  Week  
deepens  fears  about  the  city's  tourism  industry.
77  arrested  for  violating  anti-mask  law. Seventy-seven  people  have  been  arrested  so  far  for  violating  the  anti-mask  law,  which  came  into  effect  on  Saturday.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.28%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  72.37  points,  or  0.28  percent,  to  25,893.4  points.
ID  check  rumors  dismissed. The  city’s  Home  Affairs  Department  dismissed  claims  officials  will  visit  the  public  to  check  people’s  personal  identification  documents.

Boom  forecast  for  HR  management  sector  in  GBA. The  Greater  Bay  Area  is  in  the  process  of  facilitating  talent  flow,  boosting  the  need  of  labor  force  management,  said  the  CEO  of  a  leading  HR  consulting  firm.

70-year-old  woman  challenges  rioters. A  70-year-old  woman  infuriated  by  protesters'  destruction  of  Hong  Kong  set  herself  the  task  of  clearing  road  barriers  erected  by  anti-government  radicals.

LegCo  repair  cost  amounts  to  HK$40  million. Part  of  the  money  for  the  restoration  would  come  from  the  SAR  government,  while  the  rest  to  be  paid  by  the  LegCo,  said  its  president.

Trial  on  assaulting  police  officer  adjourned. ​Cheong  Hon-tung,  a  former  security  guard,  was  arrested  inside  Whampoa  MTR  station  on  Aug  11,  where  he  allegedly  assaulted  a  police  officer  with  his  legs.

HK  police  strongly  condemn  violence,  vandalism. HK  police  have  strongly  condemned  violence  and  vandalism  and  pledged  to  take  resolute  enforcement  actions  to  bring  all  lawbreakers  to  justice.

CE:  Violence  sends  HK  into  very  dangerous  situation. Speaking  before  an  Executive  Council  meeting  on  Tuesday,  Carrie  Lam  has  vowed  to  stop  violence  with  utmost  determination  and  resolution.

CE  urges  foreign  politicians  to  stop  fueling  violence  in  HK. Carrie  Lam  Cheng  Yuet-ngor  on  Tuesday  urged  foreign  politicians  to  stop  fueling  violence  in  Hong  Kong  with  irresponsible  remarks  that  embolden  rioters.

Traffic  chaos  in  parts  of  HK  as  train  services  partially  resume. Heavy  traffic  is  seen  in  parts  of  Hong  Kong  as  13  metro  stations  remained  shut  on  Tuesday  after  vandalism  by  riotous  mobs  over  the  long  weekend.

HKEx  drops  US$36.4b  bid  for  London  Stock  Exchange. LSE  last  month  rejected  HKEX’s  initial  takeover  proposal,  citing  complications  ranging  from  unrest  in  Hong  Kong  to  potential  problems  with  regulators.

First  violators  of  anti-mask  law  charged. HK  govt  condemns  violence,  vandalism  taking  place  over  18  weekends  as  two  offenders  become  the  first  to  be  charged  under  the  newly  enacted  anti-mask  law.
Courts  urged  to    issue  harsher  rioting  penalties. HK  community  calls  for  courts  to  consider  deterrent  effect  when  sentencing  rioters.
Residents  rally  to  support  mask  ban. Participants  also  condemn  violence  rocking  Hong  Kong  and  voice  their  support  for  the  police.

Patten's  ruthless  remarks  on  anti-mask  law  condemned. The  Commissioner's  Office  of  the  Chinese  Foreign  Ministry  in  the  HKSAR  has  condemned  the  ruthless  remarks  by  Chris  Patten,  the  "last  governor"  of  HK.
Taxi  workers  union  decries  violence. Motor  Transport  Workers  General  Union  has  condemned  an  attack  on  a  taxi  driver  by  a  masked  mob  on  Oct  6.

Court  decision  on  mask  ban  case  'key  to  deterring  violence'. Key  figures  in  the  legal  sector  expressed  their  wishes  for  a  clear  outcome  in  the  first  court  case  involving  the  breaching  of  anti-mask  law  enacted  on  Friday.
Hong  Kong  reels  from  mob  violence. ​Hong  Kong  reeled  from  the  aftermath  of  another  weekend  of  violence  on  Monday  as  metro  services  in  the  city  partially  resumed.

HK:  2  charged  with  violating  anti-mask  law,  released  on  bail. The  man  and  the  woman,  the  city's  first  offenders  arrested  under  the  newly  enacted  anti-mask  law,  will  appear  in  court  again  on  Nov  18,  2019.

CBA  suspends  cooperation  with  Rockets  after  HK  remarks. China's  official  basketball  association  said  it  would  suspend  exchanges  and  cooperation  with  Houston  Rockets  following  a  tweet  by  the  team's  general  manager  in  support  of  the  anti-government  protests  in  Hong  Kong​.

HKSAR  government  rejects  emergency  law  rumors. The  authority  said  that  the  Hong  Kong  banking  system  is  robust  and  sound,  and  that  banks  have  sufficient  supply  of  banknotes  to  meet  the  public's  needs.

Legal  pundits  hail  anti-mask  law  in  HKSAR. Experts  from  the  city's  legal  sector  voiced  their  support  for  the  anti-mask  law  announced  on  Friday,  hailing  it  as  a  much  needed  solution  to  HK's  crisis.

Court's  rejection  of  injunction  bid  by  opposition  wins  support. Legal  experts  applaud  the  High  Court's  decision  on  the  grounds  that  the  CE  is  
granted  the  power  to  enact  such  a  ban.

Residents  furious,  scared  by  unprecedented  vandalism. Hong  Kong  residents  expressed  their  anger,  desperation  and  fear  of  anti-government  rioters'  lawlessness  after  the  unprecedented  vandalism  and  violence.

Financial  secretary  says  no  forex  control  in  Hong  Kong. Official  said  there  will  be  no  foreign  exchange  control  and  the  government  is  capable  to  maintain  both  monetary  and  financial  stability  in  Hong  Kong.
HK  groups  condemn  violence  committed  by  rioters. Many  banks,  stores  and  businesses  with  Chinese  mainland  background  or  considered  patriotic  were  targeted  by  rioters.

High  Court  denies  interim  injunction  against  anti-mask  law. The  High  Court  on  Sunday  rejected  an  application  by  24  opposition  lawmakers  for  an  interim  injunction  order  against  the  government's  anti-mask  law.

Radicals  return  to  streets  as  HK  reels  from  violence. Defying  mask  ban,  many  protesters  covered  their  faces  as  they  took  to  the  streets  on  the  third  consecutive  day  of  protests.

Official:  Anti-mask  law  vital,  in  line  with  due  process. Government  officials  said  enacting  the  anti-mask  law  was  a  hard  decision  for  the  government,  but  a  must  to  the  city.
Anti-mask  law:  Violence  abated,  protests  continue. Violating  the  law  may  lead  to  imprisonment  of  up  to  one  year  and  a  fine  of  HK$25,000.

Banning  face  masks:  One  step  towards  restoring  law  and  order. The  ban  on  facial  coverings  in  public  meetings  and  processions  as  well  as  unlawful  assembles  and  riots,  is  a  move  in  the  right  direction.
Full  text:  Video  address  by  CE  to  members  of  the  public. Hong  Kong  Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  delivered  a  televised  speech  to  members  of  the  public  on  Saturday.

Hong  Kong  in  near  shutdown  as  city  reels  from  violence. Apart  from  the  MTR  services,  some  public  facilities  and  chain  stores  like  Parknshop  and  Watson's  were  also  shut  on  Saturday.

Times:  HKEx  to  raise  its  bid  for  London  exchange  next  week. HKEx  will  reportedly  raise  its  29.6  billion-pound  takeover  bid  for  the  LSE  next  week  after  receiving  conditional  support  from  some  key  shareholders.

HK  police  condemn  'outrageous,  unprecedented'  violence. Police  said  a  plainclothes  police  officer's  decision  to  open  fire  was  legal  and  reasonable  as  his  life  was  under  serious  threat  during  an  attack  in  Yuen  Long.

HK  chief  executive  vows  greatest  resolve  to  end  violence. In  a  televised  speech  on  Saturday,  Carrie  Lam  said  the  extreme  violence  on  Friday  night  had  clearly  demonstrated  that  HK's  public  safety  is  under  extensive  threats.

Greater  Bay  Area  busy  laying  foundation  for  innovation. As  entrepreneurs  create  a  bustling  innovative  atmosphere  in  the  Bay  Area,  the  Guangdong  govt  has  stepped  up  efforts  to  improve  research  capability.

HK  community  hails  ban  on  masking  in  public. Heavyweights  from  various  sectors,  including  education,  politics  and  business,  have  hailed  the  new  law  as  an  effective  way  to  end  violence.

Legal  pundits  voice  support  for  Hong  Kong  anti-mask  law. Experts  from  the  city's  legal  sector  voiced  their  support  for  the  law,  saying  it  is  a  much-needed  solution  for  Hong  Kong  to  quell  escalating  violence.
Support  face  mask  ban. Hong  Kong  SAR  Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  Cheng  Yuet-ngor  ​said  the  decision  to  adopt  a  ban  is  a  hard  but  a  necessary  one  for  the  public's  interest.

Beijing  supports  HKSAR  govt's  adoption  of  anti-mask  law. An  official  said  that  the  introduction  of  the  law  is  completely  legitimate  and  reasonable,  and  conforms  with  common  practices  in  many  countries  in  the  world.

SMEs  to  get  HK$1b  lift  from  Li  Ka-shing  foundation. HK's  richest  man  Li  Ka-shing  will  donate  HK$1  billion  ($128  million)  to  support  hard-pressed  local  small  and  medium-sized  businesses.
Business  activity  takes  a  hit  from  prolonged  unrest. Business  activity  takes  a  hit  from  prolonged  unrest  By  Pamela  Lin  in  Hong  KongThe  protracted  social

Full  text:  CE's  opening  remarks  on  adoption  of  anti-mask  law. HK  CE  Carrie  Lam  announced  on  Friday  the  introduction  of  anti-mask  law  in  a  bid  to  stop  the  escalating  violence  and  restore  calmness  in  society.

'Chilly  winter'  for  Hong  Kong  tourism  industry. Lavish  pageants,  cheerful  dancers  and  crowds  of  photo-snapping  tourists,  all  familiar  sights  at  Hong  Kong's  Disneyland,  but  a  frequent  visitor  may  notice  something  missing  from  the  jamboree.

MTR  pleas  for  an  end  to  vandalism. Hong  Kong's  rail  operator  called  for  a  stop  to  the  irresponsible  and  malicious  acts,  which  could  cause  serious  accidents  and  endanger  passengers'  safety.

Hong  Kong  adopts  anti-mask  law  to  quell  violence. The  HKSAR  government  announced  on  Friday  the  enactment  of  an  anti-mask  law  after  a  special  meeting  of  the  Executive  Council.

DAB:  District  Council  election  to  be  a  new  start  for  HK. The  Democratic  Alliance  for  the  Betterment  and  Progress  of  Hong  Kong  has  announced  that  179  members  will  run  for  the  council  seats  this  year.

Hong  Kong  —  the  place  where  the  'go  global'  vision  begins. This  year  marks  the  70th  anniversary  of  the  founding  of  the  PRC,  a  historic  milestone  that  has  produced  the  most  dramatic  success  story  by  far.

More  cars  allowed  on  Hong  Kong-Zhuhai-Macao  Bridge. The  Transport  Department  has  announced  to  increase  the  quotas  for  non-commercial  private  cars  using  the  bridge  to  Macao  by  500.

HK  govt  expected  to  enact  anti-mask  law  as  soon  as  today. Chief  executive  likely  to  invoke  Emergency  Regulations  Ordinance  after  protester  violence  plunges  city  into  chaos  on  National  Day,  sources  say.
Zeman  calls  for  tougher  law  enforcement. Hong  Kong  business  titan  Allan  Zeman  pushes  the  government  to  enact  anti-mask  law  to  keep  the  turmoil  in  check.
HK  govt  urged  to  protect  voters. Members  of  HK's  largest  political  party  stress  that  the  government  has  a  duty  to  ensure  voters'  personal  safety  in  upcoming  local  elections.
Chinese  archaeologist  wins  2019  Lui  Che  Woo  Prize. Fan  Jinshi  was  awarded  2019  LUI  Che  Woo  Prize  on  Thursday  for  her  56  years  of  dedication  to  Mogao  Grottoes  in  Dunhuang.

HK  civic  leaders  make  urgent  call  for  anti-mask  law. A  cross-sector  concern  group  says  there's  an  urge  to  enact  an  anti-mask  legislation  to  help  contain  the  escalating  violence  and  vandalism  rocking  the  city.

Live  weapons  'needed  to  quell  violence  and  protect  lives':  Zeman. HK  business  tycoon  Allan  Zeman  on  Thursday  joined  in  the  chorus  of  support  for  the  city's  police  in  using  live  weapons  when  their  lives  are  threatened.

Hong  Kong  'may  invoke  emergency  law,  ban  masks'. Hong  Kong  is  reportedly  set  to  invoke  an  emergency  ordinance  and  to  ban  face  masks  in  order  to  end  violence,  according  to  local  media  outlets.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.26%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  67.62  points,  or  0.26  percent,  to  26,110.31  points.

Light  buses  collide  in  Sheung  Shui,  woman  driver  killed. A  56-year-old  woman  was  killed  &  14  people  were  injured  in  Sheung  Shui  when  2  public  light  buses  collided,  according  to  a  press  release.

Shot  HK  teen  charged  with  rioting,  assaulting  police. The  case  of  the  suspect,  Tsang,  who  is  recovering  from  his  wounds  in  hospital,  is  scheduled  to  be  heard  at  Shatin  Magistrates'  Courts  on  Oct  3  afternoon.

Goldman  says  US$4b  moved  from  HK  to  S'pore  amid  unrest. The  New  York-based  bank  estimated  that  there  has  been  a  maximum  outflow  of  Hong  Kong  dollar  deposits  totaling  US$3b  to  US$4b  to  the  island  city-state.

HK  society  decries  National  Day  violence. The  violence  and  vandalism  paralyzed  a  major  part  of  Hong  Kong's  public  transportation  services,  and  also  led  to  the  injury  of  dozens  of  people.

Stress  on  unity  heartens  Hong  Kong  delegations. Guests  of  honor  from  Hong  Kong  delegations  expressed  confidence  over  the  development  of  the  nation  and  the  special  administrative  region.

Police  firing  live  round  is  lawful,  timely  and  necessary:  Legal  professionals. Experts  explain  officer  was  justified  in  using  his  revolver  when  faced  with  such  violent  protesters.

Retail  sales  in  HK  hit  record  low  for  August. Crippled  by  protracted  riots,  HK's  retail  sales  plunged  23  percent  year-on-year  to  HK$29  billion,  while  insiders  predict  the  worst  has  yet  to  come.
Hong  Kong  students  urged  to  shun  violence. Hong  Kong  educators  and  political  heavyweights  on  Wednesday  urged  students  to  steer  clear  of  violence.
Cantonese-dubbed  film  set  to  reproduce  National  Day  pageantry  in  HK. High-definition  film  is  set  to  screen  in  more  than  100  movie  theaters  in  the  Bay  Area.

Beijing  slams  US,  UK  politicians  for  condoning  violence. A  principal  official  of  the  Commissioner's  Office  of  the  Foreign  Ministry  in  the  HKSAR  firmly  opposed  remarks  by  those  politicians  who  had  openly  condoned  radical  protesters.

HK  protests  bring  record  23%  retail  sales  slump  in  August. Data  released  Wednesday  showed  retail  sales  value  falling  by  a  record  23%  year-on-year  in  August,  a  result  which  a  govt  spokesman  said  was  the  worst  ever.

Business  organizations  denounce  HK  violence. ​Business  organizations  in  Hong  Kong  joined  the  chorus  of  voices  denouncing  Tuesday's  violence  and  called  for  an  end  to  the  months-long  social  unrest.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.19%  lower. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  down  49.58  points,  or  0.19  percent,  to  26,042.69  points.

Hong  Kong  stocks  little  changed  after  worst  quarter  since  2015. The  Hang  Seng  Index  handed  investors  the  world's  worst  returns  last  quarter,  losing  8.6  percent  for  the  worst  three-month  period  since  2015.

Police:  Firing  live  round  in  self-defense  complies  with  guidelines. Hong  Kong  police  officers  are  well  trained  in  the  use  of  force,  noted  Lam  Chi-wai,  chairman  of  Junior  Police  Officers'  Association.

Educators  urge  students  to  renounce  violence. The  Hong  Kong  Federation  of  Education  Workers  urged  students  to  renounce  violence  while  extending  its  regards  to  the  injured  18-year-old  student.

Hong  Kong  guests  inspired  by  mainland  youths'  vitality. The  peaceful  emergence  of  the  motherland  will  help  HKSAR  get  back  on  track,  said  the  guests  attending  the  National  Day  celebrations  in  Beijing.

Celebrators  share  hopes  for  the  Greater  Bay  Area. HK  should  actively  integrate  into  the  bigger  picture  of  the  country,  said  the  chairman  of  the  Hong  Kong  Federation  of  Overseas  Chinese  Associations.

Hong  Kong  govt,  police  decry  extreme,  violent  acts. Hong  Kong  police  said  so  far  over  180  persons  were  arrested,  and  at  least  25  police  officers  were  injured  in  dispersal  operations  on  Tuesday.
HK  reels  as  hardcore  rioters  unleash  new  level  of  violence. Police  officer  shoots,  critically  injures  protester  in  self-defense  as  riots  break  out  across  city.

Hong  Kong  political  parties  condemn  rampant  violence. Hong  Kong  political  parties  and  its  largest  labor  union  condemned  rioters’  extreme  violence  and  vandalism  in  many  parts  of  the  city  on  National  Day.

Police  officer  fires  live  round  in  self-defense. A  police  officer  shot  and  wounded  a  pipe-wielding  protester  in  self-defense  and  to  save  his  colleagues,  a  police  spokesperson  said  on  Tuesday.
HK  delegation  reacts  to  National  Day  parade. A  group  of  Hong  Kong  delegation  attended  China's  National  Day  Parade  and  gave  their  thoughts  about  the  celebratory  event.
HK  dignitaries  share  pride,  hope. ​Guests  of  honor  from  a  Hong  Kong  delegation  shared  their  pride  at  attending  the  National  Day  celebrations  in  Beijing.

Hong  Kong  float  joins  anniversary  parade  in  Beijing. The  float,  themed  "Hong  Kong  In",  took  part  in  the  National  Day  parade  in  Beijing  on  Tuesday  to  celebrate  the  70th  anniversary  of  the  founding  of  the  PRC.

Water  cannon  deployed,  tear  gas  fired  as  violence  erupts  in  HK. The  Legislative  Council  (LegCo)  Secretariat  has  issued  a  red  alert  as  radical  protesters  charged  at  barriers  set  up  by  the  police  at  the  LegCo  building  in  Tamar  at  around  6  pm  on  Saturday.
