Driving  on  mainland  becomes  easier  for  HK  residents. Submission  of  temporary  residence  registration  form  is  no  longer  a  must  for  Hong  Kong  permanent  residents  while  applying  for  mainland  driving  licenses.

HK  stocks  hit  six-month  closing  low. The  Hang  Seng  index  ended  1.4  percent  lower  at  29,296.05,  while  the  China  Enterprises  Index  closed  lower  by  1.2  percent  at  11,364.66  points.

HK  to  celebrate  21st  anniversary  of  its  return  to  motherland. The  Hong  Kong  Celebrations  Association  have  chalked  out  a  three-day  cultural  event  themed  after  the  Greater  Bay  Area  to  celebrate  the  occasion.

Morgan  Stanley:  HK's  equity  selloff  is  far  from  over. The  new  forecast  implies  a  slump  of  18  percent  from  the  benchmark's  January  peak,  nearing  a  correction  typically  denoting  a  bear  market.
Youth  Ambassadors  Scheme  to  take  on  100  recruits  annually. Youth  Development  Commission  program  will  enhance  understanding  of  social,  public  affairs  in  Hong  Kong

HK  to  enhance  sci-tech  ties  with  Guangdong. HKTDC  chief  said  research  and  development,  traditional  industries  and  services  need  to  be  aligned  to  realize  global  science-hub  ambition.
HK  export  index  hits  29-quarter  high. Traders  in  Hong  Kong  said  they  are  optimistic  about  further  expansion  as  electronics  take  lead.

Nomura:  HK  in  most  crisis  danger  in  next  3  years. Nomura  cautioned  that  Hong  Kong  and  the  mainland  are  in  grave  danger  of  a  financial  crisis  or  sharp  drop  in  domestic  demand  in  the  next  three  years.

Xiaomi  is  said  to  set  terms  for  up  to  US$6.1b  HK  IPO. The  Chinese  smartphone  maker  and  some  existing  investors  plan  to  offer  about  2.18  billion  shares  at  HK$17  to  HK$22  apiece.

Hang  Seng  index  closes  0.8%  higher. The  Hang  Seng  index  ended  0.8  percent  higher  at  29,696.17,  while  the  China  Enterprises  Index  closed  0.1  percent  higher  at  11,505.74  points.

CE  visits  France,  meets  foreign  minister. Hong  Kong  Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  Cheng  Yuet-ngor  met  French  Minister  of
Foreign  Affairs  Jean-Yves  Le  Drian  in  Paris  on  Tuesday.

JP  Morgan,  science  parks,  extend  startup  fundraising  drive. Program  run  by  the  financial  services  giant  and  HK  Science  and  Technology  Parks  Corporation  gives  promising  tech  developers  access  to  seed  capital.
US  tariff  threat  slashes  HK  shares. Benchmark  falls  below  30,000  in  heavy  trade  to  reach  4-month  low  as  trade  worries  drive  selling  across  Asia.

Association  head:  Patriotism  'essential  for  police'. The  chairman  of  the  Junior  Police  Officers'  Association  said  neutrality  when  faced  with  the  question  of  loving  or  not  loving  their  country  is  impossible.
MTR  vows  to  review  reporting  after  run  of  scandals. Railway  operator  will  note  contractors’  performance  and  use  as  it  as  a  guide  for  tenders.
Medical  bodies  make  blanket  call  for  e-cigarette  ban. Health  authorities  warned  that  there  is  no  concrete  proof  that  these  products  don't  cause  harm.
HK  stocks  hit  over  4-month  low. The  Hang  Seng  index  closed  down  2.8  percent  at  29,468.15,  its  lowest  since  early  February.

HK  scientists  invent  novel  method  for  stem  cell  cultivation. The  Hong  Kong  Baptist  University  said  the  new  device  can  reduce  the  risk  of  carcinogenesis  while  cultivating  neural  stem  cells.
Deloitte  maintains  180-firm  IPO  forecast. Listings  will  include  large  tech  players  but  small-  and  medium-size  enterprises  comprise  bulk  of  offerings,  according  to  Deloitte.

Govt  vows  'thorough  investigation'  into  MTR's  Sha  Tin-Central  Link. The  SAR's  chief  secretary  warns  that  if  or  any  malpractices  are  found,  tough  regulatory  action  by  Development  Bureau  may  follow.
HK  to  get  European  flower  park. The  European-themed  Kaleido  Park  will  be  the  first-of-its-kind  in  the  city,  offering  a  unique  horticultural  experience  through  floral  displays.
9  HK  films  to  be  screened  at  New  York  Asian  Film  Festival. The  17th  edition  of  the  New  York  Asian  Film  Festival  will  be  held  June  29-July  15,  2018.

HK  teens  awarded  for  police-youth  partnership  role. The  teenagers,  who  are  members  of  Hong  Kong  police's  Junior  Police  Call  (JPC)  scheme,  were  awarded  for  their  various  contributions.
Toy  festival  held  in  Hong  Kong. The  4th  Hong  Kong  Toy  Festival  kicked  off  on  June  15,  2018  at  Hong  Kong  Convention  and  Exhibition  Center.
HK  eyes  trade  talks  with  EU. Carrie  Lam  met  with  Jean-Claude  Juncker,  the  European  Commission  President,  during  her  visit  to  Belgium  on  Friday.
Govt  to  tighten  e-cigarette  rules. E-cigarettes  and  heat-not-burn  cigarettes  are  harmful  and  regulation  on  such  products  will  be  strengthened,  the  health  chief  said.

Worker  claims  steel  bar  faults  at  Hung  Hom  not  rectified. The  Mass  Transit  Railway  Corporation  handed  to  the  government  Friday  a  46-page  report  on  the  corner-cutting  scandal  at  Hung  Hom  Station.

Hong  Kong  scientists  find  new  method  to  fight  flu  virus. Scientists  from  the  University  of  Hong  Kong  have  found  a  new  method  that  can  effectively  suppress  influenza  virus  by  using  virus  genes  and  proteins.
Wang  urges  foreign  business  involvement  in  Bay  Area. 'One  country,  two  systems'  guarantees  city's  long-term  stability,  prosperity,  liaison  chief  notes.
Vitasoy  cuts  costs  as  raw  material  prices  rise. The  leading  beverage  maker  moves  pre-emptively  to  counter  expected  soybean,  sugar  inflation.

HKU  new  research  points  to  'functional  cure'  for  HIV. The  discovery  by  the  University  of  Hong  Kong  is  a  major  breakthrough  that  could  see  a  new  antibody  be  used  for  both  HIV  prevention  and  treatment.
Payday  for  HK  savers  on  horizon. Banks  are  seen  boosting  deposit  rates  in  a  bid  to  accumulate  dollars  as  the  US  Fed  rate  hikes  continued.

HK  stocks  post  biggest  weekly  drop  in  2-1/2  months. The  Hang  Seng  index  fell  0.4  percent,  to  30,309.49,  while  the  China  Enterprises  Index  lost  0.7  percent,  to  11,870.18  points.
Applications  open  for  govt's  youth  self-nomination  scheme. The  scheme  aims  to  encourage  more  young  people  to  participate  in  politics  and  better  address  their  concerns.

HK  LegCo  approves  XRL  co-location  bill. The  historic  arrangement  at  the  West  Kowloon  Station  will  allow  passengers  to  complete  Hong  Kong  and  mainland  clearance  procedures  in  one  go.
CE  Lam  visits  Europe. Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  Cheng  Yuet-ngor  began  her  visit  to  Europe  on  Thursday  after  arriving  in  Brussels,  Belgium.

'Candid'  Jackie  Chan  memoir  coming  in  November. Titled  "Never  Grow  Up",  the  book  tells  a  story  about  Chan's  life  from  his  youth  to  his  "numerous"  near-death  experiences  on  and  off  camera.
Shenzhen  the  launch  pad  for  HK  startups. SAR’s  entrepreneurs  answer  clarion  call  to  go  north  to  realize  their  dreams.
Leung  remains  deeply  committed    to  the  nation’s  opening-up. Former  CE  is  on  a  lifelong  crusade  to  promote  a  stronger  economy  through  greater  global  ties.
HK-Macao  bridge  coach  will  charge  HK$170. The  round-the-clock  service  with  19  vehicles  will  run  from  Kwun  Tong  and  Hung  Hom  every  hour.
Lam:  Bay  Area  to  ease  HK's  land,  labor  shortage. Lam  said  this  while  meeting  a  delegation  from  the  Chinese  Language  Press  Institute.
5  arrested  for  World  Cup  fakes. The  customs  department  launched  an  anti-infringement  operation  codenamed  "Goalkeeper"  on  April  30.
HK  'can  be  Bay  Area's  global  tourism  hub'. The  Belt  &  Road  International  Tourism  Forum  on  New  Business  Opportunities  was  held  in  Hong  Kong  on  Thursday.
Shares  sold  down  as  credit  costs  in  HK  rise. Disappointing  mainland  retail  sales  figures  aggravate  decline  in  Hong  Kong.

Swire  is  said  in  talks  to  sell  HK  towers  for  US$1.8b. Hong  Kong  commercial  real  estate  has  been  on  a  tear,  after  a  series  of  record-breaking  purchases  fueled  by  mainland  Chinese  and  domestic  investors.

Hong  Kong  follows  US  in  raising  base  rate. It's  only  a  "matter  of  time"  before  banks  raise  deposit  and  prime  rates,  HKMA's  chief  executive  Norman  Chan  told  reporters  at  a  press  conference.

Wang  praises  'positive'  changes  in  SAR. Liaison  chief  impressed  by  "refreshing,  healthy  and  united"  atmosphere  Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam's  administration  has  brought  to  city  over  the  past  year.

Liaison  chief  urges  society  to  work  for  brighter  future. Wang  Zhimin  stresses  importance  of  city's  prosperity,  nation's  rejuvenation  and  successful  implementation  of  'one  country,  two  systems'.

Govt  set  to  unveil  vacant  property  tax  plan. Apartments  left  empty  after  completion  despite  soaring  prices  could  be  subject  to  the  levy,  Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  told  the  LegCo  Wednesday.
LegCo  finishes  2nd  reading  of  XRL  co-location  bill. The  LegCo  is  expected  to  finish  the  three  readings  and  complete  the  local  legislation  of  the  co-location  bill  by  July.

Applications  open  for  Macao  vehicles  using  HKZM  Bridge. Each  of  the  600  permit  is  valid  for  one  year  and  offers  unlimited  access  to  use  the  HKZM  Bridge  to  travel  to  Hong  Kong  and  back.
HK  has  'critical  business-services  role'  in  B&R. Addressing  initiative's  needs  will  be  important  driver  for  city's  economy,  commerce  secretary  says.

HK  stocks  end  lower  as  investors  brace  for  Fed  decision. The  Hang  Seng  index  closed  down  1.2  percent  at  30,725.15,  while  the  China  Enterprises  Index  ended  down  1.4  percent  at  12,035.63  points.
CE  says  HK's  5G  plan  on  track. Carrie  Lam  has  rejected  claims  that  the  government's  plan  for  launching  5G  mobile  services  is  lagging  behind.

Jiangxi  Bank  draws  Citic,  Dianrong  to  US$993m  HK  IPO. The  company  is  offering  1.17  billion  shares  at  HK$5.94  to  HK$6.66  apiece,  according  to  a  Hong  Kong  stock  exchange  filing  Wednesday.
HK  scientists  urge  deeper  mainland  ties. Hong  Kong's  leading  scientists  said  cooperative  relationship  will  not  only  boost  innovation  but  also  improve  people's  livelihoods.

RMB  internationalization  'enters  new  phase'. HKEx  chief  Charles  Li  made  the  remarks  in  his  opening  speech  at  the  bourse's  5th  Annual  RMB  Fixed  Income  and  Currency  (FIC)  Conference  Tuesday.
First  Belt  and  Road  joint  conference  held  in  Beijing. The  first  Belt  and  Road  joint  conference  was  convened  in  Beijing  on  Tuesdsay.

HK  govt  sets  up  panel  to  probe  MTR  corner-cutting  scandal. Justice  Michael  John  Hartmann,  an  ex-non-permanent  judge  in  the  city's  Court  of  Final  Appeal,  will  serve  as  the  chair  with  a  report  expected  within  6  months.

Visionary  new  Machine  Intelligence  lab  launched. The  Chinese  University  of  Hong  Kong,  Shenzhen,  and  internet  giant  Tencent’s  AI  Lab  have  jointly  launched  a  laboratory  of  Machine  Intelligence.

Shanghai  surpasses  HK  as  costliest  location  for  expatriates  in  China. Hong  Kong  fell  from  second  to  11th  in  the  cost  of  living  rankings  due  to  a  depreciation  of  the  Hong  Kong  dollar,  an  ECA  International  survey  revealed.

HK  stocks  close  higher  after  Trump-Kim  historic  summit. The  Hang  Seng  index  closed  up  0.1  percent  at  31,103.06  points,  while  the  China  Enterprises  Index  ended  0.3  percent  higher  at  12,206.57  points.

No  politics  in  court  decisions,  says  CE  Lam. Courts  have  no  political  consideration  when  handing  down  decisions,  Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  said  before  the  Executive  Council  meeting.

Passionate  students  urged  to  retain  professional  polish. HKBU  teacher  points  out  many  technical  skills  may  soon  fall  by  the  wayside  but  journalists  will  always  need  basics  such  as  interview  techniques.

East  African  countries  eye  HK  as  gateway  to  SE  Asian  meat  market. IGAD  member  countries  said  HK's  meat  and  live  animal  market  could  help  to  ease  challenges  faced  while  exporting  to  the  Middle  East  and  North  Africa  region.

Radical  localist  leader  gets  6  years  for  Mong  Kok  riot. Edward  Leung  Tinkei,  27,  was  sentenced  to  six  years  in  prison,  while  his  co-defendent  Lo  Kin-man,  31,  received  seven  years  for  rioting.
Legal  heavyweights  welcome  'blow  to  violence'. Barristers  say  court  has  delivered  clear  message  on  using  unrest  to  achieve  political  goals.
Mong  Kok  riot  activist  gets  6  yrs  in  jail,  co-defendant  7  yrs. Judge  gives  lengthy  terms  to  Edward  Leung  and  co-defendants  for  'organized,  large-scale  and  serious'  riot.
Emirates  passengers  emphasize  in-flight  experience. Leading  hub  carrier  Emirates  Airline  looks  to  networking  and  in-flight  entertainment  to  boost  passenger  numbers.
HKMA  brings  ESG  principles  on  board  to  boost  long-term  returns. Sustainability  becomes  key  investment-decision  factor  as  green  bonds  draw  strong  interest  in  Hong  Kong.
Swire  to  pay  US$382m  to  buy  out  HK  aircraft  shares. Property-to-retail  conglomerate  Swire  Pacific  Ltd  will  pay  HK$72  a  share  for  stake  it  doesn’t  own.
Most  HK  tourists  budget  HK$50,000  for  trips. Travel  site  KAYAK  finds  8  percent  of  Hong  Kong’s  outbound  travelers  spend  about  HK$200,000  up  per  year  annually  on  trips.
Bank  of  Singapore  seeks  to  double  assets  in  region. OCBC's  private  arm  expands  Hong  Kong  office  in  a  bid  to  capture  rapidly  growing  wealth  stream.
HK  shares  inch  up  ahead  of  Trump-Kim  summit. The  Hang  Seng  index  rose  0.3  percent  to  31,063.70,  while  the  China  Enterprises  Index  gained  0.1  percent  to  12,172.03.

HK  holds  green  fair  in  support  of  World  Environment  Day. The  Environmental  Campaign  Committee  of  Hong  Kong  held  the  Zero  Waste  Fun  Fair  to  promote  the  message  of  "use  less  and  waste  less".

Meeting  to  map  out  HK's  strategies  for  B&R. The  HKSAR  has  been  actively  engaging  in  China's  deepening  opening-up  by  co-hosting  its  first  Belt  and  Road  joint  conference  in  Beijing.
Writer  Liu  Yichang  mourned. Liu  Yichang,  born  in  Shanghai  in  1918,      received  a  Life  Achievement  Award  from  the  Hong  Kong  Arts  Development  Council  in  2014.

HKSAR  unveils  its  international  e-sports  team. The  17-strong  team  aims  to  advance  to  the  East  Asia  regional  finals  and  set  foot  in  the  18th  Jakarta-Palembang  Asian  Games  in  August  this  year.

CBIRC,  SFC  to  boost  exchange  of  information. The  regulators  will  boost  the  exchange  of  information  in  connection  with  the  supervision  and  oversight  of  cross-boundary  regulated  entities.
Free  flow  of  resources  crucial  factor  for  Bay  Area. Panelists  have  urged  the  central  government  to  streamline  boundary  crossings  so  talents  can  move  easily.
HK  ‘has  pivotal  role  in  opening  up’. Hong  Kong’s  role  in  national  development  takes  on  a  new  significance  as  the  mainland  vowed  to  open  up  wider,  policymakers  said.
Rates,  trade  tensions  rattle  investors. Stock  benchmarks  sold  down  in  Hong  Kong  and  mainland  as  worries  over  credit  costs  and  fractious  G7  meeting  weigh  on  sentiment.
Something  on  the  other  side  of  the  coin. Piles  of  unused  coins  left  at  home  can  now  be  handled  by  sorting  machines.
Xiaomi  is  said  to  win  HK  stock  exchange  approval  for  IPO. The  company,  led  by  serial  entrepreneur  Lei  Jun,  has  been  considering  seeking  about  US$10  billion  from  the  IPO.

‘Uber  of  real  estate’  redefines  industry’s  culture. Property  owners  putting  up  their  homes  or  offices  for  sale  or  lease  may  now  rid  themselves  of  having  to  deal  with  a  horde  of  property  agents  in  what  could  be  an  annoying  process.

HK  hoists  typhoon  signal  no.  3  as  Ewiniar  edges  closer. The  observatory  said  it  would  take  into  account  the  variation  of  local  wind  strength  to  consider  changing  the  warning  signal  on  Friday.

Accountants  urge  city  to  diversify  into  its  Bay  Area  role. The  service  sector  accounts  for  90%  of  HK's  economy  and  should  be  expanded  into  the  Bay  Area  to  take  up  business  opportunities,  accountants  urged.
WeChat  Pay  finding  its  feet  in  HK. At  present,  WeChat  Pay's  key  drivers  in  the  mainland  –  e-commerce  and  red  packets  –  are  limited  in  Hong  Kong.

Hong  Kong  forex  reserves  down  in  May. The  city's  foreign  currency  reserve  assets  shrank  to  US$432.1  billion  as  at  the  end  of  May  from  US$434.5  billion  at  the  end  of  April,  according  to  the  HKMA.
Hong  Kong  stocks  rise  on  Thursday. The  Hang  Seng  index  rose  0.8  percent,  to  31,512.63,  while  the  China  Enterprises  Index  gained  1.0  percent,  to  12,407.80  points.
Shenzhen  launches  air  monitoring  system. The  average  density  of  PM2.5  in  Shenzhen  was  28  micro  grams  per  cubic  meter  last  year.  The  target  set  for  2018  is  26  micro  grams.

Journalism  school  fosters  the  art  of  change. Media  and  communication  education  in  university  is  all  about  continuity  and  adjustment  to  keep  up  with  the  rapidly  changing  media  environment.

MTR  admits  faulty  steel  bars  found  at  Hung  Hom. The  faults  were  spotted  before  the  bars  were  cemented  to  create  the  floor  one  level  beneath  the  platform  for  trains  going  to  Tuen  Mun  and  Ma  On  Shan.

Lawmakers  confident  co-location  bill  will  pass  in  June. HK's  pro-establishment  legislators  are  confident  they  will  overcome  the  opposition's  filibustering  tactics  and  pass  the  Express  Rail  Link  co-location  bill.
HK's  MTR  admits  faulty  steel  bars  found  at  Hung  Hom  station. The  city's  rail  operator  has  pledged  to  take  legal  action  if  enough  evidence  of  "corner-cutting"  is  found.

CE  calls  for  broad  consensus  on  land  supply. Carrie  Lam  has  called  on  the  city  to  be  more  open  to  different  land  supply  options  to  reach  a  broad  consensus  on  where  land  should  come  from.

Lam  urges  HK,  Bay  Area  cities  to  drive  fintech  forward. Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  made  the  remarks  at  the  Guangdong-Hong  Kong-Macao  Greater  Bay  Area  Fintech  Forum  on  Wednesday.

Shenzhen,  HK  urged  to  link  up,  spearhead  Bay  Area  development. Shenzhen  and  Hong  Kong  together  play  a  very  important  role  in  building  a  first-class  international  Bay  Area,  Shenzhen  officials  said.

Typhoon  Ewiniar  approaches  Hong  Kong. Typhoon  Ewiniar  was  about  400  km  away  from  the  special  administrative  region  as  of  Wednesday  afternoon,  bringing  heavy  rain  to  Hong  Kong.

Tencent  unveils  WeChat  'E-card'  for  Greater  Bay  Area. The  proposal  would  see  multiple  travel  documents  linked  to  WeChat  app  to  streamline  border  crossings,  according  to  Tencent  Holdings.
HK  stocks  up  fifth  straight  session. The  Hang  Seng  index  rose  0.5  percent,  to  31,259.10,  while  the  China  Enterprises  Index  gained  0.2  percent,  to  12,283.58  points.

Govt  mulls  relaxing  post-Fukushima  ban  on  Japan  food  imports. The  government  has  suggested  maintaining  the  ban  on  food  imports  from  Fukushima  but  relaxing  restrictions  on  those  from  four  nearby  prefectures.

Xiaomi  'adds  6  more  Chinese  banks'  to  arrange  mega  HK  IPO. Xiaomi  is  the  first  company  to  use  Hong  Kong's  new  rules  to  go  public,  filing  for  what  would  be  the  world's  largest  first-time  share  sale  since  2014.
Poll  shows  strong  support  for  XRL  co-location. Survey  also  reveals  most  respondents  consider  arrangement  the  'most  convenient  and  efficient  plan'.
Liaison  Office  emphasizes  Xi's  inno-tech  instructions. Officials  emphasized  urgency  and  importance  of  the  city's  transformation  into  an  innovation  hub.
Business  conditions  deteriorate  as  orders  dry  up. The  Nikkei  Hong  Kong  Purchasing  Manager’s  Index  (PMI)  fell  to  47.8  last  month  -  its  lowest  level  in  almost  two  years.
CE:  No  MTR  developments  for  public  housing. Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  said  the  government  is  "very  concerned"  about  the  surging  property  prices  in  Hong  Kong.
Swiss  exhibition  honors  98  HK  innovations. Hong  Kong  innovators  triumphed  with  100  awards  for  98  of  their  inventions  honored  at  an  innovation  exhibition  in  Switzerland.
Bay  Area  ‘ideal  launchpad  for  RMB  internationalization’. Business  leaders  share  their  views  at  the    2017  RMB  Business  Outstanding  Awards  on  Tuesday.

Observatory  issues  tropical  cyclone  signal  No.  1. ​The  Hong  Kong  Observatory  forecast  that  the  tropical  depression  will  maintain  a  distance  of  over  500  km  from  Hong  Kong  for  most  of  Tuesday.

Collaboration  with  HK  priority  to  Shenzhen. A  Hong  Kong  delegation  of  around  30  deputies  to  the  National  People’s  Congress  kicked  off  their  four-day  visit  to  the  Bay  Area  on  Monday.

HK  shares  rise,  aided  by  mainland  services  sector  survey. The  Hang  Seng  index  rose  0.3  percent,  to  31,093.45,  while  the  China  Enterprises  Index  gained  0.1  percent,  to  12,259.32  points.

HK  chefs  invited  to  Dublin  to  promote  Irish  food  in  China. Finalists  of  a  recently  held  EU-funded  culinary  competition  in  Hong  Kong  will  tour  Ireland  to  get  a  first-hand  impression  of  Irish  foods.
Leung,  Yau  jailed  for  storming  LegCo. Magistrate  imposes  custodial  sentence  as  'only  suitable  option',  describing  crime  as  serious  as  defendants  had  planned  for  conflict.
HK  govt  set  to  move  on  vacant  home  tax. As  property  prices  rise  further  beyond  the  reach  of  aspirant  homeowners,  legislators  told  9,000  new  units  stand  empty.

HKU  LED  lighting  technology  wins  top  award. Robust  street-lighting  system  jointly  developed  by  the  University  of  Hong  Kong  and  a  local  high-tech  firm  outlasts  existing  solutions.
Strong  US  close  inspires  rush  for  HK  stocks. The  benchmark  Hang  Seng  Index  rose  1.66  percent  on  strong  turnover  after  slew  of  positive  factors  turned  sentiment  bullish.
Various  HK  delegations  organized  to  embrace  Bay  Area. Over  30  Hong  Kong  deputies  to  the  National  People's  Congress  will  visit  five  Bay  Area  cities  in  the  latest  such  visit.
Chinese  equity  sell-off  revives  Hong  Kong's  big  arbitrage  trade. Valuations  are  typically  higher  on  the  mainland  because  of  inefficiencies  in  China's  restricted  A  share  market.

Youths'  education,  living  woes  being  addressed. The  HK  govt  has  taken  concrete  action  in  fulfilling  its  commitment  to  address  young  people's  concerns  in  education  and  homeownership.

Carrie  Lam  chairs  summit  on  quality  education. The  Chief  Executive  said  talent  was  the  most  important  element  in  Hong  Kong's  continued  development  and  education  was  the  key  to  nurturing  talent.
Mainland,  HK  to  enhance  anti-graft  cooperation. Yang  Xiaodu,  head  of  the  national  supervisory  commission,  met  with  Hong  Kong  ICAC  Commissioner  Simon  Peh  Yun-lu  on  Friday.

Hong  Kong  to  set  up  Bay  Area  development  office. The  LegCo  passed  on  Thursday  a  non-binding  motion  to  strengthen  cooperation  in  the  Guangdong-Hong  Kong-Macao  Greater  Bay  Area.
Groups  in  HK,  Chongqing  team  up  to  boost  education. A  HK  investment  company  and  its  mainland  counterpart  plan  to  cooperate  to  improve  schooling  in  smaller  cities.
Expert  assures  adequate  water  supply  in  HK. Concern  arises  as  the  city  saw  a  rainfall  of  only  one-fifth  of  the  average  at  57  millimeters  in  May.

Pioneer  unmanned  store  set  to  boost  ecommerce  in  HK. The  city  catches  up  with  the  mainland  in  retail  technology  as  it  launches  ‘robot’  outlet  with  no  tellers  and  RFID-based  checkout.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.08  pct  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  24.35  points,  or  0.08  percent,  to  30,492.91  points  on  Friday.
Works  at  Hung  Hom  MTR  station  inspected. The  Highways  Department  has  inspected  works  at  the  Hung  Hom  MTR  station  and  asked  MTR  to  submit  an  incident  report  within  a  week.

'Plugging'  HK  tech  startups  into  the  world. To  address  the  problem  of  many  startups  in  recruiting  tech  experts,  the  govt  will  also  introduce  fast-track  visas  for  inno-tech  talents  hired  by  local  companies.

10  Mong  Kok  rioters  sentenced  to  up  to  51  months  in  prison. Nine  defendants  received  prison  sentences  of  28  to  51  months,  and  a  teenager  who  was  17  years  old  at  the  time  will  be  sent  to  a  training  center.
HK  researchers  discover  actuating  material. A  novel  actuating  material  that  can  be  powered  by  visible  light  was  discovered  by  researchers  from  the  University  of  Hong  Kong.

HKSAR  govt  regrets  US  fugitive  claim. The  response  came  after  a  US  State  Department  report  suggests  HK's  Chief  Executive  was  not  responsible  for  refusing  an  extradition  request  by  the  US.
Commission  on  Children  formed. Chief  Secretary  Matthew  Cheung  said  the  commission,  which  will  start  operations  from  June  1,  will  listen  to  children's  views  and  be  transparent.
HK  home-price  rising  run  extends  to  25  months. Private-housing  price  index  in  Hong  Kong  sets  new  18-month  high  as  values  rise  13.9  percent  year  on  year.
Startups  set  to  chase  innovation  prizes  in  Qianhai  match. Competition  designed  to  nurture  technology  talent  expands  to  include  more  Guangdong  cities.
HKSAR  stocks  close  1.37%  higher. The  benchmark  Hang  Seng  Index  traded  between  30,148.43  and  30,533.58.
'Right  time'  for  national  security  legislation. City  'cannot  simply  ignore  parts  of  Basic  Law  it  does  not  like'.
Lai  backs  co-location  as  'only  way  forward'. Former  security  chief  demolishes  arguments  against  arrangement  for  joint  boundary  control.
Police  praised  for  holding  line  in  serious  disturbances. Former  security  secretary  Lai  Tung-kwok  looked  back  on  a  turbulent  time  for  the  city  and  its  disciplined  services.
Former  HK  official  enjoys  role  in  national  politics. Former  SAR  government  member  said  HK's  opinions  are  treated  with  great  respect  by  the  central  authorities.

Beijing  slams  US  report  on  HKSAR  affairs. A  spokesperson  said  the  principle  of  "one  country,  two  systems"  had  been  faithfully  enforced  since  Hong  Kong  returned  to  the  motherland.

HKMA  expects  virtual-bank  license  applications  by  August. More  than  50  firms,  ranging  from  regular  banks  to  pure  technology  plays,  have  expressed  interest  about  virtual  bank  license.
Hong  Kong  sees  hottest  May  in  134  years. Warning  for  very  hot  weather  remains  issued  since  May  18  —  the  longest  streak  of  the  warning  since  it  was  introduced  in  2000.

Advisers  urge  rapid  setting  up  of  financial  education  institute. The  Financial  Services  Development  Council  (FSDC)  is  working  on  a  proposal  to  establish  the  Asian  Institute  of  Finance.

Innovative  Israeli  firms  urged  to  set  up  in  mainland,  HK. A  forum  organized  by  the  Israel  Innovation  Authority  heard  that  the  Bay  Area  offers  fertile  environment  for  companies  from  the  startup  nation.

HK  developer  bets  US$1.7b  for  Hangzhou  land  in  record  bid. While  China  is  restricting  foreign  purchases  of  residential  properties,  high  prices  for  commercial  land  have  been  rare.
Italian  turmoil,  US  tariffs  drive  HK  stocks  down. The  benchmark  fell  below  the  key  30,000  level  during  morning  trade  as  instability  fears  weighed  on  investors’  minds.
HK  students  willing  to  work  on  mainland. SAR  government  programs  to  help  Hong  Kong's  young  people  strengthen  their  competitiveness.
HK's  MTR  offers  HK$500m  concession  after  fare  rise. The  new  promotion  package  includes  discount  for  passengers  using  trains  and  green  minibuses.

HK  tram  riders  will  have  to  pay  more. The  Executive  Council  on  Tuesday  gave  consent  to  Hong  Kong  Tramways  to  increase  fares  from  July  2  -  the  first  fare  increase  in  seven  years.
Hong  Kong  records  142  HIV  cases  in  Q1. Sexual  transmission  remains  the  major  mode  of  HIV  transmission  in  Hong  Kong.

2  men  arrested  over  smash-and-grab  raid  on  jewelry  shop. Two  robbers  smashed  the  display  of  a  jewelry  shop  in  Harbour  City  on  Wednesday  and  stole  diamond  jewelry  worth  HK$5  million.
Minibus  driver  arrested  after  crash  injures  14. The  accident  happened  Tuesday  morning  at  around  6  am,  when  a  19-seat  minibus  overturned  after  colliding  with  a  van.

Rising  affluent  seek  high  returns  to  build  funds  for  family. Many  individuals  in  "rising  affluent"  category  are  the  "sandwich  generation"  simultaneously  caring  for  children  and  aging  parents.

Investors  calm  as  key  firms  take  benchmark  down. The  Hang  Seng  index  ended  1  percent  lower  at  30,484.58,  while  the  China  Enterprises  Index  closed  1.29  percent  lower  at  11,959.08  points.

CE  Lam  says  government  to  monitor  XRL  tests. The  government  will  liaise  with  MTR  Corporation  over  the  testing  of  the  Hong  Kong  section  of  the  Guangzhou-Shenzhen-Hong  Kong  Express  Rail  Link.
Ground  breaks  for  HK  Palace  Museum. City  will  host  permanent  collection  of  imperial  treasure  from  Beijing.
Activist  given  4-month  jail  term  over  ICAC  leak. Conviction  ends  prospect  of  Avery  Ng  Man-yuen  as  a  lawmaker  candidate  since  he  will  be  barred  from  LegCo  for  five  years.
CityU  project  takes  gold  science  award. Innovative  technology  for  submersible  robots  makes  City  University  Hong  Kong's  sole  winner  of  top  national  science  prize.

HK  stocks  edge  up  on  positive  investor  sentiment. The  Hang  Seng  index  ended  0.7  percent  higher  at  30,792.26,  while  the  China  Enterprises  Index  closed  0.6  percent  higher  to  12,115.17  points.
Making  HK  economy  ‘cashless’  no  easy  task. The  city  has  a  suite  of  mature  payment  systems.  E-payment  evolution  here  will  be  very  different  from  that  on  the  mainland.
Will  HK  underperform  the  data  economy?. Hong  Kong's  rigid  legacy  system  of  banks,  credit  cards,  and  Octopus  stored  value  leaves  little  scope  for  mobile  payment  innovation.

Paul  Chan:  Xi's  order  affirms  SAR's  role  in  nation's  tech  push. The  president's  latest  directive  to  support  HK  has  affirmed  the  SAR's  role  in  the  nation's  sci-tech  development,  the  HKSAR's  financial  secretary  said.
FS  Chan  attends  big  data  expo  in  Guiyang. Financial  Secretary  Paul  Chan  Mo-po  attended  the  China  International  Big  Data  Industry  Expo  2018  in  Guiyang  on  May  27.

People's  Liberation  Army  brushes  up  'window  to  HK'  image. A  total  of  300  managerial-level  soldiers  and  grass-roots  cadres  from  the  People's  Liberation  Army  HK  Garrison  familiarize  themselves  with  the  army's  new  rules.

HK  supports  high-quality  economic  arrangements. Being  a  services-oriented  economy,  HK  welcomes  APEC's  progress  in  the  implementation  of  the  APEC  Services  Competitiveness  Roadmap,  said  Yau.

HK  youths  urged  to  seize  inno-tech  opportunities. Deputy  liaison  chief  tells  summer  interns  central  government  support  and  city's  innovation  drive  have  created  perfect  opportunity.

Edward  Yau  makes  trade  plea. A  Hong  Kong  commerce  and  economic  official  has  urged  Asia-Pacific
Economic  Cooperation  economies  to  support  the  multilateral  trading  system.
HK  shares  down  amid  DPRK,  trade  tensions. The  Hang  Seng  index  fell  0.6  percent,  to  30,588.04,  while  the  China  Enterprises  Index  lost  0.9  percent,  to  12,047.75  points.

Brand  micro-influencers  roar  off  to  a  heady  start. With  the  goal  of  revolutionizing  Hong  Kong’s  brand  market  industry,  a  local  startup  has  embarked  on  a  mission  which,  it  believes,  will  ultimately  change  the  way  brands,  advertisers  and  enterprises  promote  themselves.
Dual-class  shares  —  perils  lurking  beneath. ​Experts  call  for  tighter  control  over  listings  to  protect  investors  after  key  revamp.

Stakeholders  urge  national  backing  for  'high-quality'  Bay  Area. HK  has  'model  role'  in  region  which  accounts  for  12  percent  of  nation's  economy  despite  occupying  less  than  1  percent  of  area
New  history  curriculum  emphasizes  HK's  role  in  nation. Overhaul  marks  first  official  revision  of  curriculum  in  city's  secondary  schools  since  1997.
HK,  Finland  sign  pact  to  avoid  double  taxation. The  agreement  will  come  into  force  after  the  completion  of  ratification  procedures  on  both  sides.

Competitiveness:  Govt  pledges  support  as  HK  world  no.  2. Hong  Kong  was  ranked  second  globally  in  the  International  Institute  for  Management  Development's  World  Competitiveness  Yearbook  (WCY)  2018.
HKSAR  stocks  end  higher  on  services,  energy  firms. At  close  of  trade,  the  Hang  Seng  index  rose  0.3%  to  30,760.41  points.

HK,  Macao  experts  invited  to  evaluation  on  C919  aircraft. Civil  aviation  experts  from  Hong  Kong  and  Macao  have  been  invited  to  participate  in  the  operational  evaluation  of  C919  aircraft.
Proposal  on  unsold  unit  tax  needs  cautious  study. The  HKSAR  government  will  carefully  consider  the  proposal  to  impose  a  new  tax  on  unsold  private  residential  units.
Pricey  IPOs  weigh  on  HKEX. Investors  losing  interest  in  'hyped'  stocks  of  new  economy  companies.

Ex-minister:  HK  'vital  in  nation's  sci-tech  drive'. Former  science  minister  Wan  Gang  said  Hong  Kong's  talent  pool,  international  ties  give  it  a  key  role  in  creating  technology  superpower.
Bay  Area  cities  'should  team  up  to  go  green'. Authorities  urged  to  turn  cluster  into  a  world-class  low-carbon  economic  hub.

Overseas  buyers  set  to  chase  A-shares. Inclusion  in  the  Morgan  Stanley  Capital  International  benchmark  is  expected  to  draw  institutional  players  into  previously  retail-investor  dominated  market.

Having  fun  with  bun  in  Hong  Kong. Thousands  of  people  flocked  to  Cheung  Chau  island  in  Hong  Kong  to  celebrate  a  local  bun  festival  despite  recording-breaking  heat  on  Tuesday.

HKSAR  stocks  fall  most  in  7  weeks,  coal  miners  lead  losses. The  Hang  Seng  index  ended  down  1.8  percent  at  30,665.64,  while  the  China  Enterprises  Index  closed  2.1  percent  lower  at  12,090.79  points.

CE  Lam  says  govt  backs  lift  safety  support. The  Hong  Kong  Special  Administrative  Region  government  is  willing  to  offer
policy  and  financial  support  to  improve  lift  safety.
Hongkong  Post  to  issue    special  stamps. Hongkong  Post  announced  on  Wednesday  the  issue  of  a  set  of  special  stamps  on  the  theme  of  "Inclusive  Communication"  on  June  7.
Civil  servants  trained  on  national  Constitution. National  studies  guiding  scheme  to  concentrate  on  officers  who  deal  directly  with  cross-boundary  counterparts.

HK:  Business,  academics,  govt  team  up  to  drive  AI  development. Hong  Kong  Artificial  Intelligence  Laboratory  accelerator  program  will  nurture  two  sets  of  10  entrepreneurial  startups  each  year.

HK  universities  urged  to  play  bigger  role  in  Bay  Area. Delegates  at  the  region's  first  education  forum  encourage  SAR  institutions  to  overcome  space  woes  by  setting  up  satellite  campuses.
HK  students  nail  diplomatic  colors  to  mast. Contest  to  enhance  knowledge  on  international  relations  draws  record  20,000  entrants  from  125  schools.

Sources:  UBS  seeks  to  pare  back  18-month  IPO  suspension. Swiss  group  UBS  is  in  talks  with  the  Securities  and  Futures  Commission  in  a  bid  to  reduce  penalty  imposed  over  deficiencies  in  sponsorship  work.

HK-bound  ANA  flight  evacuated  in  Japan  after  smoke  fills  cabin. Japan's  transport  ministry  said  investigators  found  an  oil  leak  in  the  auxiliary  engine  at  the  rear  of  the  plane  and  smoke  was  flowing  from  there.

Hong  Kong  stocks  rise  as  US-China  trade  war  fears  ease. The  Hang  Seng  index  rose  0.6  percent,  to  31,234.35,  while  the  China  Enterprises  Index  was  unchanged  at  12,349.61  points.
Economists  propose  development  index  for  Bay  Area. Shenzhen's  former  vice-mayor  indicates  need  to  evaluate  and  analyze  development  as  city  cluster  advances.

AR  book  a  new  guide  to  Hong  Kong. HKSAR  tourism  officials  are  tapping  into  the  application  of  augmented  reality  technology  to  attract  young  people  from  the  mainland  to  visit  the  city.

HK  papermaking  company  to  construct  plant  in  Myanmar. The  chairman  of  Lee  &  Man  Paper  Manufacturing  Limited  said  waste  from  the  production  plant  will  be  used  to  generate  electricity  for  the  plant  itself.

HK  must  'take  a  leaf'  from  mainland's  tech  feats. Financial  Secretary  Paul  Chan  Mo-po  said  HK  has  many  qualities  in  promoting  the  inno-tech  sector,  including  outstanding  talents.
37  schools  commended  for  meritorious  green  projects. The  awards  were  organized  under  the  Leisure  and  Cultural  Services  Department's  Greening  School  Subsidy  Scheme.
HKU  confers  honorary  degree  on  Jack  Ma. The  University  of  Hong  Kong  conferred  honorary  degrees  on  three  outstanding  individuals,  including  Alibaba  Group  Chairman  Jack  Ma  Yun.

High-profile  localist  politician  found  guilty  of  rioting. The  High  Court  has  found  localist  politician  Edward  Leung  guilty  of  rioting,  which  carries  a  maximum  sentence  of  10  years’  imprisonment.
Bay  Area  authorities  urged  to  share  traffic  data. Infrastructure  consultant  points  out  traffic  congestion  problem  affects  all  cities  within  region.

Lam  urges  Bay  Area  cities  to  actively  collaborate. The  Chief  Executive  emphasizes  importance  of  complementary  development,  rather  than  one  city  seeking  role  as  nucleus  of  region.
HKMA  spends  HK$13.03b  in  a  week  to  defend  HK  dollar. The  Hong  Kong  Monetary  Authority  has  spent  HK$13  billion  this  week  to  keep  the  currency  within  its  permitted  range.

Jiangxi  seeks  to  link  with  HK  in  B&R  push. Jiangxi,  a  fast-growing  Chinese  mainland  province  northeast  of  Hong  Kong,  is  seeking  to  link  up  with  the  city  in  order  to  tap  into  the  Belt  and  Road  Initiative.

Research  policy  overhaul  ‘boosts  prospects  for  city,  nation’. A  leading  Chinese  medicine  researcher  sees  synergies  in  HK’s  global  reach  complementing  the  mainland’s  natural  resources  and  talent  pool.

Hang  Seng  to  launch  Greater  Bay  Area-related  composite  index. The  index  will  have  250  constituent  firms  and  the  index  universe  includes  Stock  Connect  eligible  HK-listed  stocks  and  specific  mainland-listed  A-shares.
Hong  Kong  SAR  stocks  rise  on  Friday. The  Hang  Seng  index  rose  0.3  percent  to  31,047.91,  while  the  China  Enterprises  Index  gained  0.6  percent  to  12,355.13.
B&R  project  brings  sight  to  Cambodian  cataract  patients. People-to-people  bond  efforts  bear  fruit  as  HK,  Guangxi  doctors  begin  blindness  eradication  campaign.

Lam:  Bay  Area's  fortunes  depend  on  innovation,  connection. Success  for  the  Bay  Area  project  will  depend  on  innovation  and  connection,  Carrie  Lam  said  when  meeting  Guangdong  Party  chief  Li  Xi.

Home,  office  decor  at  your  fingertips  with  AR. Augmented  reality  seems  to  have  emerged  as  the  silver  bullet  when  it  comes  to  decorating  a  home  or  office.  Startup  Pixofy  has  come  up  with  a  cellphone  app  that  applies  AR  to  online  furniture  shopping  to  help  users  choose  products  that  would  fit  their  surroundings.
Smaller  banks  vulnerable  when  loans  sour. ‘Big  Five’  lenders  see  NPLs  on  the  mend  amid  economic  growth;  while  those  of  smaller  players  on  the  rise.

HK  unemployment  falls  to  2.8%,  lowest  in  over  20  years. Secretary  for  Labour  and  Welfare  Law  Chi-kwong  said  the  labor  market  tightened  further  on  the  back  of  robust  economic  conditions.

HK  spends  US$1.2b  defending  currency  overnight. Hong  Kong’s  de  facto  central  bank  intervened  to  defend  its  currency  peg  Thursday  as  the  city’s  dollar  fell  to  the  weak  end  of  its  trading  band.

National  funds  bonanza  ‘drawcard  for  research  talent’. A  steel  expert  has  welcomed  President  Xi’s  technology  initiative  as  critical  in  supporting  long-term  scientific  projects  in  the  SAR.

​Govt  support  ‘boosts  entrepreneurial  ecosystem’. Support  from  the  central  government  and  HKSAR  government  has  improved  the  city’s  entrepreneurial  environment,  said  the  city's  innovation  chief.
Union  Medical  leaps  61%  after  announcing  Tencent  tie-up. HK  healthcare  service  provider  teams  up  with  Tencent  Doctorwork,  planning  to  open  20  clinics  within  3  years.

Drones:  HK  to  refine  regulation  as  complaints  double  in  2  years. In  April,  the  Civil  Aviation  Department  launched  a  three-month  public  consultation  on  six  key  proposals  regarding  the  unmanned  aircraft  system  regulatory  regime.
HKSAR's  Hang  Seng  falls  on  Thursday;  Tencent  gains. ​Hong  Kong's  benchmark  stock  index  fell  on  Thursday,  despite  a  jump  in  index  heavyweight  Tencent  Holdings.

Funding  scheme  hailed  a  'big  push'  for  scientific  research. Chinese  President  Xi  Jinping's  move  to  grant  HK  researchers  national  science  funding  is  a  "big  push"  for  scientific  research  in  the  city.

HK  could  lead  'going  global'  drive  for  traditional  medicine. Greater  cooperation  in  science  and  technology  between  the  mainland  and  Hong  Kong  could  help  the  city  blaze  a  trail  in  the  drive  to  take  traditional  Chinese  medicine  global.
Govt  offices  urged  to  boost  sci-tech  bonds  with  SAR. Liaison  chief  pledged  support  for  HK's  goal  to  become  an  innovation  and  technology  hub.

Cheng  outlines  cross-border  commercial  dispute  resolution. Secretary  for  Justice  Teresa  Cheng  Yeuk-wah  outlined  new  trends  in  handling  cross-border  commercial  disputes  resolution  on  Wednesday  in  Hong  Kong.

Lam  sees  Bay  Area  cities  taking  HK  research  to  market. CE  hopes  neighbors  in  region  will  play  complementary  role  by  developing  and  promoting  innovative  products  based  on  SAR's  fundamental  studies
Leung  upbeat  on  further  reform  boosting  HK. Former  CE  still  amazed  by  transformation  four  decades  of  opening-up  has  brought  city  and  country

Jiangxi  association  launched  to  boost  ties. A  group  of  leading  Hong  Kong-based  Jiangxi  families  seeks  to  foster  links  between  city  and  province  which  date  back  to  Song  Dynasty.

HK's  property  market  blows  past  another  record. Sun  Hung  Kai  beat  out  bidders  including  units  from  Henderson  Land  Development  Co.,  paying  US$3.2b  of  a  coveted  plot  near  Kai  Tai  airport.

NDRC:  China  to  unveil  Bay  Area  development  plan  soon. According  to  government  work  report,  China  will  promote  mutually  beneficial  cooperation  between  the  mainland,  Hong  Kong,  and  Macao  in  all  areas.

HK  shares  barely  changed  amid  DPRK,  trade  worries. The  Hang  Seng  index  ended  0.1  percent  down  at  31,110.20,  while  the  China  Enterprises  Index  was  unchanged  at  12,440.12  points.

HKMA  intervenes  to  defend  peg  again  as  HK  dollar  weakens. The  purchases  may  further  drive  up  interbank  rates,  after  the  three-month  borrowing  cost  reached  its  highest  level  since  2008.

Deeper  Jiangxi-HK  tourism  ties  will  enhance  mutual  benefits. As  part  of  the  Jiangxi-HK  Economic  and  Trade  Cooperation  Conference,  a  series  of  events  will  be  launched  to  promote  investment  opportunities  in  Jiangxi.

Ganjiang  River  New  Area  sets  sight  on  green  development. The  Ganjiang  River  New  Area  in  Jiangxi  province  is  exploring  a  unique  path  of  green  development  in  which  innovation  comes  first.

Complementary  research  speeds  up  cross-boundary  integration. A  HK  academician  hoped  closer  collaboration  with  mainland  scientists  could  give  HK  the  chance  to  take  a  leading  role  in  some  research  projects.

Jiangxi-HK  trade  fair  keeps  getting  bigger. In  its  17th  edition,  the  Jiangxi-HK  Economic  and  Trade  Cooperation  Conference  brings  over  500  projects,    attracting  HK  and  Shenzhen  investors.
Financial  Secretary  Chan  visits  Hangzhou. Financial  Secretary  Paul  Chan  Mo-po  visited  Hangzhou,  meeting  local  officials  and  Hong  Kong  people  doing  business  in  Zhejiang.
Collaboration  ‘enhances  both  sides’  strengths’. Ex-CUHK  head  says  HK  has  solid  international  exposure,  while  mainland  researchers  have  access  to  a  much  larger  pool.
Lam  vows  to  'spare  no  effort'  in  inno-tech  drive. Xi's  backing  for  city's  bid  to  become  global  technology  hub  draws  strong  commitment  from  HK  administration.
HK  scientists  brought  into  national  decision-making. New  collaboration  and  funding  policies  expected  to  let  city  to  stand  taller  on  global  stage.

Seminar  discusses  HK's  pivotal  role  in  building  sustainable  B&R. The  seminar  was  designed  to  raise  awareness  and  promote  participation  of  Hong  Kong  banks  in  Belt  and  Road  projects,  organizers  said.

Liaison  Office  vows  to  boost  HK-mainland  sci-tech  collaboration. Tan  Tieniu,  deputy  director  of  the  central  government's  Liaison  Office  in  Hong  Kong,  made  the  pledge  at  a  forum  on  IT  cooperation  in  the  SAR  on  Tuesday.

Volatile  markets  crimp  HK  Exchange  Fund  performance. Quarterly  returns  of  Hong  Kong’s  Exchange  Fund  is  down  60  percent  with  earnings  from  Hong  Kong  equities  plummeting  88  percent.
Lam  welcomes  strong  support  for  HK  sci-tech  talents. President  Xi  Jinping  said  he  supports  Hong  Kong  becoming  an  international  center  for  innovative  science  and  technology.
HKSAR  stocks  end  lower  on  Tuesday. The  Hang  Seng  index  ended  1.2  percent  down  at  31,152.03,  while  the  China  Enterprises  Index  closed  down  0.8  percent  at  12,440.75  points.
China  cancer  drug  developer  3D  Med  is  said  to  plan  HK  IPO. 3D  Medicines  Corp  is  planning  a  Hong  Kong  initial  public  offering  that  could  seek  as  much  as  US$500  million.

China  Tower  files  for  HK  IPO,  may  raise  US$10b. ​China  Tower  Corp,  the  wireless  infrastructure  operator,  filed  for  an  initial  public  offering  in  HK  that  could  match  the  city's  biggest  since  2010.

E-commerce  transformation  set  to  hit  HK  shops. About  72  percent  of  retailers  and  90  percent  of  landlords  in  the  city  expect  online  sales  to  expand  over  the  next  five  years,  a  survey  showed.
Xi:  HK  vital  for  national  sci-tech  development. President  Xi  also  encouraged  HK's  scientific  community  to  contribute  to  building  a  strong  country  of  science  and  technology.
HK  students  win  medals  in  physics. Hong  Kong  students  have  won  one  gold  medal,  one  silver  medal  and  three  bronze  medals  at  the  19th  Asian  Physics  Olympiad.

Hong  Kong-mainland  formula  for  science  superpower. Researchers  are  optimistic  about  rapid  progress  after  President  Xi  Jinping's  call  for  closer  collaboration  and  development  of  innovation  center.

Xi  backs  HK  to  contribute  to  national  sci-tech  development. Xi  Jinping  has  urged  enhanced  cooperation  in  science  and  technology  between  the  Hong  Kong  Special  Administrative  Region  and  the  mainland.

Bay  Area  cultural  links  promoted. ​Cross-border  cultural  ties  will  open  a  bigger  market  for  HK  and  Macao  culture-related  businesses  and  help  ease  disharmony  in  HK,  officials  said.
Beyond  Ventures,  Linear  Capital  back  firewatch  startup. Venture  capitalists  put  US$9m  into  Insight  Robotics  to  extend  forestry,  national  park  surveillance  technology.

OKEx  CEO  quits  just  as  crypto  exchange  becomes  world's  biggest. OKEx  has  been  climbing  in  the  global  ranking  over  the  past  few  weeks,  recently  overtaking  Binance  as  the  biggest  by  turnover.

Ho:  Tech  innovations  'enhance  travelers'  experiences'. Industry  leader  tells  Wang  Yuke  that  trip  planning  on  mobile  devices  gives  tourists  more  control  over  their  trips  and  can  help  avoid  congestion,  delays.
HK,  Sichuan  anticipate  'new  era'  of  regional  cooperation. HKSAR  Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  said  two  areas  are  also  strongly  interested  in  working  together  on  youth  issues.
Carrie  Lam  to  visit  bay  area  cities. Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  will  visit  Huizhou  and  Guangzhou  on  May  16  and  17.

Carrie  Lam  attends  earthquake  memorial  in  Sichuan. Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  attended  a  ceremony  to  commemorate  the  10th  anniversary  of  the  Wenchuan  earthquake  in  Sichuan  on  Saturday.
Carrie  Lam  visits  Chengdu  university. The  HKSAR  Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  visited  the  University  of  Electronic  Science  and  Technology  of  China  in  Chengdu  on  Saturday.
HK,  Sichuan  formalize  cooperation  mechanism. Agreement  culminates  10  years  of  collaboration  which  began  abruptly  after  the  Wenchuan  earthquake  in  2008.

HK  economy  shows  fastest  growth  in  7  years. The  4.7-percent  expansion  in  the  first-quarter  exceeds  official  estimates  and  marks  the  sixth  consecutive  quarter  above  the  city’s  10-year  average.
Hong  Kong  police  defuse  wartime  bomb. Explosive  Ordnance  Disposal  officers  defused  the  device  —  a  US-made  explosive  weighing  about  450  kg  —  after  20  hours  of    operation.
Central  leaders  urge  recognition  of  SARs'  input  in  joint  projects. HK,  Macao  affairs  director  emphasizes  livelihood  betterment  as  key  goal  in  planning  two  cities'  development
'One  country,  two  systems'  proves  its  worth  with  ties. Liaison  chief  emphasizes  how  synergy  between  two  different  systems  contributes  to  development  of  entire  country.
HK,  Sichuan  put  cooperation  spotlight  on  I&T. Carrie  Lam  announces  joint  funding  mechanism  with  science  ministry,  city  and  province  to  support  innovative  R&D.

2  HK  localist  ex-lawmakers  guilty  of  unlawful  assembly. Ousted  lawmakers  Sixtus  Leung  Chung-hang,  Yau  Wai-ching  and  three  of  their  assistants  stormed  a  Legislative  Council  meeting  in  2016.

First  Hong  Kong-Sichuan  cooperation  conference  held. The  two  sides  have  reached  a  consensus  on  11  cooperation  areas,  including  the  Belt  and  Road  Initiative  and  youth  development.

HK  investors  park  money  down  in  the  lot. Over  the  past  15  months,  two  thirds  of  parking  spaces  fetched  more  than  HK$1  million,  while  one  in  five  cost  more  than  HK$2  million.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  1.02%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  312.84  points,  or  1.02  percent,  to  31,122.06  points  on  Friday.

Suspected  WWII  bomb  unearthed  in  downtown  HK. This  is  the  third  time  within  half  a  year  that  an  explosive  device  was  found  at  the  same  location,  where  construction  work  of  a  railway  link  is  in  progress.

HK  top  tycoon  Li  Ka-shing  ends  CK  chairmanship  on  high  note. The  veteran  businessman  has  expressed  confidence  in  his  successor,  son  Victor  Li,  and  assured  shareholders  of  a  smooth  transition.

Wang  urges  innovative  promotion  of  'one  country,  two  systems'. Officials  urged  to  step  up  efforts  to  deliver  on  the  president's  and  the  central  government's  support  and  care  for  city.
Hollywood  collections  auctioneer  makes  Asia  debut  in  HK. Items  on  display  include  a  Charlie  Chaplin  suit  and  a  famous  hat  worn  by  Marilyn  Monroe.
LegCo  passes  budget  bill. Financial  Secretary  Paul  Chan  said  the  government  will  implement  its  Budget  initiatives  as  soon  as  possible  to  benefit  the  community.
HKMA  targets  fresh  issuers  with  bond  subsidies. The  authority  hoped  the  scheme  to  cut  costs  will  draw  in  new  players,  increasing  market  liquidity  and  diversity.

Xiongan  to  host  next  cashierless  fresh  food  market. The  store  updates  the  retail  experience  by  adding  digital  price  tags  that  can  provide  updated  price  discounts  in  real  time.

HK  stocks  rise  as  mainland  producer  inflation  picks  up. The  Hang  Seng  index  rose  0.9  percent  to  30,809.22,  while  the  China  Enterprises  Index  gained  0.4  percent  to  12,233.96  points.
Healthcare  next  in  line  for  tech  transformation. Having  a  lead  in  communications,  fintech,  mainland  tech  titans  set  sights  on  medical  breakthroughs.

Separatists  'should  be  barred  from  district  polls'. Legal  experts  urge  candidates  for  local  elections  to  respect  HK's  constitutional  arrangements  as  they  intend  to  work  in  the  city's  political  institutions.
Entrepreneur  Day  focuses  on  Bay  Area  opportunities. Event  launches  youth  competition  geared  toward  boosting  startups  by  helping  them  find  openings  in  region.

IMF  raises  2018  GDP  growth  forecast  for  Asia,  HK. According  to  a  report,  the  International  Monetary  Fund  raised  its  forecast  for  Asia's  economic  growth  to  5.6%,  and  that  for  HK  to  3.6%.
HK  stocks  gain  as  investors  discount  Iran  fallout. Solid  performance  by  market  operator  HKEx  underpins  prices,  taking  rising  run  into  third  day.

Secretary  for  Justice  Teresa  Cheng  to  visit  Beijing. Secretary  for  Justice  Teresa  Cheng  Yeuk-wah  will  visit  Beijing  to  promote  Hong  Kong's  strengths  as  a  legal  and  dispute  resolution  services  center.
HK  launches  fast-track  scheme  to  attract  tech  talents. Visa  processing  time  cut  to  two  weeks  for  employees  in  seven  key  fields,  including  biotechnology  and  AI.
Stakeholders  welcome  scheme  to  lure  global  inno-tech  talent. Science  Parks  head  praises  arrangement  for  removing  uncertainty  over  recruitment  prospects.

CE  hopes  XRL  bill  will  be  passed  by  end-June. The  Guangzhou-Shenzhen-Hong  Kong  Express  Rail  Link  (Co-location)  Bill  will  go  back  to  the  LegCo  for  a  second  reading  on  June  6.

HK  steps  up  efforts  to  snatch  I&T  talents  with  fast-track  scheme. The  Hong  Kong  government  will  shorten  the  time  taken  to  process  work  visas  for  innovation  and  technology  talents  to  two  weeks.
Hong  Kong  commemorates  late  premier  Zhou  Enlai. An  exhibition  highlighting  late  premier  Zhou  Enlai’s  life  was  launched  on  Wednesday.
HKSAR  stocks  end  higher. The  Hang  Seng  index  ended  1.4  percent  higher  at  30,402.81,  while  the  China  Enterprises  Index  closed  up  1.5  percent  at  12,144.79  points.

Cathay  Pacific  adopts  new  hybrid  cloud  technology. With  its  new  IT  architecture,  Cathay  Pacific  is  able  to  bring  new  services  more  efficiently  to  meet  evolving  application  requirements.
Leung  gives  stinging  rebuke  for  legislators. LegCo  president  condemns  unruly  lawmakers  who  resisted  expulsion  from  chamber,  pointing  out  conduct  endangered  security  officers.
Accounting  professionals  recognize  HK's  role  in  B&R. Accountants  living  in  Hong  Kong  and  abroad  are  upbeat  about  the  city’s  future  role  in  the  Belt  and  Road  Initiative.
Dual-class  shares  eligible  for  broad  HSCI. Inclusion  in  most  expansive  benchmark  qualifies  'weighted  voting'  firms  for  purchase  by  mainland  investors.

Tickets  to  all  XRL  destinations  'available  in  HK  terminus'. MTR  itself  can  sell  tickets  just  for  18  direct  routes,  but  transport  bureau  assures  public  every  destination  is  catered  for.
Leading  Manhattan  redevelopment  courts  HK  buyers. One  Wall  Street  developer  makes  city  first  stop  while  marketing  566-unit  office  tower  conversion  to  international  investors.

CE  approves  Laura  Cha's  appointment  as  HKEx  chief. Laura  Cha  has  been  appointed  as  HKEx’s  chairman  for  the  next  two  years  –  coinciding  with  the  remainder  of  her  term  as  a  director.

HK  stocks  rise  ahead  of  a  slew  of  mainland  economic  data. The  Hang  Seng  index  rose  0.2  percent,  to  29,994.26  points,  while  the  China  Enterprises  Index  gained  0.6  percent,  to  11,966.41  points.

HK  international  medical  fair  highlights  innovative  tech. In  its  ninth  edition,  this  year's  Hong  Kong  International  Medical  Devices  and  Supplies  Fair  featured  280  exhibitors  from  13  countries  and  regions.

Four  charges  could  cost  Hui  LegCo  seat. Opposition  lawmaker  and  district  councilor  Hui  Chi-fung  could  face  the  risk  of  being  stripped  of  his  titles  after  being  arrested  on  four  charges.
Cheung:  HK  youth  should  seek  career  development  in  Bay  Area. Matthew  Cheung  says  the  SAR  government  intends  to  strengthen  promotion  of  the  GBA  on  all  fronts.

CE  Carrie  Lam  to  visit  Sichuan  this  week. Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  Cheng  Yuet-ngor  of  the  Hong  Kong  Special  Administrative  Region  will  visit  Sichuan  province  later  this  week.
Financial  Secretary  Chan  meets  ADB  president. Hong  Kong's  Financial  Secretary  Paul  Chan  Mo-po  met  Asian  Development  Bank  President  Takehiko  Nakao  in  Manila  on  Saturday.
Advanced  satellite  launched  for  HK  firm. The  launch  marked  the  273rd  flight  of  the  Long  March  rocket  family.

Lawmakers  condemn  Hui's  'insincere'  apology. Legislator  who  grappled  with  female  official  to  seize  device  continues  to  claim  authorities  'violate  members'  privacy  by  tracking  movements'.
Lenovo  dropped  from  Hang  Seng  Index. The  Beijing-based  company  will  be  replaced  by  CSPC  Pharmaceutical  Group,  as  part  of  Hang  Seng  Indexes  Co’s  quarterly  review.

BNP  banks  on  HK-mainland  fund  flows  to  fuel  growth. The  French  investment  bank  is  bullish  on  supporting  any  cross-border  flows  as  China's  opening  up  and  linkage  schemes  with  HK  bring  fresh  opportunities.

HSI  hits  month-low  on  trade-talks  worries. The  Hang  Seng  index  fell  1.28  percent,  to  29,926.5.  Heavily  subscribed  tech  debutant  Good  Doctor  disappointed  investors,  closing  in  line  with  IPO  price.

Lok  Ma  Chau  Loop  envisioned  as  next  Silicon  Valley. Chief  Secretary  for  Administration  Matthew  Cheung  said  the  government  would  inject  HK$10  billion  to  support  local  technology  application  research.
SAR  to  ‘take  a  hit’  in  US-China  trade  crossfire. Full-blown  trade  war  may  slash  as  much  as  0.8  of  a  percentage  point  off  city’s  growth  next  year,  commentator  warns.
Lawmakers  must  safeguard  'one  country,  two  systems':  CE. Carrie  Lam  stresses  legislators  need  to  stand  firm,  protect  national  sovereignty  and  security.

Xiaomi  files  in  HK  for  world's  biggest  IPO  since  2014. Xiaomi  is  looking  to  raise  at  least  US$10  billion,  people  with  knowledge  of  the  matter  have  said,  and  could  value  the  business  as  high  as  US$100  billion.

HK  govt  mulls  introducing  vacant  property  tax. Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  Cheng  Yuet-ngor  said  the  vacancy  tax  will  help  release  residential  units  into  the  market  to  increase  supply.

Govt  keeps  close  watch  on  Sino-US  trade  talks. ​Hong  Kong's  treasury  chief  is  seeking  to  assess  the  impact  of  measures  taken  by  the  economic  superpowers  and  safeguard  the  city’s  interests.

HK  youth  upbeat  about  working  in  Bay  Area. But  the  survey  also  found  that  many  youngsters  are  hesitant  about  engaging  with  the  region  as  they  are  unsure  about  opportunities  available.

Sentiment  fatigue  stunts  HK  stocks. The  prospect  of  further  interest-rate  gains  and  fears  over  trade  talks  have  kept  investors  on  sidelines.  The  Hang  Seng  was  down  1.34%  on  Thursday.

What  could  end  HK  property  boom?  Here  are  some  triggers. A  higher  prime  rate,  which  sets  the  upper  limits  on  mortgages,  could  damp  surging  housing  prices  in  the  world's  least-affordable  real  estate  market.

Nine  guilty  of  rioting  in  2016  HK  disturbance. Magistrate  postpones  sentencing  until  May  23  to  allow  time  to  get  reports  from  the  training  center,  detention  center  and  local  community  service  authorities.
Tax  revenue  up  13%. The  Inland  Revenue  Department  collected  HK$328.6  billion  in  tax  revenue  for  2017-18,  with  the  increase  mainly  from  stamp  duty  receipts.
Stock  connects  quota  expansion  gets  slow  start. The  new  daily  trading  quota  of  the  two  equity  market  trading  links  between  Hong  Kong  and  mainland  took  effect  on  Wednesday.

Reclamation  wins  strong  support  among  land-supply  options. A  survey  by  Our  Hong  Kong  Foundation  has  revealed  generation  gap  in  views,  with  most  young  respondents  opposing  to  land  reclamation.
Shop  tills  jangle  as  mainland  visitors  pour  in. The  Labor  Day  weekend  saw  599,000  mainland  visitors  flock  to  Hong  Kong,  the  highest  recorded  in  the  past  three  years.

HK  shares  fall  ahead  of  Sino-US  trade  talks,  Fed  policy  statement. The  Hang  Seng  index  fell  0.3  percent  to  30,723.88,  while  the  China  Enterprises  Index  lost  1.1  percent  to  12,193.59  points.

Recruitment  for  mainland  astronaut  summer  camp  begins. Thirty  students  selected  from  local  secondary  schools  will  undergo  training  and  meet  aerospace  experts  and  astronauts  during  the  event.
Lam  praises  impartial  media  for  role  in  Hong  Kong. China  Daily  takes  lead  among  print  titles,  scooping  up  14  prizes  in  annual  Hong  Kong  News  Awards.

HK  scrambles  for  talent  in  battle  for  Nasdaq's  biotech. Just  3%  of  all  HK-listed  stocks,  by  capitalization,  come  from  so-called  "new  economy"  sectors  compared  with  60%  for  Nasdaq  and  47%  for  NYSE.
HKMA  set  to  launch  green  bonds. Move  by  city's  de  facto  central-bank  should  emphasize  official  commitment  to  eco-friendly  securities  market  and  draw  in  further  issuers.
Tourism  operators  see  rich  prospects  off  beaten  track. Less-known  destinations  can  offer  culturally  more  authentic  experiences,  industry  experts  said.
HK  encouraged  to  join  in  development  plans. Secretary  for  Justice  Teresa  Cheng  Yeuk-wah  made  the  statement  on  Sunday  after  her  duty  visit  to  Beijing.

CE  opens  district  promenade. Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  Cheng  Yuet-ngor  opened  the  Central  &
Western  District  Promenade  -  the  Western  Wholesale  Food  Market  Section.

Liaison  Office  hosts  open  days,  forges  closer  ties  with  community. Selected  areas  below  the  10th  floor,  including  the  lobby,  meeting  rooms,  a  staff  canteen  and  activities  rooms,  will  be  opened  to  the  public  this  weekend.
NPC  delegation  leader  'inspired'  by  meeting  and  future. NPC  deputies  had  the  chance  to  vote  on  motions  concerning  revisions  to  the  Constitution.
HK,  Sichuan  to  launch  cooperation  framework. ​The  HKSAR  and  Sichuan  province  are  setting  up  a  close  cooperation  framework  and  will  have  their  first  summit  meeting  next  month.
National  Anthem  Law  'aims  to  foster  respect'. NPC  deputy  Ma  says  legislation  is  necessary  and  not  to  punish  people  but  to  encourage  self-discipline.
FTU  urged  to  boost  Bay  Area  integration. Liaison  office  chief  praises  trade  union  body's  pioneering  role  as  a  bridge  between  city  and  mainland.

Laureate  gives  nod  to  opening-up. Nobel  laureate  Mo  Yan  said  China’s  reform  and  opening-up  helped  his  writing  talents  flourish  and  carved  out  a  path  to  a  vibrant  era  in  literature.

HK  stocks  track  Asian  markets  higher,  led  by  IT,  energy  sectors. The  Hang  Seng  index  ended  0.9  percent  higher  at  30,280.67,  while  the  China  Enterprises  Index  closed  1  percent  higher  at  12,066.58  points.

Offshore  bonds  —  the  answer  to  cash  crunch. Cash-strapped  enterprises  on  the  Chinese  mainland,  cornered  by  a  liquidity  squeeze  that  has  seen  borrowing  costs  spiraling  upward,  are  turning  to  offshore  bond  markets  to  beat  the  crunch.
Bond  moves  boost  HK’s  hub  credentials. Pundits  hail  city’s  measures  to  spur  bond  market  as    the  right  step  for  a  comprehensive  financial  center.
Political  academy  puts  spotlight  on  ethics. Noting  a  deteriorating  political  climate,  patron  Ronny  Tong  says  city  needs  to  cultivate  good  leaders.

Phone-snatching  lawmaker  faces  'most  serious  penalty'. Legislature's  commission  imposes  sternest  measures  for  'shaming  LegCo'  after  legislator  takes  cellphone  from  female  security  officer.
Govt  seeks  public  views  on  land  supply. The  Task  Force  on  Land  Supply  has  launched  a  five-month  public  consultation  on  18  options  to  boost  land  supply.
HKEx  appoints  Laura  Cha  to  chair. Attracting  listings  and  cooperation  with  mainland  bourses  are  the  key  goals  for  the  first  woman  to  head  the  exchange  operator’s  board.

HKU  scientists  invent  drug  for  HIV-1  prevention. BiIA-SG  will  hopefully  be  the  first  "made  in  Hong  Kong"  anti-HIV-1  antibody  drug  for  clinical  development,  the  HKU  research  team  said.

Liaison  Office  to  host  first  open  day. The  Liaison  Office  will  host  its  first  open-days  event  on  Saturday  and  Sunday,  welcoming  about  1,500  visitors  to  its  headquarters  in  Sai  Wan.
Former  CE  urges  businesses  to  look  to  Gansu. Leung  Chun-ying  was  speaking  at    a  Gansu  investment  promotion  conference  in  Hong  Kong.
HK  stocks  fall  amid  US  probe  of  Huawei. The  Hang  Seng  index  fell  1.1  percent  to  30,007.68,  while  the  China  Enterprises  Index  lost  1.2  percent,  to  11,949.38.
Celebrating  20th  Anniversary  of  HKJC  Scholarships. ​The  Hong  Kong  Jockey  Club  highlights  its  wide-ranging  support  for  talent  development.

HK  media  group  visits  Sichuan. A  Hong  Kong  media  group  is  on  a  five-day  visit  to  Sichuan  province  to  mark  the  10th  anniversary  of  the  magnitude-8.0  Wenchuan  earthquake,  which  struck  the  province  on  May  12,  2008.
HK  exchange  overhaul  days  away. Analysts  suppose  the  market  changes  not  in  conflict  with  mainland's  CDR  role.
CE  Carrie  Lam  visits  Indonesia. Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  Cheng  Yuet-ngor  visited  Indonesia  to  enhance  Hong  Kong's  collaboration  with  Indonesia  as  well  as  the  ASEAN.

Crypto  billionaire  sued  in  HK  after  funding  deal  goes  awry. Court  filings  shed  light  on  how  big-name  venture  capital  firms  have  valued  the  world's  largest  cryptocurrency  exchange,  Binance.

Goldman,  BlackRock  fight  to  protect  LGBT  employees  in  HK. Fifteen  financial  institutions  are  supporting  a  British  woman  who  sued  after  being  denied  a  visa  as  a  dependent  of  her  same-sex  civil  partner.
HK  stocks  follow  Asia,  Wall  Street  lower. The  Hang  Seng  index  fell  1.0  percent  to  30,328.15,  while  the  China  Enterprises  Index  lost  1.2  percent,  at  12,094.32.

Bay  Area  to  establish  intellectual  property  protection  mechanism. The  mechanism  aims  to  enhance  protection  level  and  application  capacity  on  intellectual  property  in  the  Guangdong-HK-Macao  Bay  Area.
HK  listing  revamp  set  to  draw  'dozens'  of  companies. Three  new  types  of  enterprises  will  qualify  to  be  listed  on  the  city's  bourse.
New  SARs  affairs  chief  meets  Macao  officials. Coordination  group  head  Han  commends  Fernando  Choi  for  work  on  long-term  development

HK  approves  dual-class  shares,  paving  way  for  tech  titans. The  payoff  for  HKEx  could  come  very  soon  as  companies  including  Xiaomi  and  Ant  Financial  are  among  tech  giants  preparing  to  go  public.
HK  students  make  debut  bid  for  English-speaking  prize. The  SAR  competitors  made  their  first  appearance  at  national  contest’s  finale  in  Hangzhou  earlier  this  month.
HK  stocks  close  1.26%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  381.84  points,  or  1.26  percent,  to  30,636.24  points  on  Tuesday.

HK  takes  key  role  at  world  equine  summit. The  summit  was  expected  to  level  up  the  mainland's  equine  industry  with  the  active  participation  of  Hong  Kong  -  the  world's  leading  player  in  this  area.

Legislators  urged  to  work  pragmatically,  efficiently. The  central  government's  top  liaison  official  in  HK  said  the  council  helps  the  govt  promote  policies  favorable  to  economic  and  livelihood  developments.
Discover  latest  trends  at  Global  Sources. Cutting  edge  developments  in  sportswear  fabrics  and  technology  wear,  plus  much  more,  on  display  at  expo  for  fashion  buyers.
'One-party  rule'  a  non-issue,  explains  Wang. Wang  points  out  a  call  for  end  to  such  governance  makes  no  sense  since  system  does  not  apply  in  country.
LegCo  'vital  in  promoting  patriotism'  in  Hong  Kong. Central  govt  liaison  chief  says  legislators  are  key  elements  in  city's  establishment  and  governance  system.

Sichuan  University  set  to  launch  world’s  top  rescue  team. Equipment  miniaturization  key  in  creating  emergency  medical  team  that  can  fly  to  any  disaster  scene  worldwide  within  72  hours.
Moody's  expects  home-sales  growth  to  cool  in  HK. The  global  ratings  agency  believes  that  Hong  Kong's  stable  economy  and  its  tight  supply  will  ensure  price  increases  continue.
IPO  could  bring  Good  Doctor  as  much  as  HK$8.77b. Medical  app's  listing  ushers  in  expected  rush  of  new-economy  launches  as  authorities  set  to  announce  rule  overhaul.

HK  shares  end  lower,  led  by  tech  stocks  over  trade  spat  worries. The  Hang  Seng  index  ended  0.5  percent  lower  at  30,254.40,  while  the  China  Enterprises  Index  closed  0.5  percent  lower  at  12,000.16  points.

Constitution  'guarantees  'one  country,  two  systems''. The  deputy  director  of  the  Liaison  Office  of  the  Central  People's  Government  in  the  HKSAR  said  HK  people  should  have  an  understanding  of  the  system.
Qiao:  'HK  independence'  harms  'one  country,  two  systems'. Former  chief  of  12th  NPC  Law  Committee  warns  'HK  independence'  backers  hurt  nation's  feelings.

Guangdong  urges  closer  SAR  ties. Intensifying  ties  with  the  HK  and  Macao  SARs  will  be  the  major  focus,  and  form  a  vital  part  in  pressing  ahead  with  the  country's  reform  and  opening-up.

2018  World  Book  Day  Fest  opens  with  joy  and  fun. Hong  Kong  Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  gave  away  some  130  books  chosen  from  her  personal  collection  to  participants  to  share  with  them  the  joy  of  reading.
Foreign  govts  urged  not  to  interfere  in  HK  affairs. The  HKSAR  government  made  the  statement  in  response  to  media  inquiries  about  comments  in  a  US  human  rights  report.

Dongguan  neutron  facility  to  drive  innovation  in  Bay  Area. A  delegation  of  Hong  Kong  govt  officials  and  lawmakers  visited  a  spallation  neutron  source  facility  in  Dongguan  on  Saturday.

Qiao:  HK  independence  harms  'one  country,  two  systems'. Former  head  of  the  Law  Committee  of  the  nation's  top  legislature  stressed  that  advocating  HK  independence  is  never  an  issue  of  freedom  of  expression.

Details  for  Caring  scheme  to  be  announced  by  year-end. The  Caring  and  Sharing  Scheme  will  be  open  for  applications  from  Feb  1  next  year  at  the  earliest,  the  government  said.
Qiao:  Constitution  root  and  origin  of  Basic  Law. Former  head  of  NPC  Law  Committee  advises  HK  people  to  get  a  better  understanding  of  the  national  Constitution.
Jiangsu  gets  to  shine  at  event  in  HK. Lam  said  she  hoped  the  events  will  help  Hong  Kong  people  acquire  a  better  understanding  of  the  unique  culture  of  Jiangsu.

HK  firms  set  to  gain  from  opening-up. The  Hong  Kong  Chamber  of  Commerce  in  China  will  sign  an  agreement  with  the  Silk  Road  Cities  Alliance  to  co-host  a  Belt  and  Road  forum.

HKEx  to  accept  dual-class  IPO  listing  applications  from  April  30. Rules  allowing  companies  with  weighted  voting  rights  to  go  public  in  Hong  Kong  will  take  effect  within  two  weeks,  Charles  Li,  CEO  of  the  HKEx,  said  Friday.
HK,  Shenzhen  set  for  a  closer  partnership. Both  sides  agree  to  more  cooperation  on  innovation  and  technology,  medical  services  and  education.
Digital  transformation  'will  contribute  billions  to  HK  GDP'. A  study  by  Microsoft  and  research  firm  IDC  also  notes  80%  of  organizations  in  the  city  are  already  embracing  it.

Seminar  explains  constitutional  law  to  civil  servants. Qiao  Xiaoyang,  chairman  of  the  Law  Committee  of  the  12th  NPC,  talked  about  the  history  of  constitutional  law  and  its  importance  to  HK  at  the  seminar.

HK  launches  low  carbon  living  calculator. The  low  carbon  living  calculator  aims  to  help  the  public  assess  their  individual  carbon  emissions  and  turn  to  a  more  environment-friendly  lifestyle.

Hong  Kong  stocks  end  lower  on  slump  in  energy  shares. The  Hang  Seng  index  ended  down  0.9  percent  at  30,418.33,  while  the  China  Enterprises  Index  closed  1.5  percent  down  at  12,054.23  points.

New  economy  enterprises  primed  for  a  big  showing. They  are  expected  to  join  the  ranks  of  the  "Hong  Kong  Top  100  Stocks"  as  the  city's  bourse  is  sparing  no  efforts  in  luring  new  industries  to  its  fold.

Lawmakers  kick  off  first  duty  visit  to  Bay  Area. Lawmakers  from  four  panel  committees  kicked  off  a  three-day  duty  visit  to  the  Guangdong-Hong  Kong-Macao  Greater  Bay  Area  on  Friday.

Hong  Kong  skies  get  clean  report  card. Human  resources  consultancy  ECA  International  ranked  HK  as  the  28th  most  livable  city  in  Asia  for  expats,  out  of  more  than  480  locations,  in  March.

Next  time,  you  won't  be  just  staring  at  empty  machines. HK  startup  Gritus  provides  machines  which  can  warn  companies  that  supplies  have  run  out,  or  are  fast  running  out,  so  that  they  can  be  quickly  restocked.
The  'new  economy'  takes  the  floor. Asia's  leading  stock  exchanges  swing  into  top  gear  with  groundbreaking  listing  overhauls  to  lure  tech  enterprises.
Liaison  chief  urges  team  effort  to  boost  Bay  Area. Regional  project  key  platform  in  drive  to  integrate  city's  development  into  that  of  country.

Education,  public-service  sectors  next  fronts  for  VR. Veteran  VR  developers  share  their  insights  on  the  technology's  rapid  development  at  a  computer-altered-reality  ecosystem  summit  during  the  Global  Sources  exhibition.
Study  shows  HK  people  spending  more  time  e-reading. Survey  also  finds  that  reading  e-books  is  still  not  popular  in  city.

Finance  chief  cautions  borrowers  as  HKMA  shores  up  dollar. HKMA's  move  to  spend  HK$51.3  billion  to  defend  the  local  currency  helped  drive  the  city's  three-month  interbank  rate  to  its  highest  level  in  almost  a  decade.

New  economy  enterprises  primed  for  a  big  showing. At  the  2017  Hong  Kong  Top  100  Stocks  Awards  ceremony  on  Thursday,  some  of  the  biggest  names  in  the  banking  and  energy  sectors  grabbed  top  honors.

Energy  shares  lead  HK  stocks  to  end  higher  on  firm  oil  prices. The  Hang  Seng  index  ended  1.4  percent  higher  at  30,708.44  points,  while  the  China  Enterprises  Index  closed  up  2.1  percent  at  12,239.84  points.

Govt  to  regulate  sales  calls. Secretary  for  Commerce  and  Economic  Development  Edward  Yau  said  a  public  consultation  had  found  people  support  the  regulation  of  telemarketing  calls.

IPO  in  HK:  Bezos-backed  cancer  startup  'to  seek  to  raise  US$1b'. Cancer-detection  startup  Grail  Inc  is  planning  an  initial  public  offering  in  Hong  Kong  this  year,  people  with  knowledge  of  the  matter  have  said.
LegCo  committee  set  to  wrap  up  co-location  bill. Bills  Committee  head  Ip  hopes  proposed  law  will  stay  on  track  and  allow  for  XRL  launch  in  September

China  Daily  reporter  wins  award  for  property  story. Evelyn  Yu  has  received  the  Silver  Award  for  Best  Property  Market  News  Reporting  for  2017  initiated  by  Hang  Seng  Management  College.
